entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 11} to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. {@h}16 ({@damage 2d10 + 5}) bludgeoning damage plus 9 ({@damage 2d8}) necrotic damage. The target must succeed on a {@dc 19} Strength saving throw or be pushed up to 15 feet away from the bone lord.

action.name: Fling
entries: One Medium or smaller object held or creature {@condition grappled} by the bone lord is thrown up to 60 feet in a random direction and knocked {@condition prone}. If a thrown target strikes a solid surface, the target takes 3 ({@damage 1d6}) bludgeoning damage for every 10 feet it was thrown. If the target is thrown at another creature, that creature must succeed on a {@dc 19} Dexterity saving throw or take the same damage and be knocked {@condition prone}.

action.name: Servants of Death
entries: The bone lord magically calls {@dice 3d6} skeletons or zombies, {@dice 2d4} ghouls, or 2 wights. The called creatures arrive in {@dice 1d4} rounds, acting as allies of the bone lord and obeying its spoken commands. The Undead remain for 1 hour, until the bone lord dies, or until the bone lord dismisses them as a bonus action. The bone lord can have any number of Undead under its control at one time, provided the combined total CR of the Undead is no higher than 8.

action.name: Pattern of Death {@recharge 6}
entries: Necrotic energy ripples out from the bone lord. Each creature that isn't a Construct or Undead within 30 feet of the bone lord must make a {@dc 19} Constitution saving throw, taking 54 ({@damage 12d8}) necrotic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. Each friendly Undead within 30 feet of the bone lord, including the bone lord, regains hp equal to half the single highest amount of necrotic damage dealt.

legendaryHeader: The bone lord can take 3 legendary actions, choosing from the options below. Only one legendary action option can be used at a time and only at the end of another creature's turn. The bone lord regains spent legendary actions at the start of their turn.

legendary.name: Sovereign's Onslaught
entries: The bone lord commands up to four friendly Undead it can see within 60 feet of it to move. Each target can use its reaction to immediately move up to its speed. This movement doesn't provoke {@action opportunity attack||opportunity attacks}.

legendary.name: Sovereign's Reprisal
entries: The bone lord commands one friendly Undead within 30 feet of it to attack. The target can make one weapon attack as a reaction.

legendary.name: Call Servants (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The bone lord uses Servants of Death.

legendary.name: Fling (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The bone lord uses Fling.

trait.name: Colony Cluster
entries: The brain coral consists of a Huge central spire and three Small clusters. Each cluster acts on the brain coral's turn and shares its movement, allowing the central spire and the clusters to swim a total of 120 feet on the brain coral's turn. A cluster can't move further than 120 feet away from the central spire. A cluster more than 120 feet away from its central spire for more than 24 hours enters a dormant state, becoming a new brain coral after 30 days.

A brain coral and its clusters share hp, and damage dealt to a cluster or the central spire reduces that shared total. If more than one section of the brain coral is included in a damaging spell or effect, such as a Dragon's breath weapon or the {@spell lightning bolt} spell, the brain coral makes one saving throw and takes damage as if only one of its sections was affected. Whenever the brain coral takes 15 damage or more in a single turn, one of its clusters is destroyed.

At the end of its turn, if the brain coral took damage on the previous turn, it can expel one new cluster from the central spire for every 15 damage it took. The brain coral can't have more than five clusters active at one time.

trait.name: Water Breathing
entries: The brain coral can breathe only underwater.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The brain coral makes one Pseudopod attack from its central spire and one additional Pseudopod attack for each cluster it has. These additional Pseudopod attacks can originate from the central spire or from any cluster, provided the target is within reach of the attack's origin.

action.name: Pseudopod
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d8 + 3}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Reef Poison Spray {@recharge 5}
entries: The brain coral expels a cloud of poison. Each creature within 15 feet of the brain coral's central spire must make a {@dc 15} Intelligence saving throw. On a failure, a creature takes 21 ({@damage 6d6}) poison damage and is {@condition incapacitated} until the end of its next turn. On a success, a creature takes half the damage and isn't {@condition incapacitated}.

action.name: Beasts of the Sea (1/Day)
entries: The brain coral magically calls {@dice 2d4} giant crabs, 2 giant sea horses or reef sharks, or 1 swarm of quippers, provided the brain coral is underwater. The called creatures arrive in {@dice 1d4} rounds, acting as allies of the brain coral and obeying its telepathic commands. The Beasts remain for 1 hour, until the brain coral dies, or until the brain coral dismisses them as a bonus action.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The brownie has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Speak with Beasts
entries: The brownie can communicate with Beasts as if they shared a language.

action.name: Branch Spear
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 2d4 + 5}) piercing damage.

action.name: Domestic Magic
entries: The brownie can cast the {@spell mending} and {@spell prestidigitation} cantrips at will, requiring no material components and using Wisdom as the spellcasting ability.

action.name: Invisibility
entries: The brownie magically turns {@condition invisible} until it attacks or uses Domestic Magic, or until its concentration ends (as if concentrating on a spell). Any equipment the brownie wears or carries is {@condition invisible} with it.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The brownie has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Mounted Warrior
entries: While mounted, the brownie's mount can't be {@condition charmed} or {@condition frightened}.

trait.name: Speak with Beasts
entries: The brownie can communicate with Beasts as if they shared a language.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The brownie makes two Branch Spear attacks, or it makes one Branch Spear attack and its mount makes one melee weapon attack.

action.name: Branch Spear
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 2d4 + 5}) piercing damage.

action.name: Domestic Magic
entries: The brownie can cast the {@spell mending} and {@spell prestidigitation} cantrips at will, requiring no material components and using Wisdom as the spellcasting ability.

action.name: Invisibility
entries: The brownie magically turns {@condition invisible} until it attacks, uses Domestic Magic, or Beasts of the Forest, or until its concentration ends (as if concentrating on a spell). Any equipment the brownie wears or carries is {@condition invisible} with it.

action.name: Beasts of the Forest (1/Day)
entries: The brownie magically calls {@dice 2d4} hawks or ravens, or it calls 1 black bear or wolf. The called creatures arrive in {@dice 1d4} rounds, acting as allies of the brownie and obeying its spoken commands. The Beasts remain for 1 hour, until the brownie dies, or until the brownie dismisses them as a bonus action.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The brownie has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Speak with Beasts
entries: The brownie can communicate with Beasts as if they shared a language.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The brownie mystic makes three Mystic Staff or Magical Blast attacks. The mystic can replace one of the attacks with a use of Spellcasting.

action.name: Mystic Staff
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d4 + 5}) bludgeoning damage plus 3 ({@damage 1d6}) psychic damage.

action.name: Mystic Blast
entries: {@atk rs} {@hit 6} to hit, ranged 60 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 2d6 + 3}) psychic damage.

action.name: Invisibility
entries: The brownie magically turns {@condition invisible} until it attacks or uses Spellcasting, or until its concentration ends (as if concentrating on a spell). Any equipment the brownie wears or carries is {@condition invisible} with it.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The brownie casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Wisdom as the spellcasting ability (spell save {@dc 13}):

trait.name: Snow Stride
entries: A brumalek can burrow through nonmagical snow and earth. While doing so, it doesn't disturb the material it moves through. In addition, difficult terrain composed of snow doesn't cost it extra movement.

action.name: Headbutt
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Reverberating Howl
entries: The brumalek releases an ear-shattering howl in a 30-foot cone that is audible 300 feet away. Each creature in that cone must make a {@dc 13} Dexterity saving throw. On a failure, a creature takes 5 ({@damage 2d4}) thunder damage and is {@condition deafened} for 1 minute. On a success, the creature takes half the damage and isn't {@condition deafened}. A {@condition deafened} creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

bonus.name: Skittish
entries: The brumalek can take the {@action Dash} or {@action Disengage} action.

trait.name: Firesight
entries: The caldera kite can see through areas obscured by fire, smoke, and fog without penalty.

trait.name: Flyby
entries: The caldera kite doesn't provoke {@action opportunity attack||opportunity attacks} when it flies out of an enemy's reach.

trait.name: Sulfuric Haze
entries: A glittering haze emanates from the caldera kite within 10 feet of it. The haze moves with the caldera kite, lightly obscuring the area. If dispersed by a wind of moderate or greater speed (at least 10 miles per hour), the haze reappears at the start of the caldera kite's next turn. When a creature enters the haze's area for the first time on a turn or starts its turn there, that creature must make a {@dc 14} Constitution saving throw. On a failure, a creature takes 7 ({@damage 2d6}) poison damage and is {@condition poisoned} until the end of its next turn. On a success, a creature takes half the damage and isn't {@condition poisoned}. If a creature's saving throw is successful, it is immune to the Sulphuric Haze of all caldera kites for 1 minute.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The caldera kite makes two Wings attacks or one Wings attack and one Proboscis attack.

action.name: Proboscis
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 2d6 + 4}) piercing damage. The target is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 17}) if it is a Medium or smaller creature and the caldera kite doesn't have another creature {@condition grappled}. Until this grapple ends, the creature is {@condition restrained}, the caldera kite can automatically hit the target with its Proboscis, and the caldera kite can't make Proboscis attacks against other targets.

action.name: Wings
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 2d6 + 4}) slashing damage and 7 ({@damage 2d6}) poison damage.

action.name: Dust Cloud {@recharge 4}
entries: The caldera kite thrashes its body and releases stored toxic gases. Each creature within 20 feet of the caldera kite must make a {@dc 14} Constitution saving throw, taking 28 ({@damage 8d6}) poison damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. A creature that fails the saving throw can't speak and is {@quickref suffocating||2} until it is no longer within 20 feet of the caldera kite.

trait.name: Hold Breath
entries: The capybear can hold its breath for 30 minutes.

trait.name: Keen Smell
entries: The capybear has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on smell.

trait.name: Pack Tactics
entries: The capybear has advantage on attack rolls against a creature if at least one of the capybear's allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally isn't {@condition incapacitated}.

trait.name: Pounce
entries: If the capybear moves at least 20 feet straight toward a creature and then hits it with a Slam attack on the same turn, that target must succeed on a {@dc 13} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}. If the target is {@condition prone}, the capybear can make one Bite attack against it as a bonus action.

trait.name: Swamp Camouflage
entries: The capybear has advantage on Dexterity ({@skill Stealth}) checks made to hide in swamps or muddy terrain.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 2d6 + 2}) piercing damage.

action.name: Slam
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 2d4 + 2}) bludgeoning damage.

reaction.name: Protect the Community
entries: When another capybear within 5 feet of this capybear is hit by an attack, this capybear can leap in the way, becoming the new target of the attack.

trait.name: Calming Presence
entries: A creature that enters a space within 5 feet of the caretaker weevil or that starts its turn there must succeed on a {@dc 13} Charisma saving throw or be indifferent to all creatures that it is hostile toward while it remains within 60 feet of the weevil. This indifference ends if the creature is attacked or harmed by a spell or if it witnesses any of its allies being harmed.

trait.name: Diligent Preservation
entries: A creature that isn't a Construct or Undead and that starts its turn with 0 hp within 60 feet of the caretaker weevil becomes stable. In addition, any corpse within 60 feet of the weevil is protected from decay and can't become Undead while it remains within 60 feet of the weevil and for 24 hours after it leaves the area.

action.name: Mandibles
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 3} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 2d8 + 1}) slashing damage.

action.name: Glue Glob
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 3} to hit, range 30/60 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 2d6}) acid damage. The target must make a {@dc 13} Dexterity saving throw. On a failure, it is {@condition restrained} for 1 minute. On a success, its speed is halved for 1 minute. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

action.name: Regenerative Spittle (3/Day)
entries: The caretaker weevil launches spittle at one creature it can see within 10 feet of it. The target regains 2 ({@damage 1d4}) hp. For 1 minute, the target regains 1 hp at the start of each of its turns.

trait.name: Well-Grounded
entries: The catamount has advantage on ability checks and saving throws made against effects that would knock it {@condition prone}.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The catamount makes one Bite attack and two Claw attacks.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d8 + 4}) piercing damage.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 2d4 + 4}) slashing damage.

bonus.name: Control Earth
entries: The catamount molds the ground near it, causing one of the following effects:

items.name: Stone Wall.
items.entry: The catamount causes a wall of rock to rise from the ground at a point it can see within 30 feet of it. The wall is up to 30 feet long, 5 feet high, and 5 feet thick. It can be any shape, as long as its base is connected to the ground. If the wall cuts through a creature's space when it appears, the creature is pushed to one side (the catamount's choice). If a creature would be surrounded on all sides by the wall, it can make a {@dc 14} Dexterity saving throw. On a success, it can use its reaction to move up to its speed so that it is no longer enclosed by the wall. The wall lasts 1 minute or until the catamount creates a new wall.

items.name: Fissure.
items.entry: The catamount causes a rift to form in the ground at a point it can see within 30 feet of it. The rift can be up to 15 feet wide, up to 30 feet long and up to 10 feet deep, and it can be any shape. Each creature standing on a spot where the fissure opens must succeed on a {@dc 14} Dexterity saving throw or fall in. A creature that successfully saves moves with the fissure's edge as it opens. A fissure that opens beneath a structure causes it to automatically collapse as if the structure was in the area of an {@spell earthquake} spell. The catamount can have only one fissure open at a time. If it opens another, the previous fissure closes, shunting all creatures inside it to the surface.

items.name: Tremors.
items.entry: The catamount causes the earth beneath its feet to shake and shift. Each creature within 30 feet of the catamount must succeed on a {@dc 14} Strength saving throw or take 3 ({@damage 1d6}) bludgeoning damage and be knocked {@condition prone}.

trait.name: Pierce the Veil
entries: When a creature the catonoctrix can see is {@condition stunned} by Mind Ravage, the catonoctrix learns one secret the creature knows.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The catonoctrix makes one Bite attack and two Claw attacks, or it makes three Psychic Bolt attacks. It can replace one attack with a use of Spellcasting.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}18 ({@damage 3d8 + 5}) piercing damage plus 7 ({@damage 2d6}) psychic damage.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}15 ({@damage 3d6 + 5}) slashing damage.

action.name: Psychic Bolt
entries: {@atk rs} {@hit 8} to hit, range 60 ft., one target. {@h}18 ({@damage 4d6 + 4}) psychic damage.

action.name: Mind Ravage {@recharge 5}
entries: The catonoctrix unleashes a torrent of psychic energy. Each creature within 20 feet of the catonoctrix must make a {@dc 16} Intelligence saving throw. On a failure, a creature takes 45 ({@damage 10d8}) psychic damage and is {@condition stunned} for 1 minute. On a success, a creature takes half the damage and isn't {@condition stunned}. A {@condition stunned} creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

reaction.name: Precognitive Dodge
entries: The catonoctrix adds 4 to its AC against one attack that would hit it. To do so, the catonoctrix must see the attacker and be within 30 feet of it.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting (Psionics)
headerEntries: The catonoctrix casts one of the following spells, requiring no spell components and using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save {@dc 15}):

trait.name: Rubbery Flesh
entries: The catterball is immune to any spell or effect that would alter its form, and it has advantage on ability checks and saving throws made to escape a grapple. In addition, it can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide without squeezing.

trait.name: Standing Leap (Ball Form Only)
entries: The catterball's long jump is up to 60 feet and its high jump is up to 30 feet, with or without a running start.

action.name: Snap Back (Extended Form Only)
entries: The catterball violently returns to its true form. Each creature within 5 feet of the catterball must make a {@dc 12} Dexterity saving throw. On a failure, a creature takes 4 ({@damage 1d8}) thunder damage, or 9 ({@damage 2d8}) if the catterball has extended its reach to 15 feet, and is {@condition deafened} for 1 minute. On a success, a creature takes half the damage and isn't {@condition deafened}. A {@condition deafened} creature can make a {@dc 12} Constitution saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

bonus.name: Change Form
entries: The catterball can extend its body, roll up into a ball, or return to its true form. Each time it extends its body, its reach with its slam attack increases by 5 feet, to a maximum of 15 feet, and its Armor Class decreases by 1.

variant.name: Catterball Familiars
entries: Some catterballs are willing to serve spellcasters, especially those who enjoy mayhem. Such catterballs have the following trait.

entries.name: Familiar
entries: The catterball can serve another creature as a familiar, forming a magic, telepathic bond with that willing companion. While the two are bonded, the companion can sense what the catterball senses as long as they are within 1 mile of each other. While the catterball is within 10 feet of its companion, the companion increases its reach by 5 feet. At any time and for any reason, the catterball can end its service as a familiar, ending the telepathic bond.

items.name: Familiar
entries: The catterball can serve another creature as a familiar, forming a magic, telepathic bond with that willing companion. While the two are bonded, the companion can sense what the catterball senses as long as they are within 1 mile of each other. While the catterball is within 10 feet of its companion, the companion increases its reach by 5 feet. At any time and for any reason, the catterball can end its service as a familiar, ending the telepathic bond.

trait.name: Adhesive (Object or Terrain Form Only)
entries: The mimic adheres to anything that touches it. A creature adhered to the cave mimic is also {@condition grappled} by it (escape {@dc 15}). Ability checks made to escape this grapple have disadvantage. It can choose for a creature to not be affected by this trait.

trait.name: False Appearance (Object or Terrain Form Only)
entries: While the mimic remains motionless, it is indistinguishable from an ordinary object or terrain feature.

trait.name: Grappler
entries: The mimic has advantage on attack rolls against any creature {@condition grappled} by it.

trait.name: Object Mimicry (Object or Terrain Form Only)
entries: The mimic can shape minor pseudopods into Medium or smaller objects. A creature that sees such an object can tell it is an imitation with a successful {@dc 15} Wisdom ({@skill Insight}) check. A creature with at least half its body in contact with the object, such as sitting on an imitation chair, is subjected to the mimic's Adhesive trait.

trait.name: Stretched Form (Terrain Form Only)
entries: The mimic can occupy another creature's space and vice versa.

trait.name: Tunneler
entries: The cave mimic can burrow through solid rock at half its burrow speed and leaves a 15-foot-diameter tunnel in its wake.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The cave mimic makes four Pseudopod attacks.

action.name: Pseudopod
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 1d10 + 5}) bludgeoning damage. If the cave mimic is in object or terrain form, the target is subjected to the mimic's Adhesive trait.

action.name: Stalagteeth (Terrain Form Only) {@recharge 4}
entries: The cave mimic launches a harpoon-like pseudopod, shaped like a stalactite or other similarly pointed object, at one creature in its space. The target must succeed on a {@dc 14} Dexterity saving throw or take 24 ({@damage 7d6}) piercing damage and have the harpoon pseudopod stuck in it. While the pseudopod is stuck, the target is {@condition restrained} and takes 10 ({@damage 3d6}) acid damage at the start of each of its turns, and the mimic can use a bonus action to pull the target up to 30 feet toward the mimic's nearest wall, ceiling, or similar surface. A creature, including the target, can take its action to detach the harpoon pseudopod by succeeding on a {@dc 15} Strength check. If the target detaches the harpoon while it is stuck to the ceiling of the mimic, the target takes falling damage as normal.

bonus.name: Change Shape
entries: The cave mimic transforms into a Gargantuan object or stretches itself out as terrain no larger than a 35-foot cube or back into its true, amorphous form. Its statistics are the same in each form. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying isn't transformed. It reverts to its true form if it dies.

resist.note: from nonmagical attacks not made with adamantine weapons

trait.name: Deathlights
entries: When a creature that can see the cave sovereign's glowing antennae starts its turn within 30 feet of the cave sovereign, the cave sovereign can force it to make a {@dc 18} Wisdom saving throw if the cave sovereign isn't {@condition incapacitated} and can see the creature. If the saving throw fails by 5 or more, the creature is {@condition stunned} until the start of its next turn. Otherwise, a creature that fails the save is {@condition incapacitated} and its speed is reduced to 0 until the start of its next turn as it remains transfixed in place by the lights.

Unless surprised, a creature can avert its eyes to avoid the saving throw at the start of its turn. If the creature does so, it can't see the cave sovereign until the start of its next turn, when it can avert its eyes again. If the creature looks at the cave sovereign in the meantime, it must immediately make the save.

trait.name: Illumination
entries: The cave sovereign's antennae shed dim light in a 5-foot radius. This radius increases to 20 feet while at least one creature is {@condition incapacitated} or {@condition stunned} by Deathlights. At the start of its turn if no creatures are incapacitated or {@condition stunned} by Deathlights, the cave sovereign can suppress this light until the start of its next turn.

trait.name: Inscrutable
entries: The cave sovereign is immune to any effect that would sense its emotions or read its thoughts, as well as any divination spell that it refuses. Wisdom ({@skill Insight}) checks made to ascertain the cave sovereign's intentions or sincerity have disadvantage.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries: If the cave sovereign fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The cave sovereign has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Sinuous Form
entries: Provided there is suitable room to accommodate its bulk, the cave sovereign can squeeze through any opening large enough for a Small creature.

trait.name: Spider Climb
entries: The cave sovereign can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The cave sovereign makes one Bite attack and two Slam attacks. It can make one Tail attack in place of its Bite attack.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 12} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}25 ({@damage 4d8 + 7}) piercing damage plus 11 ({@damage 2d10}) poison damage.

action.name: Slam
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 12} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}23 ({@damage 3d10 + 7}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Tail
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 12} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}26 ({@damage 3d12 + 7}) slashing damage. If the target is a Large or smaller creature, it is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 18}). Until this grapple ends, the target is {@condition restrained}, and the cave sovereign can't use its tail on another target.

action.name: Consume Soul {@recharge 5}
entries: The cave sovereign chooses up to three creatures it can see within 60 feet of it that are incapacitated or {@condition stunned} by Deathlights. Each target must make a {@dc 18} Wisdom saving throw, taking 55 ({@damage 10d10}) psychic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. A creature {@condition stunned} by Deathlights has disadvantage on this saving throw. The cave sovereign then regains hit points equal to half the total psychic damage dealt.

A Humanoid slain by this attack rises {@dice 1d4} rounds later as a zombie under the cave sovereign's control, unless the Humanoid is restored to life or its body is destroyed. The cave sovereign can have no more than thirty zombies under its control at one time.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting (Psionics)
headerEntries: The cave sovereign casts one of the following spells, requiring no spell components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save {@dc 18}):

legendary.name: Move
entries: The cave sovereign moves up to its speed without provoking {@action opportunity attack||opportunity attacks}.

legendary.name: Telekinetic Reel
entries: The cave sovereign magically pulls a creature it can see that is {@condition incapacitated} or {@condition stunned} by its Deathlights up to 20 feet straight toward it.

legendary.name: Cast a Spell (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The cave sovereign uses Spellcasting.

legendary.name: Tail Attack (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The cave sovereign makes one Tail attack.

trait.name: Pandemonium Fruit
entries: The chaos creeper produces pitcher-shaped magical fruit. When a creature picks a fruit, it is subjected to the chaos creeper's Wondrous Cornucopia trait. A fruit withers 24 hours after being picked, losing all magic. If a creature expends a spell slot of 3rd level or higher or volunteers some of its life force while picking the fruit, it can choose which Wondrous Cornucopia effect happens instead of determining the effect randomly. A creature volunteering its life force must spend two Hit Dice, rolling the dice and losing hp equal to the total.

trait.name: Wondrous Cornucopia
entries: A creature that picks one of the chaos creeper's fruits or that is struck by the creeper's Fruit Bomb triggers the chaotic magic within the fruit. Roll a {@dice d8} to determine which of the following effects happens:

trait.name: Butterfly Cloud
entries: The fruit explodes into a cloud of butterflies, swirling out in a 30-foot radius from the fruit for 1 minute, making the area heavily obscured.

trait.name: Restoration
entries: A creature eating the fruit ends one condition, disease, or any reduction to one of its ability scores, or it reduces its {@condition exhaustion} level by one.

trait.name: Poison Gas
entries: The fruit bursts into a cloud of red gas in a 20-foot radius centered on the fruit. The area is heavily obscured and lasts for 1 minute or until dispersed by a strong wind. When a creature enters the cloud for the first time on a turn or starts its turn there, that creature must make a {@dc 16} Constitution saving throw, taking 22 ({@damage 5d8}) poison damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

trait.name: Healing
entries: A creature eating the fruit regains 22 ({@damage 5d8}) hp.

trait.name: Swarming Insects
entries: The fruit bursts, releasing {@dice 2d4} swarms of insects.

trait.name: Protection
entries: A creature eating the fruit gains resistance to acid, cold, fire, lightning, poison, or thunder damage (determined randomly) for 8 hours.

trait.name: Squirrel Transformation
entries: A creature eating the fruit must succeed on a {@dc 16} Constitution saving throw or transform into a squirrel for 10 minutes.

trait.name: Cleansing
entries: All curses and diseases afflicting a creature end when it eats the fruit.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The chaos creeper makes three Vine Whip attacks or two Fruit Bomb attacks.

action.name: Vine Whip
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}18 ({@damage 4d6 + 4}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Fruit Bomb
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 8} to hit, range 30/120 ft., one target. {@h}31 ({@damage 5d10 + 4}) acid, cold, fire, lightning, poison, or thunder damage (the chaos creeper's choice). Instead of dealing damage, the chaos creeper can choose for the fruit to trigger its Wondrous Cornucopia trait. Treat the target as if it ate the fruit, where applicable.

monster.name: Chaos Raptor
languages: understands Common and Terran, but can't speak

trait.name: Aura of Chaos
entries: When a creature with an Intelligence of 4 or higher starts its turn within 30 feet of the chaos raptor, the creature must make a {@dc 18} Charisma saving throw. On a failure, the creature can't take reactions until the start of its next turn and must roll a {@dice d8} to determine what it does during that turn. On a 1 to 4, the creature does nothing. On a 5 or 6, the creature takes no action but uses all its movement to move in a random direction. On a 7 or 8, the creature makes one melee attack against a randomly determined creature within its reach, or it does nothing if no creature is within its reach. At the start of the chaos raptor's turn, it chooses whether this aura is active.

trait.name: Earth Glide
entries: The chaos raptor can burrow through nonmagical, unworked earth and stone. While doing so, the chaos raptor doesn't disturb the material it moves through.

trait.name: Keen Sight
entries: The chaos raptor has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on sight.

trait.name: Regeneration
entries: The chaos raptor regains 20 hp at the start of its turn if at least half of its body is submerged in earth or stone. If the chaos raptor takes thunder damage, this trait doesn't function at the start of the chaos raptor's next turn. The chaos raptor dies only if it starts its turn with 0 hp and doesn't regenerate.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The chaos raptor makes one Beak attack and one Talons attack.

action.name: Beak
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 14} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}27 ({@damage 4d8 + 9}) piercing damage.

action.name: Talons
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 14} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}23 ({@damage 4d6 + 9}) slashing damage, and the target is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 18}). Until this grapple ends, the target is {@condition restrained}, and the chaos raptor can't use its talons on another target.

resist.note: from nonmagical attacks not made with silvered weapons

trait.name: Inner Light
entries: Its open mouth emits a red light, shedding bright light in a 10-foot radius and dim light for an additional 10 feet. Opening or closing its mouth doesn't require an action.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The chemosit makes one Beak attack and two Crutch attacks.

action.name: Beak
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}12 ({@damage 2d8 + 3}) piercing damage plus 7 ({@damage 2d6}) fire damage.

action.name: Crutch
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d8 + 3}) bludgeoning damage, and the target must succeed on a {@dc 14} Constitution saving throw or become infected with the cackle fever disease.

action.name: Inviting Song
entries: The chemosit sings an enchanting tune. Each creature with an Intelligence of 5 or higher within 300 feet of the chemosit that can hear the song must succeed on a {@dc 15} Wisdom saving throw or be {@condition charmed} until the song ends. The chemosit must take a bonus action on its subsequent turns to continue singing. It can stop singing at any time. The song ends if the chemosit is {@condition incapacitated}.

If the {@condition charmed} target is more than 5 feet away from the chemosit, the target must move on its turn toward the chemosit by the most direct route, trying to get within 5 feet. It won't move into damaging terrain, such as lava or a pit, taking whatever route it can to avoid the terrain and still reach the chemosit. If the target can't find a safe route to the chemosit, the {@condition charmed} effect ends. Whenever the target takes damage or at the end of each of its turns, the target can repeat the saving throw. If the saving throw is successful, the effect ends on it. A target that successfully saves is immune to this chemosit's Inviting Song for the next 24 hours.

bonus.name: Change Shape
entries: The chemosit magically transforms into a Small or Medium Humanoid or back into its true Fiendish form. Its statistics, other than its size, are the same in each form. No matter the form, the chemosit always has only one leg. Its crutch adjusts to fit its new form, but no other equipment transforms. It reverts to its true form if it dies, and its crutch becomes nonmagical.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries: If the royal chimera fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Regal Bearing
entries: The chimera's AC includes its Charisma modifier.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The chimera makes one Bite attack, one Claws attack, and one Eldritch Horns attack, or it makes two Arcane Blast attacks.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}15 ({@damage 3d6 + 5}) piercing damage.

action.name: Claws
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}15 ({@damage 3d6 + 5}) slashing damage.

action.name: Eldritch Horns
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}18 ({@damage 2d12 + 5}) force damage.

action.name: Serpent Strike
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 1d8 + 5}) piercing damage plus 7 ({@damage 2d6}) poison damage.

action.name: Arcane Blast
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 10} to hit, range 120 ft., one target. {@h}21 ({@damage 3d10 + 5}) force damage.

action.name: Searing Breath {@recharge 5}
entries: The dragon head exhales a 30-foot cone of fire that burns and blinds. Each creature in that area must make a {@dc 17} Dexterity saving throw. On a failure, a creature takes 45 ({@damage 10d8}) fire damage and is {@condition blinded} until the end of its next turn. On a success, a creature takes half the damage and isn't {@condition blinded}.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The chimera's goat head casts one of the following spells, requiring only verbal components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save {@dc 18}):

legendary.name: Prideful Prowl
entries: The chimera moves up to its walking speed, or flies up to half its flying speed, without provoking {@action opportunity attack||opportunity attacks}.

legendary.name: Serpent Strike
entries: The chimera makes one Serpent Strike attack.

legendary.name: Cast a Spell (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The chimera uses Spellcasting.

legendary.name: Roar of the King (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The lion head lets out a bellow that spurs on its allies. Each friendly creature, including the chimera, within 30 feet of the chimera that can hear the roar gains 11 ({@damage 2d10}) temporary hp and can't be {@condition frightened} for 1 minute.
This chimera has a lion's mane plaited in gold, a goat head with magic sparking between its curved horns, a smoking dragon's head, and a hissing serpent for a tail.

Chimeras that discover the luxury of long life inevitably enjoy the servitude of lesser creatures. Declaring sovereignty—with few willing to dispute the claim—such chimera foster unceasing ambition for power, wealth, and status.

entries.name: Profane Magic
entries: Any chimera that lives long enough to claim royalty and be recognized as such soon gains magical power, often commanded by its goat head. With this power, the goat transfigures the chimera's tail into a snake, giving the chimera the knowledge of speech and greater capability for deception and manipulation. Though the transformation of the tail provides the knowledge of speech, the chimera can speak through any of its heads.

trait.name: Mirror Scales
entries: While the chroma lizard is in bright light, creatures that rely on sight have disadvantage on attack rolls against the lizard.

trait.name: Mirror Shy
entries: If the chroma lizard sees itself reflected in a polished surface within 30 feet of it and in an area of bright light, the lizard immediately closes its eyes and is {@condition blinded} until the start of its next turn when it can check for the reflection again.

trait.name: Radiant Reflection
entries: When a creature deals radiant damage to the chroma lizard, half the radiant damage the lizard took is reflected back at that creature.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The chroma lizard uses Dazzling Display. It then makes one Bite attack and one Claws attack.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}14 ({@damage 2d10 + 3}) piercing damage.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d10 + 3}) slashing damage.

action.name: Dazzling Display
entries: The chroma lizard causes its chrome scales to ripple, casting dizzying reflections of light. Each creature that can see the chroma lizard must succeed on a {@dc 15} Constitution save or be {@condition blinded} until the end of its next turn. The lizard can't use this action while in darkness, and creatures have advantage on the saving throw if the chroma lizard is in dim light.

trait.name: Digestive Dew
entries: A creature that starts its turned {@condition grappled} by the climbing vine takes 2 ({@damage 1d4}) acid damage.

trait.name: Flexible Form
entries: A climbing vine can move through a space as narrow as 6 inches wide without squeezing.

action.name: Dewvine
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 3} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}The target is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 11}). The climbing vine has two attacking vines, each of which can grapple only one creature.

action.name: Squeeze
entries: The climbing vine squeezes creatures in its grasp. Each creature {@condition grappled} by the climbing vine must succeed on a {@dc 11} Strength saving throw or take 5 ({@damage 2d4}) bludgeoning damage.

reaction.name: Grasping Retaliation
entries: When a creature hits the climbing vine with a melee attack while within 5 feet of the vine, the vine can make one Dewvine attack against it.

monster.name: Clockwork Armadillo
languages: understands the languages of its creator but can't speak

trait.name: Construct Nature
entries: The armadillo doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

trait.name: Immutable Form
entries: The armadillo is immune to any spell or effect that would alter its form.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The armadillo has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Overclocked
entries: The armadillo has advantage on initiative rolls.

action.name: Scissor Claws
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d4 + 4}) slashing damage, and the target must succeed on a {@dc 11} Constitution saving throw or drop whatever it is currently holding.

action.name: Tuck In
entries: The armadillo tucks its entire body into its shell, forming an armored ball. While an armored ball, it moves by rolling, has resistance to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage, is immune to the {@condition prone} condition, and it can't make Scissor Claws attacks. As part of this action, the armadillo can expand its shell outward to contain one object of its size or smaller that isn't being worn or carried and is within 5 feet of the armadillo. The armadillo can uncurl its body and release any contained item as a bonus action.

monster.name: Clockwork Conductor
languages: understands the languages of its creator but can't speak

trait.name: Construct Nature
entries: The conductor doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

trait.name: Immutable Form
entries: The conductor is immune to any spell or effect that would alter its form.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The conductor has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Metronomic Aura
entries: When a friendly creature within 20 feet of the conductor makes an attack or a Charisma ({@skill Performance}) check, the creature can treat the d20 roll as a 10 instead of using the die's actual roll.

action.name: Conductive Baton
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 3} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}3 ({@damage 1d4 + 1}) bludgeoning damage plus 4 ({@damage 1d8}) lightning damage, and the target can't take reactions until the start of its next turn.

action.name: Overclocked Finale (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries: The conductor makes a grand sacrifice, spurring its allies on in a final masterstroke. Each friendly creature within 30 feet of the conductor that can see it gains a +5 bonus to attack rolls, damage rolls, and ability checks for until the end of the conductor's next turn. Roll a {@dice d6}. On a 1 to 4, the conductor can't use Concerted Effort until it finishes a short rest. On a 5 or 6, it can't use Concerted Effort, and its Metronomic Aura becomes inactive until it finishes a short rest.

bonus.name: Concerted Effort
entries: The conductor inspires itself or one friendly creature it can see within 30 feet of it until the start of the conductor's next turn. When the target makes an attack roll or a Constitution saving throw to maintain concentration on a spell, the target can roll a {@dice d4} and add the number rolled to the attack roll or saving throw.

trait.name: Construct Nature
entries: A clockwork pugilist doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

trait.name: Immutable Form
entries: The clockwork pugilist is immune to any spell or effect that would alter its form.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The clockwork pugilist has advantage on saving throws against spells or other magical effects.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The clockwork pugilist makes two Fist attacks.

action.name: Fist
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Brass Onslaught {@recharge 6}
entries: The pugilist moves up to 10 feet and makes one fist attack. If it hits, the target takes an extra 10 ({@damage 3d6}) bludgeoning damage. This movement doesn't provoke {@action opportunity attack||opportunity attacks}.

reaction.name: Get Down, Sir!
entries: When a creature within 5 feet of the pugilist is targeted by a ranged attack or spell, the pugilist steps in the way, and the ranged attack or spell targets the pugilist instead.

reaction.name: Parry
entries: The pugilist adds 2 to its AC against one melee attack that would hit it. To do so, the pugilist must see the attacker and have at least one hand empty.

monster.name: Clockwork Scorpion

resist.note: from nonmagical attacks not made with adamantine weapons

languages: understands the languages of its creator but can't speak

trait.name: Construct Nature
entries: The clockwork scorpion doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

trait.name: Immutable Form
entries: The clockwork scorpion is immune to any spell or effect that would alter its form.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The clockwork scorpion has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The clockwork scorpion makes one Sting attack and two Claw attacks.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 1d12 + 4}) bludgeoning damage, and the target is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 16}). The clockwork scorpion has two claws, each of which can grapple only one target.

action.name: Sting
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}9 ({@damage 1d10 + 4}) piercing damage plus 22 ({@damage 4d10}) poison damage. The scorpion then chooses one of the following alchemical solutions, and the target must make a {@dc 16} Constitution saving throw. The effect is determined by the chosen solution.

action.name: Hallucinatory Elixir
entries: On a failed save, the target sees enemies everywhere for 1 minute. On its turn, the target uses its action to make a melee attack against the nearest creature that is not the clockwork scorpion, moving up to its speed toward the creature, if necessary. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. If the target succeeds on the initial save, it is {@condition charmed} until the end of its next turn.

action.name: Sleep Solution
entries: On a failed save, the target falls {@condition unconscious} for 1 minute. This effect ends for the target if it takes damage or if another creature takes an action to wake it. On a successful save, the target is {@condition incapacitated} until the end of its next turn.

action.name: Vocal Paralytic
entries: On a failed save, the target is {@condition poisoned} for 1 minute. While {@condition poisoned} in this way, the target is unable to speak or cast spells that require verbal components. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. If the target succeeds on the initial save, it is {@condition poisoned} in this way until the end of its next turn.

action.name: Acid Spray {@recharge 5}
entries: The clockwork scorpion spews acid in a 15-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a {@dc 16} Dexterity saving throw, taking 42 ({@damage 12d6}) acid damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

reaction.name: Gas Nozzles
entries: When the clockwork scorpion takes damage, each creature within 5 feet of it takes 5 ({@damage 1d10}) poison damage. If the damage it took was fire, the gas ignites and deals an extra 5 ({@damage 1d10}) fire damage.

monster.name: Clockwork Tactician
languages: Common plus up to two languages of its creator

trait.name: Construct Nature
entries: The clockwork tactician doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

trait.name: Immutable Form
entries: The clockwork tactician is immune to any spell or effect that would alter its form.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The clockwork tactician has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Magic Weapons
entries: The tactician's weapon attacks are magical.

trait.name: Pack Tactics
entries: This clockwork tactician has advantage on attack rolls against a creature if at least one of this tactician's allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally isn't {@condition incapacitated}.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The clockwork tactician makes four Multiweapon attacks.

action.name: Multiweapon
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}14 ({@damage 2d8 + 5}) bludgeoning, piercing, or slashing damage. The clockwork tactician chooses the damage type when it attacks.

action.name: Heavy Crossbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 6} to hit, range 100/400 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d10 + 2}) piercing damage.

bonus.name: Battlefield Commands
entries: The clockwork tactician issues commands to up to three friendly creatures it can see within 60 feet of it. Each target has advantage on its next ability check or attack roll, provided it can hear and understand the tactician.

bonus.name: Press the Attack
entries: If the clockwork tactician hits one target with two Multiweapon attacks or scores a critical hit with its multiweapon, it can make one additional Multiweapon attack.

reaction.name: Quick Study
entries: When a creature hits the clockwork tactician with an attack, the tactician makes a {@dc 13} Intelligence check. On a success, it chooses one of the following benefits:

items: The tactician has advantage on melee attack rolls against the attacker.
The attacker has disadvantage on attack rolls against the tactician.
The tactician has resistance to the type of damage from the attack that hit it.

entries: The tactician can have more than one benefit active at a time. The benefits end when the tactician attacks a different creature or uses Quick Study on a different creature.

trait.name: Shoving Charge
entries: If the cloudhoof assassin moves at least 20 feet straight toward a target and then hits it with a Headbutt attack on the same turn, that target must succeed on a {@dc 13} Strength saving throw or be pushed up to 10 feet away from the cloudhoof. If a creature fails this saving throw by 5 or more, it is pushed up to 15 feet.

trait.name: Sure-Hooved
entries: The cloudhoof assassin has advantage on Strength and Dexterity checks and saving throws made against effects that would knock it {@condition prone}. In addition, it has advantage on Strength ({@skill Athletics}) checks to climb rocky surfaces and Dexterity ({@skill Acrobatics}) checks to maintain its balance on rocky surfaces.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The cloudhoof assassin makes one Headbutt attack and one Shoving Kick attack.

action.name: Headbutt
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Shoving Kick
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d4 + 3}) bludgeoning damage, and the target must succeed on a {@dc 13} Strength saving throw or be pushed up to 5 feet away from the cloudhoof assassin. If the cloudhoof scores a critical hit, the target is pushed up to 10 feet on a failed save.

trait.name: Glowing Organs
entries: While underwater, the coastline reaper's internal organs glow an eerie, pale blue, shedding dim light in a 10-foot radius.

trait.name: Hold Breath
entries: While out of water, the coastline reaper can hold its breath for 30 minutes.

trait.name: Water Breathing
entries: The coastline reaper can breathe only underwater.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The coastline reaper makes two Tentacle Lash attacks and one Stinging Tentacle attack.

action.name: Tentacle Lash
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. {@h}14 ({@damage 3d6 + 4}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Stinging Tentacle
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d6 + 4}) piercing damage plus 9 ({@damage 2d8}) poison damage. The target must succeed on a {@dc 16} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition paralyzed} for 1 minute. A {@condition frightened} creature has disadvantage on this saving throw. The {@condition paralyzed} target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

action.name: Frightening Visage {@recharge 5}
entries: If underwater, the coastline reaper flares the light from its organs, making the skull-like structure within more apparent. If above water, the coastline reaper tightly pulls in its outer flesh, causing its body to take on a fleshy, skull-like appearance. Each Humanoid within 30 feet of the coastline reaper that can see it must make a {@dc 16} Wisdom saving throw. On a failure, a creature takes 21 ({@damage 6d6}) psychic damage and is {@condition frightened} for 1 minute. On a success, a creature takes half the damage and isn't {@condition frightened}. A {@condition frightened} creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

trait.name: Death Trap
entries: When the conniption bug dies, its mandibles remain locked in place, continuing to grapple beyond its death. Until the grapple ends, the creature takes 4 ({@damage 1d8}) piercing damage at the start of each of its turns as if the bug was still alive. Any creature can take an action to remove the mandibles with a successful {@dc 11} Strength ({@skill Athletics}) or Wisdom ({@skill Medicine}) check.

trait.name: Limited Amphibiousness
entries: The conniption bug can breathe air and water, but it needs to be submerged at least once every 4 hours to avoid {@quickref suffocating||2}.

trait.name: Pack Tactics
entries: The conniption bug has advantage on attack rolls against a creature if at least one of the bug's allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally isn't {@condition incapacitated}.

trait.name: Standing Leap
entries: The conniption bug's long jump is up to 20 feet and its high jump is up to 10 feet, with or without a running start.

trait.name: Vicious Wound
entries: The conniption bug's melee attacks score a critical hit on a roll of 19 or 20.

action.name: Barbed Mandibles
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d8 + 2}) piercing damage. The target is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 13}) if it is a Medium or smaller creature and the conniption bug doesn't have another creature {@condition grappled}. Until this grapple ends, the target takes 4 ({@damage 1d8}) piercing damage at the start of each of its turns, and the conniption bug can't make Barbed Mandible attacks against other targets.

action.name: Barbed Claws
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 2d4 + 2}) piercing damage.

variant.name: Scourge Bug
entries: Those conniption bugs that mature in magically inundated regions develop a little differently. They are known as "scourge bugs" and have an affinity for elemental magic, which seeps from their saliva and coats their mandibles. A scourge bug has a challenge rating of 2 (450 XP), has resistance to acid, cold, fire, lightning, and poison damage, and has the following action option in place of Barbed Mandibles:

entries.name: Elemental Mandibles
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d8 + 2}) piercing damage. The target is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 13}) if it is a Medium or smaller creature and the scourge bug doesn't have another creature {@condition grappled}. Until this grapple ends, the target is {@condition restrained} and takes 7 ({@damage 2d6}) acid, cold, fire, lightning, or poison damage (the scourge bug's choice) at the start of each of its turns, and the scourge bug can't make Elemental Mandible attacks against other targets.

items.name: Elemental Mandibles
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d8 + 2}) piercing damage. The target is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 13}) if it is a Medium or smaller creature and the scourge bug doesn't have another creature {@condition grappled}. Until this grapple ends, the target is {@condition restrained} and takes 7 ({@damage 2d6}) acid, cold, fire, lightning, or poison damage (the scourge bug's choice) at the start of each of its turns, and the scourge bug can't make Elemental Mandible attacks against other targets.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries: If the prismatic dragon fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The prismatic dragon uses its Frightful Presence. It then makes one Bite attack and two Claw attacks.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 14} to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. {@h}18 ({@damage 2d10 + 7}) piercing damage.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 14} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}14 ({@damage 2d6 + 7}) slashing damage.

action.name: Tail
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 14} to hit, reach 20 ft., one target. {@h}16 ({@damage 2d8 + 7}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Frightful Presence
entries: Each creature of the prismatic dragon's choice that is within 120 feet of the dragon and aware of it must succeed on a {@dc 19} Wisdom saving throw or become {@condition frightened} for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a creature's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the creature is immune to the dragon's Frightful Presence for the next 24 hours.

action.name: Breath Weapon {@recharge 5}
entries: The prismatic dragon uses one of the following breath weapons:

items.name: Light Beam.
items.entry: The prismatic dragon emits a beam of white light in a 120-foot line that is 10 feet wide. Each creature in that line must make a {@dc 23} Dexterity saving throw, taking 90 ({@damage 20d8}) radiant damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

items.name: Rainbow Blast.
items.entry: The prismatic dragon emits multicolored light in a 90-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a {@dc 23} Dexterity saving throw, taking 72 ({@damage 16d8}) damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. The dragon splits the damage up among acid, cold, fire, lightning, or poison, choosing a number of {@dice d8|d8s} for each damage type totaling {@dice 16d8}. It must choose at least two damage types.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The prismatic dragon casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save {@dc 20}):

legendary.name: Detect
entries: The prismatic dragon makes a Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) check.

legendary.name: Tail Attack
entries: The prismatic dragon makes a tail attack.

legendary.name: Cast a Spell (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The prismatic dragon uses Spellcasting.

legendary.name: Shimmering Wings (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The prismatic dragon beats its wings. Each creature within 20 feet of the dragon must succeed on a {@dc 19} Wisdom saving throw or take 16 ({@damage 3d10}) radiant damage and become {@condition blinded} until the start of the dragon's next turn.

trait.name: Amorphous
entries: The slime can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide without squeezing.

trait.name: Ooze Nature
entries: The copperkill slime doesn't require sleep.

trait.name: Patinated Appearance
entries: While the slime remains motionless, it is indistinguishable from the object or structure it is stretched across, though the object or structure appears to be covered in green paint or verdigris.

trait.name: Spider Climb
entries: The slime can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The copperkill slime makes three Pseudopod attacks. If the slime hits one creature with two Pseudopod attacks, the target is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 15}). Until this grapple ends, the target is {@condition restrained} and takes 9 ({@damage 2d8}) poison damage at the start of each of its turns. The copperkill slime can have only one target {@condition grappled} in this way at a time.

action.name: Pseudopod
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d6 + 4}) bludgeoning damage plus 9 ({@damage 2d8}) poison damage.

action.name: Poisonous Snap (Stretched Body Only) {@recharge 5}
entries: While the copperkill slime is covering an object or structure, it can rapidly collapse back to its normal form, ending the stretch and spraying all nearby creatures with poisonous slime. Each creature within 10 feet of any space the stretched slime occupied before collapsing must make a {@dc 15} Dexterity saving throw. On a failure, a creature takes 27 ({@damage 6d8}) poison damage and is coated in poisonous slime. On a success, a creature takes half the damage and isn't coated in slime. A creature coated in poisonous slime takes 9 ({@damage 2d8}) poison damage at the start of each of its turns. A creature, including the slime-coated creature, can take an action to clean off the slime.

bonus.name: Stretch Body
entries: The copperkill slime stretches its body across the surface of a Gargantuan or smaller object or across the surface of a wall, pillar, or similar structure no larger than a 20-foot square within 5 feet of it, sharing the space of the object or structure. The slime can end the stretch as a bonus action, occupying the nearest unoccupied space to the object or structure.

trait.name: Downdraft
entries: While the moth is flying, the area within 10 feet of it is difficult terrain.

trait.name: Glow
entries: The moth casts light from its abdomen, shedding bright light in a 20-foot radius and dim light for an additional 20 feet.

trait.name: Keen Smell
entries: The moth has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on smell.

trait.name: Necrotic Dampening
entries: Each friendly creature within 30 feet of the moth has resistance to necrotic damage.

trait.name: Spider Climb
entries: The moth can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The corpselight moth makes two Proboscis attacks.

action.name: Proboscis
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}11 ({@damage 2d6 + 4}) piercing damage plus 7 ({@damage 2d6}) radiant damage.

action.name: Radiant Wind {@recharge 4}
entries: The corpselight moth flaps its wings, releasing magical wind in a 30-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a {@dc 15} Strength saving throw. On a failure, a target takes 21 ({@damage 6d6}) radiant damage and is flung up 15 feet away from the moth in a direction following the cone and knocked {@condition prone}.

If a thrown target strikes an object, such as a wall or floor, the target takes 3 ({@damage 1d6}) bludgeoning damage for every 10 feet it was thrown. If the target is thrown into another creature, that creature must succeed on a {@dc 15} Dexterity saving throw or take the same damage and be knocked {@condition prone}.
If the saving throw is successful, the target takes half the radiant damage and isn't flung away or knocked {@condition prone}.

variant.name: Midden Moth
entries: If the necrotic energy that accumulates in a corpselight moth isn't removed, the moth eventually transforms into a midden moth. Where the corpselight moth is like moonlight, the midden moth is like a moonless night.

A midden moth uses the statistics here, except it has resistance to radiant damage and immunity to necrotic damage, and it deals necrotic damage instead of radiant damage. It has the following trait in place of the Glow trait:

entries.name: Gloom
entries: A gloom extends from the midden moth's abdomen. Bright light within 40 feet of the midden moth becomes dim light, and dim light in the area becomes darkness.

items.name: Gloom
entries: A gloom extends from the midden moth's abdomen. Bright light within 40 feet of the midden moth becomes dim light, and dim light in the area becomes darkness.

monster.name: Cosmic Symphony
languages: understands all languages but can't speak

trait.name: Invisible
entries: The cosmic symphony is {@condition invisible}.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries: If the cosmic symphony fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The cosmic symphony has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The cosmic symphony can use Universal Music. It then makes one Discordant Wave attack and one Slam attack or two Discordant Wave attacks.

action.name: Discordant Wave
entries: {@atk ms,rs} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 60/120 ft., one target. {@h}27 ({@damage 5d8 + 5}) thunder damage. The target and each creature within 10 feet of it must succeed on a {@dc 18} Constitution saving throw or become {@condition deafened} until the end of its next turn.

action.name: Slam
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 13} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}24 ({@damage 3d10 + 8}) bludgeoning damage plus 22 ({@damage 5d8}) thunder damage.

action.name: Universal Music
entries: Each creature of the symphony's choice within 120 feet of the cosmic symphony must succeed on a {@dc 18} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition incapacitated} for 1 minute. A creature that fails the saving throw by 5 or more is {@condition stunned} for 1 minute instead. A {@condition stunned} or {@condition incapacitated} creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a creature's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the creature is immune to the cosmic symphony's Universal Music for the next 24 hours.

action.name: Celestial Crescendo {@recharge 5}
entries: Sound waves explode from the cosmic symphony. Each creature within 30 feet of the symphony must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failure, a creature takes 45 ({@damage 10d8}) thunder damage and is {@condition deafened} for 1 minute. On a success, a creature takes half the damage and isn't {@condition deafened}. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

legendary.name: Fly
entries: The cosmic symphony flies up to half its flying speed without provoking {@action opportunity attack||opportunity attacks}.

legendary.name: Major Chord (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The symphony regains 18 ({@damage 4d8}) hp.

legendary.name: Minor Chord (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: Each creature within 10 feet of the symphony must succeed on a {@dc 18} Constitution saving throw or take 9 ({@damage 2d8}) thunder damage.

trait.name: Extradimensional Bag
entries: The duffel crab uses an extra-dimensional space, such as a bag of holding, as its "shell." The bag can hold creatures in addition to the crab, based on the size of the extradimensional space. Breathing creatures inside the bag can survive up to a number of minutes equal to 10 divided by the number of creatures (minimum 1 minute), after which time they begin to suffocate. If the bag is overloaded, pierced, or torn, it ruptures and is destroyed. While this would normally cause the contents to be lost in the Astral Plane, the crab's half-in, half-out existence kept the bag constantly open, even when it fully withdrew, altering the bag, which simply spills out its contents into the area when the bag is destroyed or the crab dies. The bag becomes a standard bag of holding or similar magic item with extradimensional space 24 hours after the crab dies.

trait.name: False Appearance
entries: While motionless and withdrawn into its extradimensional bag, the duffel crab is indistinguishable from its extradimensional bag with an ajar lid or opening.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The duffel crab makes two Claw attacks, or it makes one Claw attack and uses Collect.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}10 ({@damage 2d6 + 3}) bludgeoning damage, and the target is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 13}). Until this grapple ends, the target is {@condition restrained}, and the crab can't attack another target with that claw. The crab has two claws, each of which can grapple only one target.

action.name: Collect
entries: The crab places one target it is grappling into its extradimensional space, provided there is room, and the grapple ends. The target is {@condition blinded} and {@condition restrained}, and it has total cover against attacks and other effects outside the extradimensional space. A trapped creature can take its action to climb out of the bag by succeeding on a {@dc 13} Strength or Dexterity check (the creature's choice). If the crab dies, a trapped creature is no longer {@condition restrained} by the crab and can escape from the bag using 5 feet of movement, exiting {@condition prone}.
An enormous hermit crab pulls itself along the beach with its deep-red claws. Oddly, the bulk of its body is hidden inside a bag much too small to contain a creature of its size.

Duffel crabs are often found along coastlines and shipping routes where shipwrecks are common. Destroyed shipping vessels using extradimensional bags, chests, and other items to save on weight leave valuable trinkets for curious creatures. Duffel crabs come into existence when a hermit crab stumbles upon an extradimensional bag and takes it up as a shell. The latent magic of the bag causes the crab to grow to an enormous size.

entries.name: Food Hoarders
entries: The crab's bag provides an excellent storage solution to save food for a later date. A duffel crab's bag is often stocked with rotting sea creatures and the bodies of unfortunate sailors collected from shipwrecks. Living creatures are no exception in the crab's eyes, as they never live long in the suffocating interior of the extradimensional space.

entries.name: Risky Treasure
entries: To budding adventurers, duffel crabs present the opportunity to gain a unique treasure, if they are experienced and strong enough to face a hungry crab the size of a draft horse.

trait.name: Bladed Shell
entries: A creature that touches the crab or hits it with a melee attack while within 5 feet of it takes 3 ({@damage 1d6}) slashing damage.

trait.name: Pounce
entries: If the crab moves at least 15 feet straight toward a creature and then hits it with a Shell Bash attack on the same turn, that target must succeed on a {@dc 13} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}. If the target is {@condition prone}, the crab can make one Claw attack against it as a bonus action.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The crab makes one Claw attack and one Shell Bash attack.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) bludgeoning damage, and the target is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 13}). The crab has two claws, each of which can grapple only one target.

action.name: Shell Bash
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d4 + 3}) bludgeoning plus 3 ({@damage 1d6}) slashing damage.
With a thick exoskeleton studded with sharp ridges and low spines, this large crab harkens back to the primordial era before recorded history.

Razorback crabs are a rare form of crustacean that has evolved to live outside the water. In fact, the crabs' evolution has deprived it of its gills entirely, making it markedly unsuited for coastal or aquatic living. Instead, razorback crabs thrive in farmland and grassy plains and are the bane of farmers and other plains dwellers.

entries.name: Scuttling Tunnelers
entries: In places where a colony of razorback crabs has taken hold, the land is riddled with crisscrossing tunnels and moderately-sized burrows large enough to house three or four of the pests. The tunnels are large enough for a human to crawl through, or for a hound to walk in without difficulty, though the occasion of a dog touring the tunnels often ends in tragedy for the poor beast. Colonies of the crustaceans rarely number more than ten individuals. When a group grows larger, the heartiest young crab leaves with a few of its siblings to found a new colony nearby.

entries.name: Farmland Threat
entries: Razorback crabs are carnivorous and have a diet comprised primarily of insects and small animals. In their burrows, the crabs devour insects, annelids, and arthropods, but their favorite food is fowl, particularly chicken, partridge, and pheasant. Razorback crabs are not voracious, requiring only a few pounds of meat every week to survive, but a small colony of them can empty a chicken coop in a single night simply by burrowing into it. Farmers and their families take evidence of razorback crabs in an area very seriously, and they form search parties to track the creatures to their nests and put an end to them. A single crab is deadly, even to a group of armed farmers. When facing an infestation, the farmers prefer to keep their distance and burn the nuisances out without having to get close enough to come to harm.

entries.name: Succulent Flesh
entries: Like their aquatic counterparts, razorback crabs have tender, flavorful flesh, particularly when roasted. After a razorback crab colony has been put to the torch, the exultant farmers haul the carcasses away and invite their friends and neighbors for a feast of legs and pincers. A single razorback crab can easily feed a dozen people.

trait.name: Amphibious
entries: The samurai crab can breathe air and water.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The samurai crab makes three melee attacks. If the crab is grappling two creatures, it can't make Crustaceous Sword attacks.

action.name: Crustaceous Sword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}13 ({@damage 2d8 + 4}) slashing damage.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 2d6 + 4}) bludgeoning damage. If the target is Medium or smaller, it is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 15}), and the crab can't use this claw to attack another target. The crab has two claws, each of which can grapple only one target.

bonus.name: Fighting Stance
entries: The samurai crab adopts a fighting stance, choosing from the options below. The stance lasts until the crab ends it (no action required) or uses this bonus action again.

items.name: Banded Claw.
items.entry: The samurai crab adopts a wide, grappler's stance. While the samurai crab is in this stance, each creature that starts its turn {@condition grappled} by the crab takes 3 ({@damage 1d6}) bludgeoning damage.

items.name: Hard Shell.
items.entry: The samurai crab adopts a defensive stance, increasing its AC by 2.

items.name: Soft Shell.
items.entry: The samurai crab adopts an offensive stance, gaining advantage on the first Crustaceous Sword attack it makes each turn.

entries: A crab with a peculiar looking shell shaped like a helmet scuttles forward. It moves with uncanny precision as it draws a sword from a scabbard-like section of its carapace.

There are many rumors surrounding the creation of the first samurai crab. Some say they are cursed warriors who broke the creed they swore to uphold. Others say they were a wizard experiment gone wrong. Still other scholars speculate they are just unusually intelligent crabs who watched skilled warriors' movements from the shallows and began to mimic them. Samurai crabs are found near coastal cities, especially those with significant martial forces. It is believed that the presence of talented and skilled fighters attracts the crabs.

entries.name: Unclear Motives
entries: From outside observations, the samurai crab appears to be simply a large crab with an odd shell. However, samurai crabs are quite skilled with blades, and they constantly seek out opponents to test their combat prowess. Though they can't speak, they understand rudimentary {@language Common}, and they know the basic weapon movements and signals for initiating honorable duels with armed combatants. Whether bested or the winner, a samurai crab competing in an honorable duel never kills an opponent unless its own life is threatened.

entries.name: Carapace Blade
entries: One of the most unique and interesting aspects of the samurai crab is the presence of its iconic sword or in some cases swords. Some crabs salvage the swords from shipwrecks while others seem to be hatched with them. Samurai crabs fight to the death when creatures attempt to relieve them of their swords.

trait.name: False Appearance
entries: While the crystallite remains motionless, it is indistinguishable from a large geode.

trait.name: Final Form
entries: When a crystallite dies, its corpse transforms into crystal and becomes a Large object that can be attacked and destroyed (AC 17; hp 45; immunity to poison and psychic damage). It can no longer be affected by spells and effects that target creatures.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The crystallite makes two Crystal Limb attacks. It can replace one attack with a use of Biomineralize.

action.name: Crystal Limb
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}13 ({@damage 2d8 + 4}) piercing damage, and the crystallite impales the target on its limb, grappling the target (escape {@dc 14}) if it is a Medium or smaller creature. When this grapple ends, the target takes 9 ({@damage 2d8}) slashing damage. The crystallite has two Crystal Limbs, each of which can grapple only one target.

action.name: Biomineralize
entries: The crystallite absorbs lifeforce from one creature {@condition grappled} by it. The target must make a {@dc 14} Constitution saving throw, taking 14 ({@damage 4d6}) necrotic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. The target's hp maximum is reduced by an amount equal to the necrotic damage taken, and the crystallite regains hp equal to that amount. This reduction lasts until the target finishes a long rest.
