The target dies if this effect reduces its hp maximum to 0.

reaction.name: Calcify
entries: When the crystallite takes 5 damage or more on a single turn, it can reduce its hp maximum by an amount equal to the damage taken and gains a +1 bonus to AC. The reduction and the bonus last until the crystallite finishes a long rest. The crystallite can't increase its AC above 20 using this reaction.

monster.name: Adult Prismatic Dragon

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries: If the prismatic dragon fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The prismatic dragon uses its Frightful Presence. It then makes one Bite attack and two Claw attacks.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 11} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}17 ({@damage 2d10 + 6}) piercing damage.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 11} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}13 ({@damage 2d6 + 6}) slashing damage.

action.name: Tail
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 11} to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. {@h}15 ({@damage 2d8 + 6}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Frightful Presence
entries: Each creature of the prismatic dragon's choice that is within 120 feet of the dragon and aware of it must succeed on a {@dc 16} Wisdom saving throw or become {@condition frightened} for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a creature's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the creature is immune to the dragon's Frightful Presence for the next 24 hours.

action.name: Breath Weapon {@recharge 5}
entries: The prismatic dragon uses one of the following breath weapons:

items.name: Light Beam.
items.entry: The prismatic dragon emits a beam of white light in a 90-foot line that is 5 feet wide. Each creature in that line must make a {@dc 19} Dexterity saving throw, taking 45 ({@damage 10d8}) radiant damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

items.name: Rainbow Blast.
items.entry: The prismatic dragon emits multicolored light in a 60-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a {@dc 19} Dexterity saving throw, taking 36 ({@damage 8d8}) damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. The dragon splits the damage up among acid, cold, fire, lightning, or poison, choosing a number of {@dice d8|d8s} for each damage type totaling {@dice 8d8}. It must choose at least two damage types.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The prismatic dragon casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save {@dc 17}):

legendaryHeader: The prismatic dragon can take 3 legendary actions, choosing from
the options below. Only one legendary action can be used at a time
and only at the end of another creature's turn. The dragon regains
spent legendary actions at the start of its turn.

legendary.name: Detect
entries: The prismatic dragon makes a Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) check.

legendary.name: Tail Attack
entries: The prismatic dragon makes a tail attack.

legendary.name: Cast a Spell (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The prismatic dragon uses Spellcasting

legendary.name: Shimmering Wings (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The prismatic dragon beats its crystalline wings. Each creature within 20 feet of the dragon must succeed on a {@dc 16} Wisdom saving throw or take 11 ({@damage 2d10}) radiant damage and become {@condition blinded} until the start of the dragon's next turn.

trait.name: Amphibious
entries: The warchief can breathe air and water.

trait.name: Insect Affinity
entries: Insects understand the warchief and view it favorably. The warchief can communicate simple ideas, through words and gestures, with insectoid Beasts, and the warchief has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Animal Handling}) checks made when interacting with such Beasts.

trait.name: Jungle Camouflage
entries: The warchief has advantage on Dexterity ({@skill Stealth}) checks made to hide in jungle terrain.

trait.name: Locked Saddle
entries: The warchief can't be knocked {@condition prone}, dismounted, or moved against its will while mounted.

trait.name: Mounted Warrior
entries: While the warchief is mounted, its mount can't be {@condition charmed} or {@condition frightened}.

trait.name: Slippery
entries: The warchief has advantage on saving throws and ability checks made to escape a grapple.

trait.name: Spirited Charge
entries: If the warchief moves at least 20 feet straight toward a creature while mounted and then hits with a Lance attack on the same turn, the warchief can use a bonus action to command its mount to make one melee weapon attack against that creature as a reaction.

trait.name: Standing Leap
entries: The warchief's long jump is up to 20 feet and its high jump is up to 10 feet, with or without a running start.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The cueyatl warchief makes two Lance attacks. If the warchief is mounted, its mount can then make one melee weapon attack.

action.name: Lance
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 1d12 + 4}) piercing damage plus 7 ({@damage 2d6}) poison damage.

action.name: Javelin
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 30/120 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d6 + 4}) piercing damage plus 7 ({@damage 2d6}) poison damage.

reaction.name: Mounted Parry
entries: The warchief adds 3 to its AC or its mount's AC against one melee attack that would hit it or its mount. To do so, the warchief must see the attacker and be wielding a melee weapon.

trait.name: Blur of Motion
entries: When the cyonaxin moves at least 30 feet on its turn, ranged attack rolls against it have disadvantage until the start of its next turn.

trait.name: Chain Breaker
entries: The cyonaxin deals double damage to objects that restrain creatures.

trait.name: Evasion
entries: If the cyonaxin is subjected to an effect that allows it to make a Dexterity saving throw to take only half damage, the cyonaxin instead takes no damage if it succeeds on the saving throw, and only half damage if it fails.

trait.name: Freedom of Movement
entries: The cyonaxin ignores difficult terrain, and magical effects can't reduce its speed or cause it to be {@condition restrained}. It can spend 5 feet of movement to escape from nonmagical restraints or being {@condition grappled}.

trait.name: Keen Smell
entries: The cyonaxin has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on smell.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The cyonaxin has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Magic Weapons
entries: The cyonaxin's weapon attacks are magical.

trait.name: Pounce
entries: If the cyonaxin moves at least 20 feet straight toward a creature and then hits it with a Claw attack on the same turn, that target must succeed on a {@dc 15} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}. If the target is {@condition prone}, the cyonaxin can make one Bite attack against it as a bonus action.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The cyonaxin makes one Bite attack and two Claw attacks.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}16 ({@damage 3d6 + 6}) piercing damage plus 10 ({@damage 3d6}) radiant damage.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}13 ({@damage 3d4 + 6}) slashing damage.

action.name: Frightful Yowl {@recharge 6}
entries: The cyonaxin screeches, the sound growing more intense over a few seconds. Each hostile creature within 60 feet of the cyonaxin and that can hear it must succeed on a {@dc 15} Wisdom saving throw or be {@condition frightened} for 1 minute. A creature grappling or restraining another creature has disadvantage on its saving throws. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

action.name: Liberating Churr {@recharge 5}
entries: The cyonaxin issues a loud, staccato chirp. Each friendly creature within 90 feet of the cyonaxin and that can hear it gains the benefits of the cyonaxin's Freedom of Movement trait. In addition, each affected creature grows claws, which it can use to make unarmed strikes. When an affected creature hits with a claw, its claw deals slashing damage equal to {@dice 1d6} + its Strength modifier, instead of the bludgeoning damage normal for an unarmed strike. These benefits last until the start of the cyonaxin's next turn.

bonus.name: Free Runner
entries: The cyonaxin can take the {@action Dash} action.

trait.name: Keen Smell
entries: The daeodon has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on smell.

trait.name: Relentless (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries: If the daeodon takes 15 damage or less that would reduce it to 0 hp, it is reduced to 1 hp instead.

trait.name: Trampling Charge
entries: If the daeodon moves at least 20 feet straight toward a creature and then hits it with a Bite attack on the same turn, that target must succeed on a {@dc 13} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}. If the target is {@condition prone}, the daeodon can make one Slam attack against it as a bonus action.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The daeodon makes one Bite attack and one Slam attack.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}14 ({@damage 2d8 + 5}) piercing damage, and the target is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 13}). Until this grapple ends, the target is {@condition restrained}, and the daeodon can't Bite another target.

action.name: Slam
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 2d4 + 5}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Fierce Call (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries: The daeodon lets out a loud, fearsome call. Each hostile creature within 60 feet of the daeodon must succeed on a {@dc 13} Wisdom saving throw or drop whatever it is holding and become {@condition frightened} for 1 minute. While {@condition frightened}, a creature must take the {@action Dash} action and move away from the daeodon by the safest available route on each of its turns, unless there is nowhere to move. A {@condition frightened} creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

trait.name: Flyby
entries: The dawnfly doesn't provoke {@action opportunity attack||opportunity attacks} when it flies out of an enemy's reach.

trait.name: Siege Monster
entries: The dawnfly deals double damage to objects and structures.

trait.name: Unsettling Drone
entries: A creature that starts its turn within 10 feet of the dawnfly must succeed on a {@dc 19} Constitution saving throw or become {@condition incapacitated} until the start of its next turn. {@condition Deafened} creatures have advantage on the saving throw. On a successful saving throw, the creature is immune to the dawnfly's Unsettling Drone for the next 24 hours.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The dawnfly makes one Bite attack and three Tail attacks.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 12} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}19 ({@damage 3d8 + 6}) piercing damage plus 7 ({@damage 2d6}) poison damage.

action.name: Tail
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 12} to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. {@h}22 ({@damage 3d10 + 6}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Wing Slice {@recharge 4}
entries: The dawnfly flies up to 40 feet in a straight line and can move through the space of any Huge or smaller creature. The first time it enters a creature's space during this move, that creature must make a {@dc 19} Dexterity saving throw. On a failure, a creature takes 54 ({@damage 12d8}) slashing damage and is {@condition stunned} until the end of its next turn. If the dawnfly's wings are ignited from Winged Inferno, the creature takes an extra 14 ({@damage 4d6}) fire damage. On a success, a creature takes half the damage and isn't {@condition stunned}.

bonus.name: Winged Inferno
entries: The dawnfly rapidly beats its wings igniting them until the start of its next turn. Its wings shed bright light in a 20-foot radius and dim light an additional 20 feet. A creature that touches the dawnfly or hits it with a melee attack while within 5 feet of it takes 7 ({@damage 2d6}) fire damage. In addition, when a creature starts its turn within 5 feet of the dawnfly, that creature must succeed on a {@dc 19} Dexterity saving throw or take 7 ({@damage 2d6}) fire damage. This effect ends early if the dawnfly stops flying.

legendary.name: Dust Burst
entries: The dawnfly's wings shed blinding dust within 10 feet of it. Each creature in the area must succeed on a {@dc 19} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition blinded} until the end of its next turn.

legendary.name: Fiery Downburst (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The dawnfly's wings beat furiously, releasing a downdraft of heated air in a 15-foot cone. Each creature in the area must make a {@dc 19} Strength saving throw. On a failure, a creature takes 9 ({@damage 2d8}) bludgeoning damage and 7 ({@damage 2d6}) fire damage, is pushed up to 15 feet away from the dawnfly in a direction following the cone, and is knocked {@condition prone}. On a success, a creature takes half the damage and isn't pushed or knocked {@condition prone}.

legendary.name: Snatch and Drop (Costs 3 Actions)
entries: The dawnfly flies up to half its flying speed, making one Tail attack at a creature within its reach along the way. If the attack hits, the creature is {@condition grappled} and carried with the dawnfly, which immediately drops the creature at the end of the movement. The creature takes falling damage, as normal.

trait.name: Limited Amphibiousness
entries: The desolation nymph can breathe air and water, but it needs to be submerged at least once every 4 hours to avoid {@quickref suffocating||2}.

trait.name: Shifting Camouflage
entries: The desolation nymph's carapace adapts to its current surroundings. The nymph has advantage on Dexterity ({@skill Stealth}) checks made to hide in nonmagical, natural terrain.

action.name: Hinged Maw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 15 ft., one creature. {@h}14 ({@damage 2d10 + 3}) piercing damage. If the target is a Medium or smaller creature, it is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 13}) and pulled to within 5 feet of the nymph. Until this grapple ends, the target is {@condition restrained}, and the desolation nymph can't use its Hinged Maw on another target.

action.name: Swallow
entries: The desolation nymph makes one Hinged Maw attack against a Medium or smaller target it is grappling. If the attack hits, the target is also swallowed, and the grapple ends. While swallowed, the target is {@condition blinded} and {@condition restrained}, it has total cover against attacks and other effects outside the nymph, and it takes 7 ({@damage 2d6}) acid damage at the start of each of the nymph's turns. The nymph can have only one creature swallowed at a time.
If the desolation nymph dies, a swallowed creature is no longer {@condition restrained} by it and can escape from the corpse using 5 feet of movement, exiting {@condition prone}.

bonus.name: Water Jet
entries: The desolation nymph takes the {@action Disengage} action, and each creature within 5 feet of the nymph must succeed a {@dc 13} Dexterity saving throw or be {@condition blinded} until the end of its next turn.

trait.name: Detect Life
entries: The death worm can sense the general direction of creatures that aren't Constructs or Undead within 1 mile of it.

trait.name: Discharge
entries: When a creature ends its turn within 5 feet of a death worm, the creature takes 2 ({@damage 1d4}) lightning damage.

trait.name: Dreaming Venom
entries: The death worm's poison influences the dreams of those poisoned by it. A creature that succumbs to this poison has disadvantage on Wisdom saving throws and suffers strange dreams. Every 24 hours that elapse, it must repeat the saving throw, reducing its hp maximum by 2 ({@damage 1d4}) on a failure. The poison is neutralized on a success. The target dies if dreaming venom reduces its hp maximum to 0. This reduction lasts until the poison is neutralized.

trait.name: Lightning Arc
entries: When a creature starts its turn within 15 feet of at least two death worms, the creature must succeed on a {@dc 14} Dexterity saving throw or take 5 ({@damage 2d4}) lightning damage. The creature has disadvantage on the saving throw if it is within 15 feet of three or more death worms.

trait.name: Regeneration
entries: The death worm regains 3 hp at the start of its turn if it has at least 1 hp.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d4 + 2}) piercing damage plus 2 ({@damage 1d4}) lightning damage and 4 ({@damage 1d8}) poison damage, and the target must succeed on a {@dc 12} Constitution saving throw or succumb to the worm's venom (see the Dreaming Venom trait).

action.name: Spit Poison
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 4} to hit, range 15/30 ft., one creature. {@h}9 ({@damage 2d8}) poison damage, and the target must succeed on a {@dc 12} Constitution saving throw or succumb to the worm's venom (see the Dreaming Venom trait).

trait.name: Aquatic Invisibility
entries: The balbazu is {@condition invisible} while fully immersed in water.

trait.name: Blood Reservoir
entries: The balbazu stores drained blood within itself. Each time it causes blood loss to a creature, the balbazu's Blood Reservoir increases by an amount equal to the hp of blood it drained from the creature.

trait.name: Demon Food
entries: A demon within 5 feet of the balbazu and that isn't another balbazu can use a bonus action to reduce the Blood Reservoir by up to 10, regaining hp equal to that amount as it drinks blood from the reservoir.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The balbazu has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}10 ({@damage 2d6 + 3}) piercing damage, and the balbazu attaches to the target. While attached, the balbazu doesn't attack. Instead, at the start of each of the balbazu's turns, the target loses 10 ({@damage 2d6 + 3}) hp from blood loss. When the balbazu first attaches to the target and each time the target loses hp from blood loss, the target must succeed on a {@dc 11} Constitution saving throw or be unaware of the attack (and the balbazu if it is invisible). The target is still aware of the hp loss, but it feels no pain from the attack. On a success, the target is aware of the attack and the balbazu and doesn't need to continue making this saving throw while the balbazu remains attached to it.

The balbazu regains hp equal to half the hp of blood it drains. The balbazu can detach itself by spending 5 feet of its movement. A creature that is aware of the balbazu, including the target, can use its action to detach the balbazu.

trait.name: Amorphous
entries: The inciter demon can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide without squeezing.

trait.name: Aura of Distrust
entries: The inciter demon radiates a psychic aura that causes creatures to doubt the intentions of their friends. Each creature within 30 feet of the inciter that isn't a Fiend has disadvantage on Wisdom ({@skill Insight}) checks. When a creature enters the aura's area for the first time on a turn or starts its turn there, that creature must make a {@dc 13} Charisma saving throw. On a failure, any spell cast by the creature can't affect allies or friendly creatures, including spells already in effect, such as bless, while it remains in the aura. In addition, the creature can't use the {@action Help} action or accept assistance from a friendly creature, including assistance from spells, such as bless or cure wounds, while it remains in the aura.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The inciter demon makes two Claw attacks.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) piercing damage.

action.name: Inspire Violence {@recharge 5}
entries: The inciter demon whispers to a creature within 5 feet of it that can hear it, stoking paranoia and hatred. The creature must succeed on a {@dc 13} Charisma saving throw or it uses its next action to make one attack against a creature that both the target and the inciter demon can see. A creature immune to being {@condition charmed} isn't affected by the inciter demon's Inspire Violence.

bonus.name: Invisibility
entries: The inciter demon magically turns {@condition invisible} until it attacks, or until its concentration ends (as if concentrating on a spell). Any equipment the inciter wears or carries is {@condition invisible} with it.
A humanoid wisp of flame and smoke briefly appears and then vanishes again. It slips through the gathered assembly, sowing discord and inspiring violence with its hissing words.

Inciter demons are the embodiment of malicious mischief. They are wicked fiends whose only love is to disrupt the social ties between other creatures. Their whispers spoil trust and goodwill, and domineering mages employ them to ruin important alliances and turn former friends toward infighting and hostility.

entries.name: Flame Form
entries: An inciter demon's true form is that of a slender humanoid figure of cold flames and smoke. The only sign that an inciter is to blame for a breakdown in diplomacy is the flicker of fire that appears before they vanish, as they retreat to delight in what they have wrought.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The kogukhpak has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Standing Leap
entries: The kogukhpak's long jump is up to 30 feet and its high jump is up to 15 feet, with or without a running start.

trait.name: Sunlight Hypersensitivity
entries: The kogukhpak takes 20 radiant damage when it starts its turn in sunlight. While in sunlight, it has disadvantage on attack rolls and ability checks.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The kogukhpak makes one Bite attack and two Gore attacks, or it makes three Spit Fire attacks.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 16} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}19 ({@damage 2d8 + 10}) bludgeoning damage plus 9 ({@damage 2d8}) fire damage, and the target is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 18}). Until this grapple ends, the target is {@condition restrained}, the kogukhpak can automatically hit the target with its Bite, and the kogukhpak can't make Bite attacks against other targets.

action.name: Gore
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 16} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}37 ({@damage 5d10 + 10}) piercing damage.

action.name: Spit Fire
entries: {@atk rs} {@hit 11} to hit, range 120 ft., one target. {@h}32 ({@damage 6d8 + 5}) fire damage.

action.name: Devastating Leap {@recharge 6}
entries: The kogukhpak leaps up to 30 feet and lands on its feet in a space it can see. Each creature in the space or within 5 feet of the kogukhpak when it lands must make a {@dc 20} Strength saving throw. On a failure, a creature takes 72 ({@damage 16d8}) bludgeoning damage and is knocked {@condition prone}. On a success, a creature takes half the damage, isn't knocked {@condition prone}, and, if it is in the kogukhpak's space, can choose to be pushed 5 feet back or to the side of the kogukhpak. A creature in the kogukhpak's space that chooses not to be pushed suffers the consequences of a failed saving throw.

action.name: Fire Breath {@recharge 6}
entries: The kogukhpak exhales fire in a 90-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a {@dc 20} Dexterity saving throw, taking 70 ({@damage 20d6}) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.
Tusks jut from the jaw of this massive albino toad, and small, spiky horns rise from above its demonic eyes.

Kogukhpak demons are massive toad-like creatures with mammoth tusks and a bottomless cauldron of untamed flame deep within their bellies. They are typically found in colder climes, which helps keep the raging fires within in check. They inhabit deep caverns to avoid the sun and visit the surface only at night to hunt.

entries.name: Enemy of the Light
entries: In the cold, far north, the nights are long and winter nearly interminable. This allows the kogukhpak to hunt and kill at its leisure, rarely having to fear its only true weakness: sunlight. During the summer, when daylight rarely ceases, the fiend remains underground.

entries.name: Voracious Killer
entries: The kogukhpak is a scourge to all it encounters. The fiend will attack and devour anyone or anything it comes across while hunting, to fuel the incessant fires within it. A koguhkpak eats everything, leaving little trace except blood and signs of struggle, with occasionally ashes or burnt grasses. Remnants of a settlement destroyed by a seemingly sourceless flame are a sure sign of a kogukhpak.

trait.name: Amphibious
entries: The leech demon can breathe air and water.

trait.name: Blood Sense
entries: The leech demon can pinpoint, by scent, the location of creatures that aren't Constructs or Undead within 30 feet of it.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The leech demon has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The leech demon makes one Bite attack and two Tentacle Bite attacks, or it makes two Bite attacks.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}14 ({@damage 3d6 + 4}) piercing damage plus 9 ({@damage 2d8}) necrotic damage.

action.name: Tentacle Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 2d6 + 4}) piercing damage and 4 ({@damage 1d8}) necrotic damage, and the leech demon can attach its tentacle to the target. The demon has two tentacles, each of which can attach to only one target. While a tentacle is attached, the demon can't use that tentacle to make Tentacle Bite attacks, the target is {@condition restrained}, and the demon doesn't attack with the tentacle. Instead, at the start of each of the demon's turns, each creature with a tentacle attached to it loses 11 ({@damage 2d6 + 4}) hp due to blood loss, and the demon gains temporary hp equal to that amount. The demon can add temporary hp gained from this attack together and can add it to temporary hp gained from Release Swarm. The demon's temporary hp can't exceed half its hp maximum.
The leech demon can detach one or both tentacles as a bonus action. A creature, including the target, can use its action to detach the demon's tentacle by succeeding on a {@dc 17} Strength check.

action.name: Release Swarm {@recharge 5}
entries: The leech demon shakes loose dozens of leeches, creating a {@creature leech swarm|ToB2} (or use a {@creature swarm of poisonous snakes}). The swarm acts as an ally of the leech demon and obeys its spoken commands. The swarm remains for 1 minute, until the leech demon dies, or until the demon dismisses it as a bonus action. If the leech demon is within 5 feet of the swarm, it can use its action to consume the swarm, gaining temporary hp equal to the swarm's current hp. It can add temporary hp gained in this way with temporary hp gained from its Tentacle Bite attack. The demon's temporary hp can't exceed half its hp maximum. The demon can have only one swarm active at one time.
Hundreds of leeches cling to and crawl around this serpentine creature, which has a toothy maw filling most of its face. It raises two tentacles, revealing similar toothy maws lining each tentacle.

Leech demons prefer to spend their time on the Material Plane, where their unsettling appearance draws more of a reaction and where they can better inflict suffering. They especially enjoy infesting their victims' bodies with leeches, which burst forth from the corpses to wreck havoc on the victims' loved ones.

entries.name: Implements of Swampland Revenge
entries: Rumors proliferate about rituals to summon leech demons to right a grievous wrong. The demons gleefully wreak vengeance on their targets and try to ensure their summoners witness the gruesome deaths. The stories fail to disclose the demons demand a price from their callers, usually paid by the life of someone dear to them. Only the most desperate benefit from calling leech demons for retribution, as they often have no problem offering themselves up as payment when the demons complete their deeds.

trait.name: Frozen Aura
entries: When a creature enters a space within 30 feet of the maha or starts its turn there, that creature must succeed on a {@dc 17} Constitution saving throw or have its speed reduced by 10 feet until it starts its turn outside the aura.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The maha has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Snow Camouflage
entries: The maha has advantage on Dexterity ({@skill Stealth}) made to hide in snowy or icy terrain.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The maha makes three Claw attacks. If the maha hits one creature with two Claw attacks, the target must succeed on a {@dc 17} Wisdom saving throw or chuckle until the end of its next turn. While chuckling, a creature can't speak coherently, can't cast spells with verbal components, and has disadvantage on attack rolls with weapons that use Strength or Dexterity.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}14 ({@damage 3d6 + 4}) piercing damage plus 9 ({@damage 2d8}) cold damage.

action.name: Deadly Laughter {@recharge 5}
entries: The maha chuckles, giggles, and chortles at nearby creatures. Each creature within 30 feet of the maha must make a {@dc 17} Wisdom saving throw. On a failure, a creature takes 42 ({@damage 12d6}) psychic damage, drops whatever it is holding, and laughs for 1 minute. On a success, a creature takes half the damage and doesn't drop whatever it is holding or laugh. While laughing, a creature is {@condition incapacitated}, can't speak coherently, and takes 7 ({@damage 2d6}) psychic damage at the start of each of its turns. A laughing creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a creature dies while laughing, its face turns pale blue and displays a wide grin.
This emaciated creature with long, stringy black hair, milky white eyes, and pale blue skin squats in the snow. Its face is split in an almost too-wide grin.
Mahas are demons of the cold north, reveling in the snowy wastes but never far from civilization, which holds their preferred food source: humanoids.

entries.name: Laughing Nightmares
entries: Maha demons are always seen smiling, laughing, or giggling. They spread their malevolent hilarity wherever they go by tickling their victims with their claws, all the while tearing into flesh. The victims' bodies are said to retain that same grotesque and eternal smile on their cold and rigid faces.

entries.name: Sustained by Torment
entries: The ongoing torment mahas create sustains them. A maha will try to unsettle victims long before confronting them. By manipulating the environment and creating baffling and frightening conditions, the demon seeks to slowly build a feeling of terror. A maha often ambushes single travelers or picks off stragglers, separating them from their companions and building terror on multiple fronts.

entries.name: Not so Bright
entries: According to legends, maha demons are not terribly intelligent. Stories abound of travelers escaping mahas by tricking the demons into following false footsteps in the snow, attacking cloaked snow sculptures, or ambushing an empty campsite. Such deceptions often result in the loss of equipment or a reliable pack mule, but it is preferable to contending with the maha directly

trait.name: Corpse Stride
entries: Once on its turn, the vetala can use 10 feet of its movement to step magically into one corpse or Undead within its reach and emerge from a second corpse or Undead within 60 feet of the first, appearing in an unoccupied space within 5 feet of the second corpse or Undead.

trait.name: Graveyard Walker
entries: Difficult terrain composed of tombstones, grave dirt, corpses, or other objects or features common to graveyards and necropolises doesn't cost the vetala extra movement, and the vetala can move through graveyard objects and structures, such as sarcophaguses and mausoleums, as if they were difficult terrain. It takes 5 ({@damage 1d10}) force damage if it ends its turn inside an object.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The vetala has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Master of Undeath
entries: A Humanoid killed by the vetala or an Undead under its control rises 1 minute later as a {@creature skeleton} or {@creature zombie} (the vetala's choice), unless the Humanoid is restored to life or its body is destroyed. The vetala can have no more than 20 total {@creature skeleton||skeletons} and {@creature zombie||zombies} under its control at one time.

trait.name: Shepherd of Death
entries: When an Undead under the vetala's control hits with any weapon, the weapon deals an extra 4 ({@damage 1d8}) necrotic damage.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The vetala makes two Claw attacks.

action.name: Claws
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}12 ({@damage 2d6 + 5}) slashing damage plus 9 ({@damage 2d8}) necrotic damage.

action.name: Raise Corpse
entries: One Humanoid corpse the vetala can see within 30 feet of it rises as a {@creature skeleton} or {@creature zombie} (the vetala's choice) under the vetala's control.

bonus.name: Command Corpse
entries: The vetala commands one Undead under its control that it can see to make one weapon attack as a reaction. If it does so, the Undead has advantage on the attack roll.

reaction.name: Corpse Detonation
entries: When an Undead under the vetala'a control is reduced to 0 hp, the vetala can force it to explode. Each creature that isn't an Undead or the vetala within 5 feet of the exploding Undead must make a {@dc 15} Dexterity saving throw, taking 10 ({@damage 3d6}) bludgeoning (if zombie) or slashing (if skeleton) damage and 5 ({@damage 2d4}) poison damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.
This shadowy figure has eyes like two cinders and loose, flowing hair that seems buffeted by a gentle breeze. Its chest cavity burns with hellish light, and its hands end in wicked claws.

Vetala lurk in graveyards and battlefields, where they claim corpses to serve as minions. Capricious and vain, vetala demons occasionally make bargains to protect nearby villages, requiring villagers to provide regular sacrificial goods, while the demon keeps the corpses of any killed. These bargains state the vetala may claim the residents if the village fails to meet its obligations.

entries.name: Celebrators of the Necropolis
entries: Vetala are strangely vain about their occupied graveyards, wanting the graveyards to be decorated with strings of flowers, treats, and votive offerings. They never claim these objects themselves, but they viciously attack anyone attempting to steal the items. This vanity extends to the demon's minions, which stop decaying while controlled and eventually appear less decayed.

trait.name: Insanity
entries: The abysswalker has advantage on saving throws against being {@condition charmed} or {@condition frightened}.

trait.name: Poisonous Vapors
entries: When a creature enters a space within 5 feet of the abysswalker or starts its turn there, that creature must make a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw. On a failure, the creature takes 13 ({@damage 2d12}) poison damage and is {@condition poisoned} until the start of its next turn. On a success, the creature takes half the damage and isn't {@condition poisoned}.

trait.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
entries: While in sunlight, the abysswalker has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on sight.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The abysswalker makes one Bite attack, one Claw attack, and one Scimitar attack, or it makes one Bite attack and two Scimitar attacks.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d4 + 4}) piercing and 5 ({@damage 2d4}) poison damage.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 2d6 + 4}) bludgeoning, and the target is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 15}) if it is a Medium or smaller creature. Until this grapple ends, the target is {@condition restrained}, and the abysswalker can't make Claw attacks against other targets.

action.name: Scimitar
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d6 + 4}) slashing damage.

resist.note: from nonmagical attacks not made with silvered weapons

trait.name: Insanity
entries: The hellforged has advantage on saving throws against being {@condition charmed} or {@condition frightened}.

trait.name: Hellfire Weapons
entries: The hellforged's weapon attacks are magical. When the hellforged hits with any weapon, the weapon deals an extra {@damage 2d6} fire damage (included in the attack).

trait.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
entries: While in sunlight, the hellforged has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on sight.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The hellforged makes three Battleaxe or Hurl Hellfire attacks.

action.name: Battleaxe
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d8 + 3}) slashing damage, or 8 ({@damage 1d10 + 3}) slashing damage if used with two hands, plus 7 ({@damage 2d6}) fire damage.

action.name: Hurl Hellfire
entries: {@atk rs} {@hit 5} to hit, range 120 ft., one target. {@h}12 ({@damage 3d6 + 2}) fire damage. If the target is a creature or a flammable object, it ignites. Until a creature takes an action to douse the fire, the target takes 5 ({@damage 1d10}) fire damage at the start of each of its turns.

reaction.name: Voice of Authority {@recharge 5}
entries: When a creature hits the hellforged with an attack, the hellforged shrieks a one-word command. The attacker must succeed on a {@dc 15} Wisdom saving throw or carry out this command on its next turn. This reaction works like the {@spell command} spell, except the attacker doesn't have to understand the hellforged's language. The hellforged must see the attacker and be able to speak to use this reaction.

trait.name: Insanity
entries: The voidwarped has advantage on saving throws against being {@condition charmed} or {@condition frightened}.

trait.name: Mortal Void Traveler
entries: The voidwarped doesn't require air or ambient pressure.

trait.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
entries: While in sunlight, the voidwarped has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on sight.

trait.name: Void-Touched Weapons
entries: The voidwarped's weapon attacks are magical. When the voidwarped hits with any weapon, the weapon deals an extra {@damage 1d6} cold damage and {@damage 1d6} force damage (included in the attack).

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The voidwarped makes two Shortsword attacks and one Void Tendril attack.

action.name: Shortsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d6 + 4}) piercing damage plus 3 ({@damage 1d6}) cold damage and 3 ({@damage 1d6}) force damage.

action.name: Void Tendril
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 2d6}) bludgeoning damage plus 3 ({@damage 1d6}) cold damage and 3 ({@damage 1d6}) force damage. The target must succeed on a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw or its hp maximum is reduced by the amount equal to the damage taken. This reduction lasts until the target finishes a long rest. The target dies if this effect reduces its hp maximum to 0.

action.name: Void Speech Rant {@recharge 5}
entries: The voidwarped spews a tirade of {@language Void Speech|ToB3}. Each creature within 40 feet of it that can hear the tirade must make a {@dc 15} Wisdom saving throw. On a failure, a creature takes 27 ({@damage 5d10}) psychic damage and is {@condition incapacitated} until the end of its next turn. On a success, a creature takes half the damage and isn't {@condition incapacitated}.

trait.name: Amorphous
entries: The desert slime can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide without squeezing.

trait.name: False Appearance
entries: While the desert slime remains motionless, it is indistinguishable from ordinary sand.

trait.name: Ooze Nature
entries: The desert slime doesn't require sleep.

trait.name: Sandy Ooze
entries: The desert slime can occupy another creature's space and vice versa. Its space is difficult terrain for creatures traveling through it.

action.name: Pseudopod
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d8 + 3}) bludgeoning damage plus 10 ({@damage 3d6}) acid damage.

action.name: Mire
entries: One creature in the slime's space must make a {@dc 13} Dexterity saving throw. If a creature fails the saving throw by 5 or more, it is {@condition restrained} and knocked {@condition prone}. Otherwise, a creature that fails the save is {@condition restrained}, and the slime steadily creeps up the creature, dissolving and consuming its flesh. The {@condition restrained} creature must repeat the saving throw at the end of each of turns, being pulled {@condition prone} on a failure. A {@condition restrained} creature takes 10 ({@damage 3d6}) acid damage at the start of each of the slime's turns. If the {@condition restrained} creature is also {@condition prone}, it is unable to breathe or cast spells with verbal components. The slime can have only one creature mired at a time, and a mired creature moves with the slime when it moves.

A creature, including a {@condition restrained} target, can take its action to pull the {@condition restrained} creature out of the slime by succeeding on a {@dc 13} Strength check. The creature making the attempt takes 10 ({@damage 3d6}) acid damage.

bonus.name: Surging Sands {@recharge 4}
entries: The desert slime takes the {@action Dash} action.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: Despair and anger has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Ruled by Sorrow (Despair Only)
entries: Despair and anger has advantage on saving throws against being {@condition charmed} and {@condition frightened}.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Despair and anger makes three Blazing Fist or Shadow Tendril attacks, or it makes three Divine Bolt attacks.

action.name: Blazing Fist (Anger Only)
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d8 + 4}) bludgeoning damage plus 7 (2d6fire damage and 7 ({@damage 2d6}) radiant damage.

action.name: Shadow Tendril (Despair Only)
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 2d6 + 4}) bludgeoning damage plus 7 ({@damage 2d6}) necrotic damage, and the target is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 16}). Until this grapple ends, the target is {@condition restrained}. Despair and anger has three shadow tendrils, each of which can grapple only one target. At the start of each of despair and anger's turns, each creature {@condition grappled} by it takes 7 ({@damage 2d6}) necrotic damage, and despair and anger regains hp equal to half the total necrotic damage dealt.

action.name: Divine Bolt
entries: {@atk rs} {@hit 8} to hit, range 120 ft., one target. {@h}22 ({@damage 4d8 + 4}) necrotic damage (if despair is active) or radiant damage (if anger is active).

action.name: Burning Rage (Anger Only) {@recharge 5}
entries: Despair and anger releases a burst of burning anger. Each creature within 30 feet of it must make a {@dc 16} Dexterity saving throw, taking 21 ({@damage 6d6}) fire damage and 21 ({@damage 6d6}) radiant damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

action.name: Despairing Rejection (Despair Only) {@recharge 4}
entries: Despair and anger assaults the minds of up to three creatures it can see within 30 feet of it with cold despair. Each target must make a {@dc 16} Wisdom saving throw. On a failure, a creature takes 17 ({@damage 5d6}) cold damage and 17 ({@damage 5d6}) psychic damage and must use its reaction to move its full speed away from despair and anger by the safest available route, unless there is nowhere to move. This movement doesn't provoke {@action opportunity attack||opportunity attacks}. On a success, a creature takes half the damage and doesn't move away from despair and anger.

bonus.name: Change Aspect
entries: Despair and anger changes which aspect is in control. It can have only one aspect active at a time. A creature {@condition grappled} by the despair aspect is no longer {@condition grappled} if anger becomes the aspect in control.

monster.name: Iorvensiav, Lady of the Unforgiving Cold

resist.note: from nonmagical attacks not made with silvered weapons

trait.name: Amphibious
entries: Iorvensiav can breathe air and water.

trait.name: Death Throes
entries: When Iorvensiav dies, she explodes, and each creature within 30 feet of her must make a {@dc 21} Constitution saving throw, taking 70 ({@damage 20d6}) cold damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. The explosion freezes objects in the area that aren't being worn or carried, encapsulating them in ice.

trait.name: Freezing Weapons
entries: Iorvensiav's weapon attacks are magical. When she hits with any weapon, the weapon deals an extra {@damage 2d6} cold damage (included in the attack).

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries: If Iorvensiav fails a saving throw, she can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: Iorvensiav has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Iorvensiav makes one Bite attack and two Claw attacks. She can replace one Claw attack with a Freezing Chain attack.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 16} to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. {@h}20 ({@damage 2d10 + 9}) piercing damage and 7 ({@damage 2d6}) cold damage.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 16} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}16 ({@damage 2d6 + 9}) slashing damage and 7 ({@damage 2d6}) cold damage.

action.name: Freezing Chain
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 16} to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. {@h}16 ({@damage 2d6 + 9}) slashing damage plus 7 ({@damage 2d6}) cold damage, and the target is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 21}). Until this grapple ends, the target is {@condition restrained} and takes 14 ({@damage 4d6}) cold damage at the start of each of its turns, and Iorvensiav can't make Freezing Chain attacks against other targets.

action.name: Tail
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 16} to hit, reach 20 ft., one target. {@h}18 ({@damage 2d8 + 9}) slashing damage and 7 ({@damage 2d6}) cold damage. This attack ignores resistance to slashing damage, and if Iorvensiav rolls a 20 on the attack roll, she cuts off one of the target's heads. The target dies if it can't survive without the lost head. If the target doesn't have a head or can't be decapitated, it takes an extra 27 ({@damage 6d6}) slashing damage instead.

action.name: Thundering Ice Breath {@recharge 5}
entries: Iorvensiav exhales a booming, frigid spray in a 90-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a {@dc 21} Constitution saving throw, taking 45 ({@damage 8d10}) cold damage and 45 ({@damage 8d10}) thunder damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. A creature that fails the saving throw by 5 or more is {@condition stunned} until the end of its next turn.

bonus.name: Change Shape
entries: Iorvensiav magically transforms into any Beast, Fiend, or Humanoid that is Huge or smaller or back into her true form. Her statistics, other than her size, are the same in each form. Any equipment she is wearing or carrying transforms with her or is borne by the new form (Iorvensiav's choice). She reverts to her true form if she dies.

legendaryGroup.name: Iorvensiav, Lady of the Unforgiving Cold

legendaryHeader: Iorvensiav can take 3 legendary actions, choosing from the options below. Only one legendary action can be used at a time and only at the end of another creature's turn. Iorvensiav regains spent legendary actions at the start of her turn.

legendary.name: Detect
entries: Iorvensiav makes a Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) check.

legendary.name: Tail Attack
entries: Iorvensiav makes a tail attack.

legendary.name: Chilling Wings (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: Iorvensiav beats her wings, releasing a blast of icy wind. Each creature within 15 feet of her must succeed on a {@dc 21} Constitution saving throw or take 14 ({@damage 4d6}) cold damage and be {@condition stunned} until the end of its next turn. Iorvensiav can then fly up to half her flying speed.

This serpentine fiend sprouts four pairs of limbs along her length, and horns of faceted ice adorn her dragon-like head. When moving, her scales scintillate in patterns of frostbite black, glacier blue, and snowy white. A glittering diamond point marks the end of her thrashing tail, and a spiked chain of frosty steel hangs from her clawed hands.

Iorvensiav, Lady of the Unforgiving Cold, is master of the frozen hells and queen of frigid deaths. In those infernal places where fires do not burn, the cold is so terrible it can set mortal bones and flesh ablaze.

entries.name: Last of Her Kind
entries: Even Iorvensiav no longer recalls her origins. Some in the hells whisper she was once a dragon, tortured and reshaped by her own request to become the frigid power she is today. Others say she is the last of a species that once roamed the frozen wildlands deep within various hellscapes, the others having long since turned to dust.

entries.name: Cold and Calculating
entries: Iorvensiav often holds herself aloof, watching from a distance and gauging the odds of her opportunities. She watches for any options that give her a firmer hold on her growing power in the hells. The chill she wears like a cloak is only a mask, however. Inside, the Lady of Unforgiving Cold is a raging inferno, capable of sudden violence when she is displeased.

entries.name: Her Shiny Hoard
entries: Similar to dragons, Iorvensiav keeps a hoard. Instead of coins, jewels, and other wealth, she gathers frozen souls to her lair. These souls are strewn throughout her mountain kingdom as frozen carvings, depicting how the creatures appeared in life.

entries.name: Children of Iorvensiav
entries: Throughout history, Iorvensiav has spread her influence amongst mortals. Those gifted with her power or bloodline produce descendants with fiendish traits. The skin of these tieflings is bluish-white like ice or blackish-purple like frostbite, and their horns are always crystalline, as if they were sculpted from ice. The tieflings may have patches of scales or be scaled from head to toe. To create a {@race tiefling (iorvensiav)|ToB3|tiefling} character from Iorvensiav's lineage, replace the base {@race tiefling||tiefling's} Hellish Resistance and Infernal Legacy traits with the following traits:

entries.name: Frozen Resistance
entries: You have resistance to cold damage.

entries.name: Iorvensiav's Legacy
entries: You know the {@spell message} cantrip. When you reach 3rd level, you can cast the {@spell hellish rebuke} spell, dealing cold damage in place of fire damage, as a 2nd‑level spell once with this trait and regain the ability to do so when you finish a long rest. When you reach 5th level, you can cast the {@spell alter self} spell once with this trait and regain the ability to do so when you finish a long rest. Charisma is your spellcasting ability for these spells.

entries.name: Iorvensiav in Midgard
entries: Iorvensiav rules a portion of the plane known as Efrizarr. Other arch-devils that share the realm with her regard her as an ally at best or competition at worst. Some view her as a pet who was let off its leash. The latter are the fiends Iorvensiav works hardest to bring down, crushing them beneath her machinations.

entries.name: Iorvensiav's Lair
entries: A mountain of ice rises up from a hellish plain of frost. Within the mountain, at the center of a fiend-riddled labyrinth, a glimmering, cylindrical chamber of cyclopean proportions reaches from the mountain's depths to its peak. Iorvensiav resides in this chamber, hoarding souls as she grows in power.

resist.note: from nonmagical attacks not made with silvered weapons

trait.name: Devil's Sight
entries: Magical darkness doesn't impede the juggler's {@sense darkvision}.

trait.name: Dizzying Movement
entries: If the juggler moves at least 15 feet on a turn, each creature that can see the movement must succeed on a {@dc 18} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition poisoned} until the end of its next turn.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The juggler has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Standing Leap
entries: The juggler's long jump is up to 30 feet and its high jump is up to 15 feet, with or without a running start.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The juggler makes three Deft Touch or Devilflame Sphere attacks. If the juggler hits one creature with two Deft Touch or two Devilflame Sphere attacks, the target must succeed on a {@dc 18} Wisdom saving throw or be {@condition frightened} until the end of its next turn.

action.name: Deft Touch
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}15 ({@damage 3d6 + 5}) slashing damage plus 9 ({@damage 2d8}) fire damage. Instead of dealing damage, the juggler can steal one item the target is wearing or carrying, provided the item weighs no more than 15 pounds and isn't wrapped around or firmly attached to the target, such as a shirt or belt.

action.name: Devilflame Sphere
entries: {@atk rs} {@hit 9} to hit, range 120 ft., one target. {@h}22 ({@damage 4d8 + 4}) fire damage.

action.name: Fiery Flourish {@recharge 5}
entries: The juggler tosses a ball of hellfire at a creature it can see within 90 feet of it. The target must make a {@dc 18} Dexterity saving throw, taking 45 ({@damage 10d8}) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. The ball then splits and bounces to up to four creatures within 30 feet of the target. Each of these creatures must make a {@dc 18} Dexterity saving throw, taking 22 ({@damage 5d8}) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. This fire ignites flammable objects that aren't being worn or carried and that are between each of the targets.

bonus.name: Nimble Leap
entries: The juggler takes the {@action Dash} or {@action Disengage} action.

reaction.name: Uncanny Dodge
entries: The juggler halves the damage from an attack that hits it. The juggler must be able to see the attacker.
A four-armed devil with hands for feet and a grinning face for a torso leaps to and fro, juggling balls of fire.

Insolent bards who die and end up in Hell become twisted caricatures of themselves called devilflame jugglers. Large but very nimble, these fiends bounce around on six hands attached to limbs that extend from a grinning, diabolical visage in its torso. From this torso, the creature belches orbs of hellfire fueled by the souls of entertainers who sold theirs for notoriety.

entries.name: Bound by Absurd Law
entries: Punished by eons-old infernal contracts, devilflame jugglers are victims in their own bodies, constantly on fire inside and compelled by contract to leap about for others' amusement. To cease moving spells disaster, as more powerful, and sadistic, devils descend upon it to force it back into capering and entertaining.

entries.name: Gifts Among Princes
entries: Devilflame jugglers serve as entertainers to demons, other devils, or {@creature efreeti} on the Plane of Fire, and popular ones are given as gifts. While performing, they are often ordered to distract their hosts to free up other devilish spies for diabolical plots.

resist.note: from nonmagical attacks not made with silvered weapons

trait.name: Devil's Sight
entries: Magical darkness doesn't impede the infernal tutor's {@sense darkvision}.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The infernal tutor has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Weaken Resolve
entries: The infernal tutor's speech is laced with subtle enchantments that make its words seem logical or profound, regardless of the actual words used. It has advantage on Charisma ({@skill Deception}) and Charisma ({@skill Persuasion}) checks against Humanoids.

In addition, if the infernal tutor spends at least 1 minute conversing with a Humanoid, that creature has disadvantage on saving throws against the infernal tutor's Fiendish Tutelage and against enchantment spells the tutor casts.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The infernal tutor makes three Claw or Tutor's Baton attacks, or it makes one Claw attack and two Tutor's Baton attacks. It can replace one attack with a use of Spellcasting.

action.name: Claw (True Form Only)
entries: {@atk mw} 进行攻击，达到5英尺，一个目标。 {@h}12 ({@damage 2d8 + 3}) 斩击伤害。

action.name: Tutor's Baton
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 2d6 + 3}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Fiendish Tutelage {@recharge 5}
entries: The infernal tutor speaks fiendish teachings. Each creature within 15 feet of the tutor and that can hear it must make a {@dc 15} Charisma saving throw, taking 35 ({@damage 10d6}) psychic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

bonus.name: Change Shape
entries: The infernal tutor magically transforms into a Small or Medium Humanoid, or back into its true, fiendish form. Its statistics, other than its size, are the same in each form. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying isn't transformed. It reverts to its true form if it dies.

reaction.name: Strength of Character
entries: When the infernal tutor succeeds on an Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma saving throw, the tutor responds with a scathing magical insult if the source of the effect is a creature within 60 feet of the tutor. That creature must succeed on a {@dc 15} Wisdom saving throw or take 7 ({@damage 2d6}) psychic damage and have disadvantage on the next saving throw it makes against a spell cast by the infernal tutor.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The infernal tutor casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save {@dc 15}):

resist.note: from nonmagical attacks not made with silvered weapons

trait.name: Devil's Sight
entries: Magical darkness doesn't impede the infernal tutor's {@sense darkvision}.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The infernal tutor has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Phrenic Weapons
entries: The infernal tutor's weapon attacks are magical. When the tutor hits with any weapon, the weapon deals an extra {@damage 4d6} psychic damage (included in the attack).

trait.name: Weaken Resolve
entries: The infernal tutor's speech is laced with subtle enchantments that make its words seem logical or profound, regardless of the actual words used. It has advantage on Charisma ({@skill Deception}) and Charisma ({@skill Persuasion}) checks against Humanoids.

In addition, if the infernal tutor spends at least 1 minute conversing with a Humanoid, that creature has disadvantage on saving throws against the infernal tutor's Fiendish Indoctrination and against enchantment spells the tutor casts.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The infernal tutor makes three Claw or Tutor's Baton attacks, or it makes one Claw attack and two Tutor's Baton attacks. It can replace one attack with a use of Spellcasting.

action.name: Claw (True Form Only)
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}12 ({@damage 2d8 + 3}) slashing damage plus 14 ({@damage 4d6}) psychic damage.

action.name: Tutor's Baton
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 2d6 + 3}) bludgeoning damage plus 14 ({@damage 4d6}) psychic damage. Instead of dealing psychic damage, the infernal tutor can cause the target to become {@condition incapacitated} until the end of the target's next turn.

action.name: Fiendish Indoctrination {@recharge 5}
entries: The infernal tutor speaks fiendish ideals couched in persuasive, scholarly language. Each creature within 30 feet of the tutor must make a {@dc 18} Charisma saving throw. On a failure, a creature takes 45 ({@damage 13d6}) psychic damage and is {@condition charmed} for 1 minute. On a success, a creature takes half the damage and isn't {@condition charmed}. A {@condition charmed} creature isn't under the tutor's control, but it regards the tutor as a trusted friend, taking the tutor's requests or actions in the most favorable way it can. A {@condition charmed} creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

A creature that fails the saving throw by 5 or more is {@condition charmed} for 1 day instead. Such a creature can repeat the saving throw only when it suffers harm or receives a suicidal command, ending the effect on a success.

bonus.name: Change Shape
entries: The infernal tutor magically transforms into a Small or Medium Humanoid, or back into its true, fiendish form. Its statistics, other than its size, are the same in each form. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying isn't transformed. It reverts to its true form if it dies.

reaction.name: Strength of Character
entries: When the infernal tutor succeeds on a saving throw, the tutor responds with a scathing magical insult, if the source of the effect is a creature within 60 feet of the tutor. That creature must succeed on a {@dc 18} Wisdom saving throw or take 14 ({@damage 4d6}) psychic damage and have disadvantage on the next saving throw it makes against a spell cast by the infernal tutor.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The infernal tutor casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save {@dc 18}):

trait.name: Devil's Sight
entries: Magical darkness doesn't impede the maelstrom devil's {@sense darkvision}.

trait.name: Influence Weather
entries: Nearby weather responds to the maelstrom devil's desires. At the start of each minute, the maelstrom devil can choose to change the precipitation and wind within 1 mile of it by one stage, up or down (no action required). This effect works like the changing weather conditions aspect of the {@spell control weather} spell, except the maelstrom devil can't change the temperature and the conditions change immediately.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The devil has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The devil makes three Claws attacks and one Tempest Trident attack, or it makes three Lightning Ray attacks.

action.name: Claws
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 2d6 + 3}) slashing damage.

action.name: Tempest Trident
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}16 ({@damage 2d12 + 3}) piercing damage plus 7 ({@damage 2d6}) cold damage. A creature hit by this attack must succeed on a {@dc 16} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone} by a gust of wind channeled through the trident.

action.name: Lightning Ray
entries: {@atk rs} {@hit 8} to hit, range 150 ft., one target. {@h}18 ({@damage 4d8}) lightning damage.

action.name: Crown of Water (1/Day)
entries: The water on the maelstrom devil's head erupts in a geyser. Each creature within 10 feet of the devil must make a {@dc 16} Constitution saving throw, taking 35 ({@damage 10d6}) cold damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. For 1 minute, when a creature enters a space within 10 feet of the devil for the first time on a turn or starts its turn there, that creature must succeed on a {@dc 16} Constitution saving throw or take 10 ({@damage 3d6}) cold damage.
Razor-sharp claws tip the long arms of this coralline fiend, and a crown of flowing water adorns its head. It raises a rusted trident in fury, and the wind rises into a tumultuous gale around it.

Maelstrom devils are fiends who largely dwell on the Material Plane. Unconcerned with the ever-shifting politics of Hell, they lair within dangerous shoals, war-torn waters, and remote shipping lanes. These devils are brute-force manipulators, unleashing horrible storms and suborned monsters upon passing ships, then roping mortals into their schemes with promises of safe passage and personal profit.

entries.name: Tempestuous Extortionists
entries: Maelstrom devils can control the weather, conjuring horrific storms or becalming unruly seas. They use this to beset merchant vessels and ferries with sudden hurricanes and rough seas before offering to quell the storm if the captain will do as the devil asks. Compliant captains find that their ships sail safely, and they make record profits, as competitors find their own shipments running aground or delayed by unseasonable storms. Others, as well as any captains who try to go back on their deal with the devil, are killed.

entries.name: Labyrinthine Manipulators
entries: Maelstrom devils aren't concerned with the damnation of individual souls, instead preferring to use their network of blackmailed captains and subverted ships to spread misery on a larger scale. They ensure that food fails to reach starving cities, that vital medicine never reaches those who need it most, and that the families of all aboard the nearest vessel never see their loved ones again.

trait.name: Devil's Sight
entries: Magical darkness doesn't impede the moldering devil's {@sense darkvision}.

trait.name: Field Hopper
entries: The moldering devil can fly up to 40 feet on its turn, but it must start and end its movement on a solid surface, such as a roof or the ground. If it is flying at the end of its turn, it falls to the ground and takes falling damage.

trait.name: Rotting Death
entries: When the moldering devil dies, all foodstuffs, water, and beverages within 100 feet of it are subjected to the devil's Touch of Rot trait.

trait.name: Touch of Rot
entries: Any foodstuff, water, or beverage, whether fresh or preserved, that comes into contact with the moldering devil immediately decays and becomes inedible or undrinkable. If a creature consumes such food or drink, it must make a {@dc 11} Constitution saving throw. On a failure, it takes 7 ({@damage 2d6}) poison damage and is {@condition poisoned} for 24 hours. On a success, it takes half the damage and is {@condition poisoned} for 1 hour.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d4 + 2}) piercing plus 3 ({@damage 1d6}) necrotic damage.

Scabrous flesh and tufts of bristly hair sheath this devil from the tip of its piglike snout to the ends of its well-muscled legs. A pair of insectile wings lies flat against its back, and rows of needle teeth fill its gaping maw.

Moldering devils are a fiendish blight on the farmlands and grasslands. A region rarely suffers from the presence of just one of the pests, as they tend to arrive in an area in groups numbering a dozen or more.

entries.name: Devilish Hands
entries: Moldering devils are rarely the architects of their own mischief. They act at the command of a more powerful fiend, usually a {@creature spined devil} or {@creature bearded devil}, though occasionally a favored {@creature imp} is given command. Often their presence frightens a farming community into handing control over to an infernal overseer, who then exercises its influence over the populace to increase its personal power.

entries.name: Dealers of Despair
entries: A lone moldering devil can ruin a farmstead in a single season. A group of the fiends can ruin a village in the same amount of time, turning it into a ghost town. On a personal level, moldering devils enjoy exchanging the promise of their absence for the souls of the mortals they would otherwise victimize. They have a morbid sense of humor, and they relish pitting mortals against one another. A moldering devil might grant a mortal the opportunity to alleviate the mortal's suffering by providing the names and locations of rival farmers for the devil to target instead.

entries.name: Moldering Devils in Midgard
entries: Moldering devils hail from Bzeletalet, the Buzzing Hell of Insects, or less often from Fleggesun, the Fetid Hell of Cannibal Rot. In the mortal realms, they are often encountered alongside tosculi raiders and accompanied by fiendish wasps and locusts. Wealthy farming communities, such as those bordering the River Nuria, find the threat of moldering devils so great, they hire mercenaries to protect all nearby farmland the moment a single moldering devil is spotted.

resist.note: from nonmagical attacks not made with silvered weapons

trait.name: Devil's Sight
entries: Magical darkness doesn't impede the rimepacted's {@sense darkvision}.

trait.name: Frigid Vortex
entries: The rimepacted emits a swirl of cold wind extending in a 15-foot radius around it. Each creature that enters the wind's area for the first time on a turn or starts its turn there must succeed on a {@dc 15} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}. The wind is nonmagical and disperses gas or vapor and extinguishes candles, torches, and similar unprotected flames in the area. At the start of each of its turns, the rimepacted chooses whether this wind is active. While the wind is active, the rimepacted has disadvantage on Dexterity ({@skill Stealth}) checks.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The rimepacted has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Snow Burrower
entries: The rimepacted can burrow only through nonmagical snow and ice.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The rimepacted makes two Icy Claw attacks or three Frostbolt attacks.

action.name: Icy Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 1d10 + 4}) slashing damage plus 10 ({@damage 3d6}) cold damage.

action.name: Frostbolt
entries: {@atk rs} {@hit 6} to hit, range 60 ft., one target. {@h}13 ({@damage 3d6 + 3}) cold damage, and the target's speed is reduced by 10 feet until the end of its next turn.

action.name: Freezing Smite {@recharge 5}
entries: The rimepacted raises its frigid claw, drawing upon fiendish energies, then smashes its rimed fist into the ground, causing a wave of freezing power to emanate outward. Each creature within 30 feet of the rimepacted must make a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw, taking 21 ({@damage 6d6}) cold damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. If a creature fails the saving throw by 5 or more, it is {@condition restrained} by ice until the end of its next turn.

reaction.name: Fury of the Storm
entries: When a creature the rimepacted can see is knocked {@condition prone} by Frigid Vortex, the rimepacted can move up to half its speed toward the creature.

Dark, frostbitten skin pulls taut over bone, and ice rimes this humanoid's body. Massive ice on its forearms and hands forms monstrous, rending claws, and icicles on its back give it the semblance of a fiendish tail. A vile anger burns in its eyes.

When creatures lost in the coldest reaches of the world approach death from starvation or exposure, they often call out for aid from any entities that can hear them. When an {@creature ice devil} or similarly cold-based devil hears the cries whispered into the blizzard, it might form a pact to spare the mortal's life, resulting in {@creature frost-afflicted|ToB3}. If the devil arrives too late for a pact but before the mortal's spirit has fully left the body, it can reforge the fleeing soul from the freezing cold, creating a rimepacted devil.

entries.name: Servants of Ice
entries: Rimepacted devils typically serve the devils who created them, scouring the land and reaping souls for their infernal masters. Bonded with icy and frigid locales on the Material Plane, rimepacted rarely fight for higher station in devilish hierarchies, content to bring the power of winter down on warm-blooded mortals.

monster.name: Devouring Angel
languages: understands Common and Celestial but can't speak

trait.name: Assisted Leaping
entries: The devouring angel can use its quasi-wings to fly up to 30 feet on its turn, but it must start and end its movement on a solid surface, such as a roof or the ground. If it is flying at the end of its turn, it falls to the ground and takes falling damage.

trait.name: Flexible Form
entries: The devouring angel can twist its body into unnatural positions, allowing it to easily move through any opening large enough for a Small creature. It can squeeze through any opening large enough for a Tiny creature. The angel's destination must still have suitable room to accommodate its volume.

trait.name: Keen Smell
entries: The devouring angel has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on smell.

trait.name: Limited Telepathy
entries: The devouring angel can magically communicate simple ideas, emotions, and images telepathically with any creature within 100 feet of it that can understand a language.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The devouring angel makes one Bite attack and four Claw attacks. It can replace one Claw attack with a Spiked Tongue attack.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}16 ({@damage 2d10 + 5}) piercing damage plus 10 ({@damage 3d6}) acid damage.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}12 ({@damage 2d6 + 5}) slashing damage.

action.name: Spiked Tongue
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 20 ft., one target. {@h}12 ({@damage 2d6 + 5}) bludgeoning damage, and the target is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 17}). Until this grapple ends, the target is {@condition restrained} and takes 9 ({@damage 2d8}) piercing damage at the start of each of its turns, and the devouring angel can pull the creature up to 15 feet closer to it as a bonus action. The devouring angel can have only one target {@condition grappled} in this way at a time.

action.name: Shed Spines {@recharge 5}
entries: The devouring angel shakes its body, sending acid-coated spines outward. Each creature within 10 feet of the devouring angel must make a {@dc 17} Dexterity saving throw, taking 18 ({@damage 4d8}) piercing damage and 24 ({@damage 7d6}) acid damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

trait.name: Flyby
entries: The archaeopteryx doesn't provoke {@action opportunity attack||opportunity attacks} when it flies out of an enemy's reach.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The archaeopteryx has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The guardian archaeopteryx makes one Beak attack and one Talons attack, or it makes two Spit Thorn attacks. If the archaeopteryx hits one creature with two attacks, the target must succeed on a {@dc 11} Constitution saving throw or take 2 ({@damage 1d4}) poison damage and be {@condition poisoned} until the end of its next turn.

action.name: Beak
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 2d4 + 2}) piercing damage plus 2 ({@damage 1d4}) poison damage.

action.name: Talons
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 2d4 + 2}) slashing damage.

action.name: Spit Thorn
entries: {@atk rs} {@hit 4} to hit, range 60 ft., one target. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d4 + 2}) piercing damage plus 2 ({@damage 1d4}) poison damage.

bonus.name: Imbue Poison
entries: The guardian archaeopteryx chooses a friendly creature it can see within 30 feet of it and imbues that creature's attacks with magical poison. The next time the friendly creature hits with an attack before the start of the guardian archaeopteryx's next turn, the target of the attack takes an extra 2 ({@damage 1d4}) poison damage and must succeed on a {@dc 11} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition poisoned} until the end of its next turn.
An enormous archaeopteryx, easily the size of a small dog, stares down from its high perch. Its plumage is a muted blue, and its eyes shine with intelligence.
Guardian archaeopteryxes are enormous feathered dinosaurs bred by ancient druids to guard sacred sites. Their glowing green eyes hint at the ancient magic that still suffuses their forms.

entries.name: Prehistoric Guardians
entries: In a time before writing, ancient druids infused {@creature archaeopteryx|CCodex} with magic and bred them to guard the druids' most sacred sites. The resulting creatures could spit enchanted thorns and poison foes beset by their lesser kin.

entries.name: Flock Leaders
entries: Guardian archaeopteryxes gather flocks of their smaller brethren to help perform their duties. The mundane {@creature archaeopteryx|CCodex} alert the guardians to intruders, scare off smaller creatures, and hunt for the shared nest, ensuring the flock grows strong. When a significant threat arrives, the guardian peppers foes with thorns and imbues the flock with magical poison.

entries.name: Made Obsolete by Time
entries: In the millennia since the guardians were first created, many of the sites they once guarded have been destroyed, profaned, or changed biome from the passage of time. Additionally, when a flock grows too large for a sacred site to support, the youngest guardian archaeopteryx leaves with a section of the flock, looking for a new site to guard. All of these processes create 'orphaned' flocks that guard ruins or verdant bits of forest, unrelated to their ancient purpose.

trait.name: Flyby
entries: The jeholopterus doesn't provoke {@action opportunity attack||opportunity attacks} when it flies out of an enemy's reach.

trait.name: Keen Sight
entries: The jeholopterus has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on sight.

action.name: Blood Drain
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}8 ({@damage 2d4 + 3}) piercing damage, and the jeholopterus attaches to the target. While attached, the jeholopterus doesn't attack. Instead, at the start of each of the jeholopterus's turns, the target loses 8 ({@damage 2d4 + 3}) hp due to blood loss.

The jeholopterus can detach itself by spending 5 feet of its movement. It does so after it drains 15 hp of blood from the target or the target dies. A creature, including the target, can take its action to detach the jeholopterus by succeeding on a {@dc 13} Strength check.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) slashing damage.

variant.name: Jeholopterus Familiars
entries: Some jeholopterus are willing to serve spellcasters as a familiar. Such jeholopterus have the following trait.

entries.name: Familiar
entries: The jeholopterus can serve another creature as a familiar, forming a magic, telepathic bond with that willing companion. While the two are bonded, the companion can sense what the jeholopterus senses as long as they are within 1 mile of each other. While the jeholopterus is within 10 feet of its companion, the companion shares the jeholopterus's Keen Sight trait.
