While {@condition poisoned}, a creature falls {@condition prone} if it tries to move more than half its speed during a turn. A creature that succeeds on the saving throw is immune to the Aura of Drunkenness of all rum gremlins for 24 hours.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The story keeper has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

action.name: Mug Slap
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, range 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) bludgeoning damage plus 7 ({@damage 2d6}) poison damage.

action.name: Rum Splash
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 5} to hit, range 40/80 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 2d6}) poison damage.

action.name: Drinking Stories
entries: The story keeper tells a story of a rum gremlin celebration. Each story has an initial effect and an additional effect if the story keeper takes a bonus action on its subsequent turns to continue the story. It can stop telling a story at any time, and the story ends if the story keeper is {@condition incapacitated}. The story keeper can tell only one story at a time. It chooses from the following stories:

items.name: Tale of Liquid Courage.
items.entry: Each rum gremlin within 30 feet of the story keeper and that can hear it gains 5 temporary hp for 1 minute. While this tale continues, each rum gremlin that starts its turn within 30 feet of the story keeper has advantage on saving throws against being {@condition frightened}.

items.name: Tale of the Bar Room Rush.
items.entry: Each rum gremlin within 30 feet of the story keeper and that can hear it can use its reaction to immediately move up to its speed. While this tale continues, each rum gremlin within 30 feet of the story keeper can take the {@action Dash} or {@action Disengage} action as a bonus action on its turn.

items.name: Tale of the Great Shindig.
items.entry: Each rum gremlin within 30 feet of the story keeper and that can hear it can use its reaction to immediately shove a Medium or smaller creature. While this tale continues, each rum gremlin within 30 feet of the story keeper has advantage on Strength ({@skill Athletics}) checks and can {@action shove} creatures up to two sizes larger than it.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The story keeper casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save {@dc 13}):

entries: A potbellied gremlin dressed in a dirty tabard, stained ruff collar, tattered cloak, and puffy breeches takes a swig from a jug of foulsmelling rum.

entries.name: Drunken Celebrities
entries: Story keepers are renowned among {@creature rum gremlin|ToB|rum gremlins} for always being at the center of any major drunken debauchery. They travel to gremlin gatherings then retell them as stories to other gremlins. The stories often include besting rivals in drinking contests and chaotic hijinks for non-gremlins. {@creature rum lord|ToB2|Rum lords} lure story keepers to their courts with promises of rum and fun when seeking to increase their courts' prestige.

entries.name: Solo Artists
entries: Story keepers don't like to share the spotlight when telling stories. They are notorious for sabotaging and outright attacking other performers—even performers that aren't gremlins. Devious rum lords have been known to summon rival story keepers to court at the same time in hopes of sparking a drinking or storytelling duel for the court's entertainment.

trait.name: Cheek Worm Regrowth
entries: The gravid has twenty worms stored in its cheeks. Used worms regrow when the grivid finishes a long rest.

trait.name: Keen Sight
entries: The grivid has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on sight.

trait.name: Parasitic Cheek Worm
entries: The grivid produces parasitic worms in its cheeks, and it expels these worms into other creatures when it attacks. The worm burrows into the flesh of the target, and that creature is {@condition poisoned} while infested with at least one worm. At the start of each of the infested creature's turns, it takes 5 ({@damage 2d4}) poison damage. Any creature can take an action to remove one worm with a successful {@dc 12} Wisdom ({@skill Medicine}) check. An effect that cures disease removes and kills one worm infesting the creature. When a grivid dies, all worms currently infesting other creatures die with it, ending the infestation in all infested creatures.

trait.name: Worm Regeneration
entries: If it has at least 1 hp, the grivid regains 5 hp for each worm infesting another creature at the start of its turn.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The grivid makes one Bite attack and two Kicks attacks, or it makes three Spit Worm attacks.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 10 ft., one creature. {@h}18 ({@damage 3d8 + 5}) piercing damage plus 7 ({@damage 2d6}) poison damage, and the target must succeed on a {@dc 16} Constitution saving throw or be infested with a parasitic cheek worm (see the Parasitic Cheek Worm trait), if the grivid has at least 1 cheek worm.

action.name: Kick
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}18 ({@damage 3d8 + 5}) bludgeoning damage, and the target must succeed on a {@dc 16} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}.

action.name: Spit Worm
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 7} to hit, range 20/60 ft., one creature. {@h}13 ({@damage 3d6 + 3}) bludgeoning damage plus 7 ({@damage 2d6}) poison damage, and the target must succeed on a {@dc 16} Constitution saving throw or be infested with a parasitic cheek worm (see the Parasitic Cheek Worm trait), if the grivid has at least 1 cheek worm.

bonus.name: Consume Worms
entries: The grivid consumes up to 3 cheek worms, regaining 5 ({@damage 2d4}) hit points for each worm consumed.

trait.name: Keen Smell
entries: The grolar bear has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on smell.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The grolar bear makes one Bite attack and one Claw attack. If it hits one creature with both attacks, that creature must succeed on a {@dc 13} Strength saving throw or take 7 ({@damage 2d6}) bludgeoning damage and be knocked {@condition prone}.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 1d8 + 5}) piercing damage.

action.name: Claws
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}12 ({@damage 2d6 + 5}) slashing damage.

trait.name: Dismembering Strike
entries: If the grolar bear scores a critical hit against a {@condition stunned} creature, it tears off one of the creature's limbs. A creature is immune to this effect if it is immune to slashing damage.

trait.name: Keen Smell
entries: The grolar bear has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on smell.

trait.name: Forest and Snow Camouflage
entries: The grolar bear has advantage on Dexterity ({@skill Stealth}) checks made to hide in forest terrain while its fur is brown and snowy terrain while its fur is white.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The grolar bear makes one Bite attack and two Claw attacks. If it hits one creature with two attacks, that creature takes 14 ({@damage 4d6}) bludgeoning damage and must succeed on a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition stunned} until the end of its next turn.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 1d8 + 7}) piercing damage.

action.name: Claws
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}14 ({@damage 2d6 + 7}) slashing damage.

bonus.name: Versatile Coat
entries: The grolar bear changes its fur from white to brown or vice versa.

trait.name: Hold Breath
entries: The gullkin can hold its breath for 15 minutes.

action.name: Beak
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d4 + 3}) piercing damage.

action.name: Javelin
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 30/120 ft., one creature. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) piercing damage.

action.name: Tempest Breath (Recharges on a Short or Long Rest)
entries: The gullkin exhales a lungful of air in a 15-foot cone. Each creature in that area must succeed on a {@dc 11} Strength saving throw or be pushed up to 15 feet away from the gullkin.

trait.name: Hold Breath
entries: The gullkin can hold its breath for 5 minutes.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The gullkin hunter makes one Beak attack and one Shortsword attack or two Shortbow attacks.

action.name: Beak
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d4 + 3}) piercing damage.

action.name: Shortsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) piercing damage.

action.name: Shortbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 5} to hit, range 80/320 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) piercing damage.

action.name: Tempest Breath (Recharges on a Short or Long Rest)
entries: The gullkin hunter exhales a lungful of air in a 15-foot cone. Each creature in that area must succeed on a {@dc 12} Strength saving throw or be pushed up to 15 feet away from the gullkin.

trait.name: Earth Climb
entries: The haakjir can climb difficult earth or stone surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

trait.name: Earth Glide
entries: The haakjir can burrow through nonmagical, unworked earth and stone. While doing so, the haakjir doesn't disturb the material it moves through.

trait.name: Earthen Claws
entries: The haakjir's claws easily meld through stone and metal. When the haakjir makes a Claw attack against a creature wearing nonmagical metal armor or wielding a nonmagical metal shield, the attack ignores the AC bonus provided by the armor or shield. If the target is a construct made of stone or metal, the attack ignores the AC bonus provided by the target's natural armor, if any.

trait.name: Pack Tactics
entries: The haakjir has advantage on attack rolls against a creature if at least one of the haakjir's allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally isn't {@condition incapacitated}.

trait.name: Stone Camouflage
entries: The haakjir has advantage on Dexterity ({@skill Stealth}) checks made to hide in rocky terrain.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The haakjir makes one Bite attack and two Claw attacks.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, 5 ft reach, one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 2d6 + 3}) piercing damage.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft, one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 2d4 + 3}) slashing damage.

variant.name: Haakjir Variant: Vektyr
entries: It took several generations for the ancient deep gnomes to get a domesticated guardian creature for their enclaves. Vektyrs, early progenitors to the haakjir, were particularly vicious and unsociable. Vektyrs replace the haakjir's Pack Tactics trait with the following trait:

entries.name: Pounce
entries: If the vektyr moves at least 20 feet straight toward a creature and then hits it with a Claw attack on the same turn, that target must succeed on a {@dc 13} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}. If the target is {@condition prone}, the vektyr can make one Bite attack against it as a bonus action.

items.name: Pounce
entries: If the vektyr moves at least 20 feet straight toward a creature and then hits it with a Claw attack on the same turn, that target must succeed on a {@dc 13} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}. If the target is {@condition prone}, the vektyr can make one Bite attack against it as a bonus action.

trait.name: Imposing Figure
entries: The alleybasher uses its Strength modifier instead of its Charisma modifier when making {@skill Intimidation} checks (included above).

trait.name: I Work for the Boss (3/Day)
entries: If the alleybasher is subjected to an effect that would force it to make an Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma saving throw while it is within 30 feet of its superior, the ogre can use the superior's Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma modifier for the saving throw instead of its own.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The alleybasher makes two Fist attacks or three Throw Brick attacks. If the ogre hits one Medium or smaller creature with both Fist attacks, the target must succeed on a {@dc 13} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}.

action.name: Fist
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}14 ({@damage 2d8 + 4}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Throw Brick
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 6} to hit range 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 2d4 + 4}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Handful of Sandy Rocks {@recharge 6}
entries: The alleybasher scatters rocks and blinding sand in a 15-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a {@dc 13} Dexterity saving throw. On a failure, a creature takes 14 ({@damage 4d6}) bludgeoning damage and is {@condition blinded} until the end of its next turn. On a success, a creature takes half the damage and isn't {@condition blinded}.

reaction.name: Intimidating Rebuff
entries: When a creature the alleybasher can see within 30 feet of it targets it with an attack, the ogre can make a Strength ({@skill Intimidation}) check, taking half a step forward, snarling, or otherwise attempting to spook the attacker. If the check is equal to or higher than the attack roll, the attacker must reroll the attack roll, using the lower of the two results.
An ogre clad in spiked leathers and wearing brass knuckles turns the corner. It cracks its knuckles and smiles wickedly, punching a hole in a brick wall for violent emphasis.

Most ogres are simple giants, driven by foul tempers and large appetites. Theirs is an existence that is often cut short by infighting, bigger giants, and defiant heroes. Some of the bolder ogres seek out the bustling cities the smaller folk call home, where their talent for violence and intimidation makes it easy for them to enjoy a life of crime.

entries.name: Goon Squad Muscle
entries: A few alleybasher ogres take jobs as bouncers and muggers on their own, but more often a street gang, a shady performer, or thieves' guild employs them as muscle. Their cruelty and propensity for violence serve them well, and their massive size counts for far more than personality in criminal circles. Gangs and guilds teach alleybashers the tools of their trade: Brick, rocks, fists, and more.

trait.name: Amphibious
entries: The brine hag can breathe air and water.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The hag has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Polluted Aura
entries: The brine hag pollutes the water around her when she is submerged. Each creature in the same water as the hag and that start its turn within 20 feet of the hag must succeed on a {@dc 16} Constitution saving throw or become {@condition poisoned} while within the aura and for 1 minute after it leaves. A {@condition poisoned} creature that starts its turn outside of the aura can repeat the saving throw, ending the effect on itself on a success.

trait.name: Skilled Submariner
entries: The hag has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) and Wisdom ({@skill Survival}) checks to find creatures and objects underwater. In addition, she has advantage on Dexterity ({@skill Stealth}) checks made to hide while underwater.

trait.name: Speak with Aquatic Creatures
entries: The brine hag can communicate with Beasts and Monstrosities that have a swimming speed as if they shared a language.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The brine hag makes two Claw attacks and one Tail Slap attack.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, range 5 ft., one target. {@h}12 ({@damage 2d8 + 3}) slashing damage plus 7 ({@damage 2d6}) poison damage. The target must succeed on a {@dc 16} Constitution saving throw or become {@condition incapacitated} until the end of its next turn. If it fails the saving throw by 5 or more, it is {@condition paralyzed} instead.

action.name: Tail Slap
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, range 5 ft., one target. {@h}16 ({@damage 2d12 +3}) bludgeoning damage, and the target must succeed on a {@dc 16} Strength saving throw or pushed up to 10 feet away from the hag.

action.name: Shriek {@recharge 5}
entries: The brine hag unleashes a painful screeching in a 30-foot cone. Each creature in the area must make a {@dc 16} Constitution saving throw. On a failure, a creature takes 33 ({@damage 6d10}) thunder damage and is {@condition stunned} until the end of its next turn. On a success, a creature takes half the damage and isn't {@condition stunned}.

action.name: Denizens of the Deep (1/Day)
entries: The brine hag magically calls four {@creature reef shark||reef sharks}, two {@creature swarm of quippers||swarms of quippers}, or one {@filter Beast of CR 2 or lower that has a swimming speed|bestiary|type=beast|challenge rating=[&0;&2]|speed type=swim}. The called creatures arrive in {@dice 1d4} rounds, acting as allies of the hag and obeying her spoken commands. The Beasts remain for 1 hour, until the hag dies, or until the hag dismisses them as a bonus action.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The brine hag casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save {@dc 16}):

entries: Clawed, spined, and eel-tailed, this scaly, fishlike crone is slick with slime and seaweed and dotted with crusts of barnacles.

The brine hag inhabits coastal regions, lairing in hidden grottoes, shipwrecks, and tidal caves. Sometimes posing as fishers or oyster diggers under hoods or cloaks, they prey on beachcombers, castaways, and fishermen.

entries.name: Corrupted Beauty
entries: Brine hags were once aquatic fey who were lured into evil doings by evil, primordial entities of the deeps. Whether coerced or tempted, these marine monstrosities have been transformed by their unrepented acts.

entries.name: Cruel Manipulators
entries: Like the creatures that created them, brine hags regularly manipulate weaker-willed beings, drawing them into wicked intrigues. They delight in corrupting others, reveling as much in those that embrace evil as in the despair of those who regret any actions committed due to the hag's influences.

trait.name: Amphibious
entries: The floe hag can breathe air and water.

trait.name: Ice Walk
entries: The floe hag can move across and climb icy surfaces without needing to make an ability check. Additionally, difficult terrain covered in ice or snow doesn't cost her extra movement.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The floe hag makes two Claw attacks or three Ice Bolt attacks.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d8 + 4}) slashing damage plus 10 ({@damage 3d6}) cold damage, and the target is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 15}) if the hag doesn't have another creature {@condition grappled}.

action.name: Ice Bolt
entries: {@atk rs} {@hit 5} to hit, range 60 ft., one target. {@h}12 ({@damage 3d6 + 2}) cold damage.

action.name: Stash
entries: The floe hag stashes a Medium or smaller creature {@condition grappled} by her or that is {@condition incapacitated} within 5 feet of her inside an extradimensional pocket in her parka, ending the {@condition grappled} or {@condition incapacitated} condition. The extradimensional pocket can hold only one creature at a time. While inside the pocket, the creature is {@condition blinded} and {@condition restrained}, and it has total cover against attacks and other effects outside the pocket. The trapped creature can take its action to escape the pocket by succeeding on a {@dc 15} Strength check and using 5 feet of movement, falling {@condition prone} in an unoccupied space within 5 feet of the hag. If the floe hag dies, a trapped creature is freed, appearing in an unoccupied space within 5 feet of the hag's body.

action.name: Distracting Knock {@recharge 5}
entries: The floe hag raps her knuckles on the ice, creating a magical, echoing knock. Each creature within 30 feet of the hag must make a {@dc 15} Wisdom saving throw. On a failure, a creature takes 21 ({@damage 6d6}) psychic damage and is {@condition incapacitated} for 1 minute. On a success, a creature takes half the damage and isn't {@condition incapacitated}. While {@condition incapacitated}, a creature moves toward the hag by the safest available route on each of its turns, unless there is nowhere to move. An {@condition incapacitated} creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The floe hag casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save {@dc 13}):

entries: A woman with long, lank hair, green-scaled skin, and elongated fingers hums eerily as it emerges from a hole in the ice.
The floe hag is found in freezing cold seas. People living in the fishing villages of the far north know to limit their time on the ice to avoid a floe hag grabbing them.

entries.name: Tell-Tale Signs
entries: The floe hag clings to the underside of ice floes and knocks on the ice to attract the attention of hunters and fishermen. When a victim gets too close, the hag seizes it and stashes it inside an extradimensional pocket stitched into the back of her sealskin parka. Once she has a captive, she brings it to her lair beneath the ice.

entries.name: Eternal Captive
entries: Captives brought to the floe hag's lair are never seen again. Some say the hag is lonely and wants company, freezing the captives into statues for companionship and decoration. Others say she stays young by slowly absorbing her captives' life energy. On rare occasions, a captive that survives an extended stay in the hag's lair transforms into a new floe hag and leaves the lair to claim its own victims and lair.

trait.name: Disease Sense
entries: The pesta hag can pinpoint the location of {@condition poisoned} creatures or creatures suffering from a disease within 60 feet of her and can sense the general direction of such creatures within 1 mile of her.

trait.name: Pestilence Aura
entries: At the start of each of the pesta hag's turns, each creature within 10 feet of her takes 4 ({@damage 1d8}) poison damage. If a creature remains within the aura for more than 1 minute, it must succeed on a {@dc 13} Constitution saving throw or contract a disease of the hag's choice. The disease's saving throw DC is 13, regardless of the disease the hag chooses.

trait.name: Plague Carrier
entries: The pesta hag is immune to diseases.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The pesta hag makes two Pestilence Rake or Poison Bolt attacks.

action.name: Pestilence Rake
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d8 + 3}) piercing damage plus 5 ({@damage 2d4}) necrotic damage. The target must succeed on a {@dc 13} Constitution saving throw or its hp maximum is reduced by an amount equal to the necrotic damage taken, and it contracts sewer plague, sight rot, or another disease of the pesta hag's choice. The disease's saving throw DC is 13, regardless of the disease the hag chooses.

action.name: Poison Bolt
entries: {@atk rs} {@hit 5} to hit, range 120 ft., one target. {@h}12 ({@damage 2d8 + 3}) poison damage.

action.name: Curative Touch (3/Day)
entries: The pesta hag touches another creature. The target magically regains 10 ({@damage 2d8 + 1}) hp and is freed from any disease or poison afflicting it.

action.name: Summon Plague Rats (1/Day)
entries: The pesta hag magically calls {@dice 1d3} swarms of rats. The called rats arrive in {@dice 1d4} rounds, acting as allies of the hag and obeying her spoken commands. The swarms carry a terrible disease. If a creature takes damage from the swarm's Bites, it must succeed on a {@dc 10} Constitution saving throw or contract the disease. Until the disease is cured, the creature can't regain hp except by magical means, and the target's hp maximum decreases by 3 ({@damage 1d6}) every 24 hours. If the creature's hp maximum drops to 0 as a result of this disease, it dies. The rats remain for 1 hour, until the hag dies, or the hag dismisses them as a bonus action.
This hideous crone is wrapped in tattered, black garments and carries a large, wooden rake. Her pale skin is blackened on her nose and fingertips, and her exposed flesh shows open, weeping sores.

Pesta hags, also known as plague hags, are physical manifestations of disease. As a pesta hag wanders, disease spreads in her wake, especially where folk antagonize her. A pesta hag will cure diseases from petitioners that come bearing gifts or even on a whim. The gifts demanded vary widely, depending on the hag's mood. She may demand the grandest horse in a lord's stables, for example, but accept a fresh pear or a scarf full of berries from a poor leper. Or she may turn away both without explanation.

entries.name: Ghost Ships
entries: Occasionally, a pesta hag takes passage on a vessel. Inevitably, the crew falls victim to disease. If the entire crew succumbs, the ghost ship continues on its course, often with the body of a determined captain slumped over the wheel to keep the vessel on course. When it docks, the pesta hag slips ashore amid the confusion, leaving the ship and its grisly cargo behind.

trait.name: One with the Woods
entries: While the hag remains motionless in forest terrain, she is indistinguishable from an old, decomposing log or tree stump.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The wood hag has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Speak with Beasts and Plants
entries: The wood hag can communicate with Beasts and Plants as if they shared a language.

trait.name: Woodland Walk
entries: Difficult terrain composed of plants doesn't cost the wood hag extra movement. In addition, she can pass through plants without being slowed by them and without taking damage from them if they have thorns, spines, or a similar hazard.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The wood hag makes two Claw or Toxic Splinter attacks.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 2d6 + 3}) slashing damage plus 18 ({@damage 4d8}) poison damage.

action.name: Toxic Splinter
entries: {@atk rs} {@hit 9} to hit, range 60 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d4 + 5}) piercing damage plus 18 ({@damage 4d8}) poison damage, and the target must succeed on a {@dc 16} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition poisoned} for 1 minute. While {@condition poisoned} in this way, the target is {@condition paralyzed}. A {@condition poisoned} creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. A creature within 5 feet of the target can take its action to remove the splinter with a successful {@dc 13} Wisdom ({@skill Medicine}) check, ending the {@condition poisoned} condition on the target.

bonus.name: Nettling Word
entries: The wood hag heckles, mocks, or jeers at one creature she can see within 30 feet of her. If the creature can hear and understand the hag, it must succeed on a {@dc 16} Charisma saving throw or become enraged until the end of its next turn. While enraged, a creature has advantage on melee attack rolls, is unable to distinguish friend from foe, and must move to and attack the nearest creature other than the hag. If no other creature is near enough to move to and attack, the enraged creature stalks off in a random direction. Attack rolls against an enraged creature have advantage.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The wood hag casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Wisdom as the spellcasting ability (spell save {@dc 17}):

entries: In the rainforest's mist-draped half-light, a rotting, mossy tree stump mutters to itself. The decomposing mass rises, unfolding from its camouflage of ferns, mosses, and mulch, revealing the short, powerfully-built crone underneath.

The wood hag resembles a disheveled, ancient woman. The hag's pallid skin is mottled by patches of mold and clusters of tiny mushrooms. Her clothing consists of draped mosses, lichens, and fern fronds, and it crawls with slugs, grubs, and earthworms.

entries.name: Witch of the Wilds
entries: Wood hags haunt fog-wreathed rainforests, steaming, mountain-top jungles, and murky mangrove swamps. Their homes are moist, moldering places of fern and fungus, snail, and shadow. Wood hags carve out lairs within great, rotting logs, build camouflaged treehouses, or dig rabbit-like warrens into forest floors.

entries.name: Monstrous Matron
entries: Wood hags are friends to {@creature cueyatl|CCodex}, {@creature shambling mound||shambling mounds}, and similar denizens of the dark and damp areas in which they live. Wood hags also create allies and servants from available materials, constructing {@creature witchalder|ToB3|witchalders} and {@creature mud golem|CCodex|mud golems} to do their bidding.

trait.name: Limited Telepathy
entries: The plague harpy can magically transmit simple messages and images to any creature within 90 feet of it that can understand a language. This form of telepathy doesn't allow the receiving creature to telepathically respond.

trait.name: Virulence
entries: A creature infected with harpy's plague becomes contagious 24 hours after contracting the disease. When a creature starts its turn within 5 feet of the contagious target, that creature must succeed on a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw or also contract the harpy's plague disease.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The harpy uses Dirge. It then makes one Bite attack and two Talons attacks, or it makes three Sorrowful Caw attacks. If the harpy hits one Medium or smaller creature with two Talons attacks, the target is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 15}). Until this grapple ends, the harpy can automatically hit the target with its Talons, and the harpy can't make Talons attacks against other targets.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 2d4 + 3}) piercing damage plus 7 ({@damage 2d6}) necrotic damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw or contract the harpy's plague disease. If the target is disheartened and contracts harpy's plague, its hp maximum is reduced by an amount equal to the necrotic damage taken. Until the disease is cured, the target can't regain hp except by magical means, and the target's hp maximum decreases by 10 ({@damage 3d6}) every 24 hours. If the target's hp maximum drops to 0 as a result of this disease, the target dies.

action.name: Talons
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}14 ({@damage 2d10 + 3}) slashing damage.

action.name: Sorrowful Caw
entries: {@atk rs} {@hit 6} to hit, range 90 ft., one target. {@h}13 ({@damage 3d6 + 3}) psychic damage.

action.name: Dirge
entries: The harpy telepathically sings a mournful hymn and projects images of sickly and dying loved ones in the mind of one creature it can see within 90 feet of it. The target must succeed on a {@dc 15} Wisdom saving throw or be disheartened for 1 minute. While disheartened, a creature has disadvantage on saving throws against being {@condition poisoned} or contracting a disease. The disheartened creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.
The creature combines the body of a woman with the head, wings, and talons of a giant vulture. It perches silently, head cocked to the side, studying its surroundings.
The plague harpy is a carrion eater and an aggressive plague carrier. They are found anywhere bodies accumulate, especially those that are diseased.

entries.name: Patiently Awaiting Death
entries: A plague harpy likes its meals dead, and preferably rotten and diseased. The harpies are perfectly content to infect individuals, leaving the creatures otherwise unmolested, and allow them to return to their loved ones. Plague harpies sow the seeds of disease today in the hopes of reaping greater rewards tomorrow.

entries.name: Pain of the Dying
entries: The dirge sung by plague harpies sounds different to each person that hears it and is accompanied by telepathic images of dying friends and family. The harpies hope to instill a state of sorrow and grief with the dirge, making their victims more susceptible to illness.

trait.name: Beast of Burden
entries: The harvest horse is considered one size larger for the purpose of determining its carrying capacity.

trait.name: Construct Nature
entries: The harvest horse doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

trait.name: Poor Traversal
entries: The harvest horse must spend two additional feet of movement to move through difficult terrain instead of one additional foot.

trait.name: Siege Monster
entries: The harvest horse deals double damage to objects and structures.

action.name: Slam
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 2d4 + 2}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Harvester's Stampede {@recharge 5}
entries: The harvest horse moves up to its speed in a straight line and can move through the space of any Large or smaller creature. The first time the harvest horse enters a creature's space during this move, that creature must make a {@dc 12} Dexterity saving throw. On a failure, it takes 7 ({@damage 2d6}) slashing damage and is knocked {@condition prone}. On a success, it takes half as much damage and isn't knocked {@condition prone}. When the harvest horse moves in this way, it doesn't provoke {@action opportunity attack||opportunity attacks}.

trait.name: Herd-Hidden (Herd Animal Form Only)
entries: The herd skulker has advantage on Dexterity ({@skill Stealth}) and Charisma ({@skill Deception}) checks to blend into the herd or convince those observing the herd that it is part of the herd.

trait.name: Keen Hearing and Smell
entries: The herd skulker has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on hearing or smell.

trait.name: One of the Herd
entries: A domesticated herd animal, such as a cow, horse, sheep, or chicken, that can see the herd skulker treats it as a member of the herd, regardless of the form the skulker takes. When such an animal sees a herd skulker attack or feed, it becomes immune to the herd skulker's One of the Herd for the next 24 hours, acting as it normally would when confronting a predator. Creatures immune to the {@condition charmed} condition are immune to this trait.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}12 ({@damage 2d8 + 3}) piercing damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 13} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}.

bonus.name: Change Shape
entries: The herd skulker transforms into a Large or smaller domesticated herd animal it can see, such as a cow, horse, sheep, or chicken, or back into its true, canine form. Its statistics, other than its size, are the same in each form. It reverts to its true form if it dies.

bonus.name: Nimble Escape
entries: The herd skulker takes the {@action Disengage} or {@action Hide} action.

trait.name: Aura of Misfortune
entries: Each creature within 15 feet of the hinderling treats any roll of a 20 on an attack roll as a 19 and can't gain the benefit of advantage on ability checks, attack rolls, and saving throws.

trait.name: Rejuvenation
entries: While the hinderling curse remains on a victim, a slain hinderling returns to life in 1 day, regaining all its hp and becoming active again. The hinderling appears within 100 feet of the victim.

action.name: Stolen Belonging
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d4 + 3}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Hurl Stolen Belonging
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 5} to hit, range 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d4 + 3}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Mad Dash
entries: The hinderling moves up to twice its speed and can move through the space of any creature that is Medium or larger. When the hinderling moves through a creature's space, the creature must succeed on a {@dc 13} Dexterity saving throw or fall {@condition prone}. This movement doesn't provoke {@action opportunity attack||opportunity attacks}.

bonus.name: Nimble Escape
entries: The hinderling takes the {@action Disengage} or {@action Hide} action.

reaction.name: Run and Hide
entries: When a creature the hinderling can see targets it with a weapon attack, the hinderling chooses another creature within 5 feet it to become the target of the attack, then it moves up to half its speed without provoking {@action opportunity attack||opportunity attacks}.

trait.name: Hold Breath
entries: The hippopotamus can hold its breath for 10 minutes.

action.name: Gore
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}18 ({@damage 3d8 + 5}) piercing damage.

action.name: Thunderous Bray {@recharge 5}
entries: The hippopotamus emits a resounding bray in a 15-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a {@dc 13} Constitution saving throw. On a failure, a creature takes 14 ({@damage 4d6}) thunder damage and is {@condition incapacitated} until the end of its next turn. On a success, a creature takes half the damage and isn't {@condition incapacitated}.

trait.name: Divine Awareness
entries: The sacred hippopotamus knows if it hears a lie.

trait.name: Divine Jaws
entries: The sacred hippopotamus's weapon attacks are magical. When the hippopotamus hits with a Gore attack, the Gore deals an extra {@damage 2d8} necrotic damage or radiant damage (included in the attack), the hippopotamus's choice.

trait.name: Hold Breath
entries: The sacred hippopotamus can hold its breath for 30 minutes.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The sacred hippopotamus has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Sacred Guardian
entries: The sacred hippopotamus can pinpoint the location of an agent or worshiper of an opposing deity or a creature with ill intent toward the hippopotamus's sacred site within 120 feet of itself. In addition, the hippopotamus can sense when such a creature moves within 100 feet of the site and can sense the general direction of such creatures within 1 mile of the site.

action.name: Gore
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}23 ({@damage 4d8 + 5}) piercing damage plus 9 ({@damage 2d8}) necrotic damage or radiant damage (the hippopotamus's choice).

action.name: Divine Cacophony {@recharge 5}
entries: The sacred hippopotamus opens its jaws and releases a cacophony of otherworldly screams, songs, and roars from the Upper or Lower Planes in a 30-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw. On a failure, a creature takes 21 ({@damage 6d6}) necrotic damage or radiant damage (the sacred hippopotamus's choice) and is {@condition stunned} until the end of its next turn. On a success, a creature takes half the damage and isn't {@condition stunned}.

action.name: Healing Rumble (2/Day)
entries: The sacred hippopotamus touches another creature with its snout as it hums a tone that reverberates through its jaw. The target magically regains 10 ({@damage 3d6}) hp and is freed from any disease, poison, blindness, or deafness.

bonus.name: Protector's Step
entries: The sacred hippopotamus magically teleports, along with any equipment it is wearing or carrying, up to 120 feet to an unoccupied space within its sacred site or within 30 feet of the exterior of its sacred site. Swirls of golden light or tendrils of inky shadow (the hippopotamus's choice) appear at the origin and destination when it uses this bonus action.

trait.name: Infernal Runes
entries: The Black Sun ogre's tattoos give it a +2 bonus to its AC (included above). In addition, the ogre has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Unholy Blade
entries: Infused with unholy power, the ogre's weapon attacks are magical. When the ogre hits with any weapon, the weapon deals an extra {@damage 2d6} necrotic damage (included in the attack).

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The Black Sun ogre makes two Greatsword attacks.

action.name: Greatsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}19 ({@damage 4d6 + 5}) slashing damage plus 7 ({@damage 2d6}) necrotic damage.

action.name: Dark Word
entries: The ogre speaks an infernal word of unmaking at up to two creatures it can see within 120 feet of it. Each target must succeed on a {@dc 16} Constitution saving throw or take 22 ({@damage 5d8}) necrotic damage.

reaction.name: Gauntleted Backhand
entries: When a creature within 5 feet of the Black Sun ogre misses the ogre with a melee attack, the attacker must succeed on a {@dc 16} Dexterity saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}.
A pale, scarred ogre lumbers forward, half its body covered in armor, the other half covered in tattooed glyphs and arcane symbols.

Hulking armored killers fueled by infernal magic and cold brutality, Black Sun ogres serve as enforcers, guardians, and a nearly unstoppable assault force for those they serve. Dark priests and priestesses of the Black Sun seek out the most ruthless ogres among their followers and empower them with tattooed glyphs to enhance their tremendous strength and fortitude. Unlike many ogres, those sought for initiation into the ranks of the Knights of the Black Sun can control their ferocity and rage, holding it back until it is needed most.

entries.name: Infernally Empowered
entries: Once selected to join the Knights of the Black Sun, these ogres undergo a series of torturous and unholy rituals, their skin marked to channel infernal energy into their bodies. This new power gives Black Sun ogres greater protection and fuels their already brutal attacks into something otherworldly. When caught at a distance, Black Sun ogres can call upon these infernal brandings to shred their opponents with dark energy from afar. Up close, the unholy blades of the Knights of the Black Sun writhe with malevolent magic.

entries.name: Knights of the Black Sun
entries: Black Sun ogres serve their lieges in many ways. The knights often serve as guardians for powerful priests or priestesses. Often Black Sun knights are sent on quests in pairs, an elder and a newly-branded squire, to recover lost artifacts, find scribes useful to the Black Sun's research, eliminate heretical and chosen enemies, or seek lost ruins discovered in prophecies. In war, Black Sun knights serve as a nearly unstoppable vanguard of an army, attacking in groups of ten or twenty during sieges or frontal assaults. Few armies have seen the coming of the Knights of the Black Sun and survived the experience.

monster.name: Hirudine Stalker
languages: telepathy 120 ft. (only with other hirudine stalkers)

trait.name: Amphibious
entries: The hirudine stalker can breathe air and water.

trait.name: Blood Scent
entries: The hirudine stalker has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) and Wisdom ({@skill Survival}) checks to find or track a creature that doesn't have all its hp.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The hirudine stalker makes two Bite or Spit Tooth attacks.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 2d4 + 3}) piercing damage plus 3 ({@damage 1d6}) necrotic damage, and the hirudine stalker regains hp equal to the necrotic damage dealt.

action.name: Spit Tooth
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 5} to hit, range 30/120 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 2d4 + 3}) piercing damage, and the target must succeed on a {@dc 13} Constitution saving throw or suffer one of the following effects (the hirudine stalker's choice): Anesthetic. On a failed save, the target is unaware of any damage it takes from the hirudine stalker's Spit Tooth attack for 1 hour, but it is still aware of other sources of damage.

action.name: Debilitating
entries: On a failed save, the target is {@condition incapacitated} until the end of its next turn. If the target fails the saving throw by 5 or more, it also suffers one level of {@condition exhaustion}. A creature can't suffer more than three levels of {@condition exhaustion} from this attack.

action.name: Magebane
entries: On a failed save, the target has disadvantage on Constitution saving throws to maintain its concentration for 1 hour. If the target fails the saving throw by 5 or more, it also loses its lowest-level available spell slot.

bonus.name: Hidden Predator
entries: The hirudine stalker takes the {@action Hide} action.

monster.name: Howler of the Hill
languages: and Void Speech but can't speak

trait.name: Hungry Void Traveler
entries: The howler of the hill doesn't require air, drink, or sleep.

trait.name: Inscrutable
entries: The howler is immune to any effect that would sense its emotions or read its thoughts, as well as any divination spell that it refuses. Wisdom ({@skill Insight}) checks made to ascertain the howler's intentions or sincerity have disadvantage.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The howler of the hill uses Gloaming Howl. It then makes three Claw or Psychic Bolt attacks.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 11} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}15 ({@damage 2d8 + 6}) slashing damage plus 13 ({@damage 3d8}) psychic damage.

action.name: Psychic Bolt
entries: {@atk rs} {@hit 9} to hit, range 120 ft., one target. {@h}26 ({@damage 5d8 + 4}) psychic damage.

action.name: Gloaming Howl
entries: The howler emits a magical howl that changes in melody and frequency, depending on the light surrounding the howler. Each creature of the howler's choice that is within 120 feet of it and can hear the howl must succeed on a {@dc 18} Wisdom saving throw or succumb to the effects of one of the following howls. If a creature's saving throw is successful or the howl's effect ends for it, the creature is immune to that particular howl for the next 24 hours.

items.name: Bright Howl.
items.entry: When the howler is in bright light, each target that fails the saving throw is {@condition incapacitated} until the end of its next turn.

items.name: Dim Howl.
items.entry: When the howler is in dim light, each target that fails the saving throw is {@condition stunned} until the end of its next turn.

items.name: Dark Howl.
items.entry: When the howler is in darkness, each target that fails the saving throw drops whatever it is holding and is {@condition paralyzed} with fear for 1 minute. A {@condition paralyzed} creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

action.name: Otherworldly Hunter
entries: The howler can transport itself to a different plane of existence. This works like the {@spell plane shift} spell, except the howler can affect only itself and can't use this action to banish an unwilling creature to another plane.

trait.name: Echolocation (Whale Form Only)
entries: The hvalfiskr can't use its {@sense blindsight} while {@condition deafened}.

trait.name: Hold Breath
entries: The hvalfiskr can hold its breath for 1 hour.

trait.name: Speak with Cetaceans
entries: The hvalfiskr can communicate with dolphins, porpoises, and whales as if they shared a language.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The hvalfiskr makes four Bite or Slam attacks, or it makes three Chained Anchor attacks.

action.name: Bite (Whale Form Only)
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 11} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}23 ({@damage 5d6 + 6}) piercing damage.

action.name: Chained Anchor (Giant or Hybrid Form Only)
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 11} to hit, reach 15 ft. or range 30/60 ft., one target. {@h}28 ({@damage 5d8 + 6}) bludgeoning damage, and the anchor hooks around the target. While hooked by the anchor, the target and the hvalfiskr can't move further than 60 feet from each other. A creature, including the target, can take its action to detach the anchor by succeeding on a {@dc 19} Strength check. Alternatively, the anchor's chain can be attacked and destroyed (AC 18; hp 50; vulnerability to thunder damage; immunity to piercing, poison, and psychic damage), dislodging the anchor into an unoccupied space within 5 feet of the target and preventing the hvalfiskr from using Reel Anchor.

action.name: Slam
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 11} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}24 ({@damage 4d8 + 6}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Whale Song {@recharge 5}
entries: The hvalfiskr sings a magical melody. Each hostile creature within 60 feet of the hvalfiskr that can hear the song must make a {@dc 17} Wisdom saving throw. On a failure, a creature takes 45 ({@damage 10d8}) psychic damage and is {@condition charmed} for 1 minute. On a success, a creature takes half the damage and isn't {@condition charmed}. A {@condition charmed} creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a creature fails the saving throw by 5 or more, it also suffers {@table short-term madness}.

bonus.name: Change Shape
entries: The hvalfiskr transforms into a Huge frost giant, a Huge whale, or back into its true form, which is a whale-giant hybrid. Its statistics are the same in each form. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying transforms with it. It reverts to its true form if it dies.

bonus.name: Reel Anchor
entries: The hvalfiskr pulls on the chain connected to its anchor, returning the anchor to its empty hand. If the anchor is hooked around a creature, that creature must succeed on a {@dc 19} Strength saving throw or be pulled up to 30 feet toward the hvalfiskr.

trait.name: Fiery Blood
entries: When the ibexian takes damage, each creature within 5 feet of it must succeed on a {@dc 15} Dexterity saving throw or take 3 ({@damage 1d6}) fire damage. The fire ignites flammable objects within 5 feet of the ibexian that aren't being worn or carried.

trait.name: Fiery Charge
entries: If the ibexian moves at least 20 feet straight toward a target and then hits it with a Ram attack on the same turn, the target takes an extra 7 ({@damage 2d6}) fire damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 15} Strength saving throw or be pushed up to 10 feet away and knocked {@condition prone}.

trait.name: Pack Tactics
entries: An ibexian has advantage on attack rolls if at least one of the ibexian's allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally isn't {@condition incapacitated}.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The ibexian makes one Ram attack and one Hooves attack, or it makes two Spit Fire attacks.

action.name: Ram
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}13 ({@damage 2d8 + 4}) bludgeoning damage plus 7 ({@damage 2d6}) fire damage.

action.name: Hooves
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 2d4 + 4}) bludgeoning damage plus 7 ({@damage 2d6}) fire damage.

action.name: Spit Fire
entries: {@atk rs} {@hit 5} to hit, range 60 ft., one target. {@h}16 ({@damage 4d6 + 2}) fire damage.

action.name: Pyroclasm (1/Day)
entries: The ibexian moves up to 30 feet in a straight line toward a creature and can move through the space of any Medium or smaller creature, stopping when it moves within 5 feet of the target. Each friendly ibexian within 50 feet of the ibexian can use its reaction to also move up to its speed in a straight line toward the target, stopping when it moves within 5 feet of the target. This movement doesn't provoke opportunity attacks.

The target and each creature within 20 feet of it must make a {@dc 15} Dexterity saving throw, taking 14 ({@damage 4d6}) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. For each ibexian in the Pyroclasm after the first, the fire damage increases by 3 ({@damage 1d6}), to a maximum of 28 ({@dice 8d6}).

trait.name: Fear of Fire
entries: An ice urchin is inherently fearful of fire. If presented forcefully with fire, or if it is dealt fire damage, the ice urchin must succeed on a {@dc 13} Wisdom saving throw or become {@condition frightened} until the end of its next turn. Once it has been {@condition frightened} by a specific source of fire (such as a torch), the ice urchin can't be {@condition frightened} by that same source again for 24 hours.

trait.name: Ice Slide
entries: The ice urchin's speed increases to 60 feet when it moves on snow or ice. Additionally, difficult terrain composed of ice or snow doesn't cost it extra movement.

trait.name: Melting Away
entries: If the ice urchin takes fire damage, its AC is reduced by 2, and it has disadvantage on attack rolls until the end of its next turn.

trait.name: Spiny Defense
entries: A creature that touches the ice urchin or hits it with a melee attack while within 5 feet of it takes 3 ({@damage 1d6}) piercing and 2 ({@damage 1d4}) cold damage.

trait.name: Venomous Spine Regrowth
entries: An ice urchin has twelve venomous spines. Used spines regrow when the ice urchin finishes a long rest.

action.name: Ice Spine
entries: {@atk mw} +4, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 2d6 + 2}) piercing damage plus 2 ({@damage 1d4}) cold damage

action.name: Venomous Spine
entries: {@atk rw} +3, range 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}3 ({@damage 1d4 + 1}) piercing plus 2 ({@damage 1d4}) cold damage and 7 ({@damage 2d6}) poison damage.

trait.name: False Appearance
entries: While the ice willow remains motionless, it is indistinguishable from an ice-covered willow tree.

trait.name: Ice Melt
entries: If the ice willow takes fire damage, its icicles partially melt. Until the end of the ice willow's next turn, creatures have advantage on saving throws against the willow's Icicle Drop and Icicle Spray.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The ice willow makes two Slam attacks.

action.name: Slam
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}13 ({@damage 2d8 + 4}) bludgeoning plus 7 ({@damage 2d6}) cold damage.

action.name: Icicle Drop {@recharge 4}
entries: The ice willow shakes several spear-like icicles loose. Each creature within 10 feet of the willow must make a {@dc 15} Dexterity saving throw, taking 9 ({@damage 2d8}) piercing damage and 7 ({@damage 2d6}) cold damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

action.name: Icicle Spray {@recharge 6}
entries: The ice willow flings icicles in a 30-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a {@dc 15} Dexterity saving throw, taking 18 ({@damage 4d8}) piercing damage and 14 ({@damage 4d6}) cold damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

reaction.name: Melting Icicles
entries: When the ice willow takes fire damage, it can immediately use Icicle Drop, if available.

trait.name: Amphibious
entries: The iceworm can breathe air and water.

trait.name: Cold Physiology
entries: The iceworm can't abide constant warmth. Each hour it spends in an area with a temperature above 40 degrees Fahrenheit, the ice worm must succeed on a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw or suffer one level of {@condition exhaustion} that can't be removed until it finishes a long rest in an area with a temperature below 40 degrees.

trait.name: Heat Sensitivity
entries: The iceworm has disadvantage on attack rolls when within 5 feet of a strong source of heat that isn't a warm‑blooded creature's natural warmth, such as a torch or campfire. In addition, the iceworm can pinpoint the location of warm-blooded creatures within 90 feet of it and can sense the general direction of such creatures within 1 mile of it.

trait.name: Slippery
entries: The iceworm has advantage on saving throws and ability checks made to escape a grapple.

action.name: Icy Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d4 + 3}) piercing damage plus 7 ({@damage 2d6}) cold damage.

action.name: Icy Spit
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 5} to hit, range 20/60 ft., one creature. {@h}10 ({@damage 2d6 + 3}) cold damage, and the target is coated in freezing, viscous slime. While coated in the freezing slime, a creature's speed is reduced by 10 feet, and it has disadvantage on the first attack roll it makes on each of its turns. A creature, including the target, can take its action to clean off the slime, ending the effect.

trait.name: Essential Oiliness
entries: The imperator has advantage on saving throws and ability checks made to escape a grapple or end the {@condition restrained} condition.

trait.name: Hold Breath
entries: The imperator can hold its breath for 1 hour.

trait.name: Penguin Telepathy
entries: The imperator can magically command any penguin within 120 feet of it, using a limited telepathy.

trait.name: Siege Monster
entries: The imperator deals double damage to objects and structures.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The imperator makes one Beak attack and two Wing Slap attacks.

action.name: Beak
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}24 ({@damage 3d12 + 5}) piercing damage. If the target is a Large or smaller creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 17} Dexterity saving throw or be swallowed by the imperator. A swallowed creature is {@condition blinded} and {@condition restrained}, it has total cover against attacks and other effects outside the imperator, and it takes 21 ({@damage 6d6}) acid damage at the start of each of the imperator's turns.

If the imperator takes 30 damage or more on a single turn from a creature inside it, the imperator must succeed on a {@dc 17} Constitution saving throw at the end of that turn or regurgitate all swallowed creatures, which fall {@condition prone} in a space within 10 feet of the imperator. If the imperator dies, a swallowed creature is no longer {@condition restrained} by it and can escape from the corpse by using 15 feet of movement, exiting {@condition prone}.

action.name: Wing Slap
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}16 ({@damage 2d10 + 5}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Pelagic Bile {@recharge 6}
entries: The imperator regurgitates its stomach contents in a 60-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a {@dc 17} Dexterity saving throw. On a failure, a creature takes 17 ({@damage 5d6}) acid damage and 17 ({@damage 5d6}) poison damage and is {@condition poisoned} for 1 minute. On a success, a creature takes half the damage and isn't {@condition poisoned}. A {@condition poisoned} creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. Swallowed creatures are then regurgitated, falling {@condition prone} in a space within 10 feet of the imperator.

action.name: Toboggan Charge {@recharge 5}
entries: The imperator moves up to 30 feet in a straight line over ice or snow and can move through the space of any Large or smaller creature. The first time it enters a creature's space during this move, that creature must make a {@dc 17} Strength saving throw. On a failure, a creature takes 36 ({@damage 8d8}) bludgeoning damage and is knocked {@condition prone}. On a success, a creature takes half the damage and isn't knocked {@condition prone}.

reaction.name: Muster the Legions (1/Day)
entries: When the imperator is reduced to half its hp or lower, it magically calls {@dice 1d4} swarms of penguins. The penguins arrive on initiative count 20 of the next round, acting as allies of the vampire and obeying its telepathic commands. The penguins remain for 1 hour, until the imperator dies, or until the imperator dismisses them as a bonus action.

trait.name: Swarm
entries: The swarm can occupy another creature's space and vice-versa, and the swarm can move through any opening large enough for a Medium penguin. The swarm can't regain hp or gain temporary hp.

trait.name: Tobogganing Tide
entries: The swarm can move at double its walking speed over ice and snow.

action.name: Beaks
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 0 ft., one creature in the swarm's space. {@h}21 ({@damage 6d6}) piercing damage, or 10 ({@damage 3d6}) if the swarm has half its hp or fewer.

action.name: Toboggan Charge {@recharge 5}
entries: The swarm moves up to 20 feet in a straight line over ice or snow and can move through the space of any Large or smaller creature. The first time it enters a creature's space during this move, that creature must make a {@dc 14} Strength saving throw. On a failure, a creature takes 10 ({@damage 3d6}) bludgeoning damage and 10 ({@damage 3d6}) piercing damage and is knocked {@condition prone}. On a success, a creature takes half the damage and isn't knocked {@condition prone}.

trait.name: Aqueous Form
entries: The incandescent one can enter a hostile creature's space and stop there. It can move through a space as narrow as 1 foot wide without squeezing.

trait.name: Amphibious
entries: The incandescent one can breathe air and water.

trait.name: Flyby
entries: The incandescent one doesn't provoke {@action opportunity attack||opportunity attacks} when it flies out of an enemy's reach.

trait.name: Immortal Nature
entries: The incandescent one doesn't require food, drink, or sleep.

trait.name: Luminous
entries: The incandescent one sheds dim light in a 5-foot radius.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The incandescent one has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Magic Weapons
entries: The incandescent one's weapon attacks are magical.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The incandescent one makes two Slam attacks or three Astral Bolt attacks.

action.name: Slam
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 2d6 + 4}) bludgeoning damage plus 18 ({@damage 4d8}) cold damage.

action.name: Astral Bolt.
entries: {@atk rs} {@hit 8} to hit, range 120 ft., one target. {@h}18 ({@damage 4d6 + 4}) radiant damage, and the next attack roll made against the target before the end of the incandescent one's next turn has advantage.

bonus.name: Celestial Inspiration
entries: The incandescent one inspires one creature it can see within 60 feet of it. Whenever the target makes an attack roll or a saving throw before the start of the incandescent one's next turn, the target can roll a {@dice d4} and add the number rolled to the attack roll or saving throw.

trait.name: Amorphous
entries: The ion slime can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide without squeezing.

trait.name: Ionic Form
entries: Whenever the ion slime is subjected to lightning damage, it takes no damage and instead regains hp equal to the lightning damage dealt. The slime's Supercharge action then recharges. If the ooze takes cold damage while supercharged, it must roll a {@dice d6}. On a 1 or 2, it loses the supercharged state.

trait.name: Ooze Nature
entries: The ion slime doesn't require sleep.

trait.name: Spider Climb
entries: The ion slime can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The ion slime makes two Pseudopod attacks.

action.name: Pseudopod
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) bludgeoning plus 9 ({@damage 2d8}) lightning damage.

action.name: Discharge (Supercharged Only)
entries: The ion slime sends a shock of lightning through its supercharged pseudopod at one creature it can see within 5 feet of it, ending the supercharged state. The target must make {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw, taking 27 ({@damage 6d8}) lightning damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

Three bolts of lightning then leap to as many as three targets, each of which must be within 20 feet of the first target. A target can be a creature or an object and each can be targeted by only one of the bolts. Each target must make a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw, taking 13 ({@damage 3d8}) lightning damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

bonus.name: Charged Motion (Supercharged Only)
entries: The ion slime takes the {@action Dash} or {@action Dodge} action.

bonus.name: Supercharge {@recharge 5}
entries: The ion slime gathers ambient electricity to supercharge itself for 3 rounds. While supercharged, the ion slime gains a +2 bonus to its AC, and it gains an additional action on each of its turns. At the end of the third round, if the slime hasn't used the Discharge action, it suffers feedback, taking 18 ({@damage 4d8}) force damage. Its supercharged state then ends.

trait.name: Elemental Weapons
entries: The jinnborn's weapon attacks are imbued with its elemental power. When the jinnborn hits with any weapon, the weapon deals an extra {@damage 1d6} lightning damage (included in the attack).

trait.name: Flamboyant Defense
entries: While the jinnborn pirate is wearing no armor and wielding no shield, its AC includes its Charisma modifier.

trait.name: Knows the Ropes
entries: The jinnborn pirate has proficiency with airships, sandships, or waterborne ships (the jinnborn's choice). It adds its proficiency bonus to any check it makes to control the chosen type of ship, and it adds its proficiency bonus to any saving throws made while on the chosen type of vehicle.

action.name: Rapier
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d8 + 2}) piercing damage plus 3 ({@damage 1d6}) lightning damage.

action.name: Shortbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 4} to hit, ranged 80/320 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) piercing damage plus 3 ({@damage 1d6}) lightning damage.

reaction.name: Parry
entries: The jinnborn pirate adds 2 to its AC against one melee attack that would hit it. To do so, the jinnborn must see the attacker and be wielding a melee weapon.

trait.name: Elemental Weapons
entries: The jinnborn's weapon attacks are imbued with its elemental power. When the jinnborn hits with any weapon, the weapon deals an extra {@damage 1d6} acid damage (included in the attack).

trait.name: Flamboyant Defense
entries: While the jinnborn pirate is wearing no armor and wielding no shield, its AC includes its Charisma modifier.

trait.name: Knows the Ropes
entries: The jinnborn pirate has proficiency with airships, sandships, or waterborne ships (the jinnborn's choice). It adds its proficiency bonus to any check it makes to control the chosen type of ship, and it adds its proficiency bonus to any saving throws made while on the chosen type of vehicle.

action.name: Rapier
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d8 + 2}) piercing damage plus 3 ({@damage 1d6}) acid damage.

action.name: Shortbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 4} to hit, ranged 80/320 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) piercing damage plus 3 ({@damage 1d6}) acid damage.

reaction.name: Parry
entries: The jinnborn pirate adds 2 to its AC against one melee attack that would hit it. To do so, the jinnborn must see the attacker and be wielding a melee weapon.

trait.name: Elemental Weapons
entries: The jinnborn's weapon attacks are imbued with its elemental power. When the jinnborn hits with any weapon, the weapon deals an extra {@damage 1d6} fire damage (included in the attack).

trait.name: Flamboyant Defense
entries: While the jinnborn pirate is wearing no armor and wielding no shield, its AC includes its Charisma modifier.

trait.name: Knows the Ropes
entries: The jinnborn pirate has proficiency with airships, sandships, or waterborne ships (the jinnborn's choice). It adds its proficiency bonus to any check it makes to control the chosen type of ship, and it adds its proficiency bonus to any saving throws made while on the chosen type of vehicle.

action.name: Rapier
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d8 + 2}) piercing damage plus 3 ({@damage 1d6}) fire damage.

action.name: Shortbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 4} to hit, ranged 80/320 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) piercing damage plus 3 ({@damage 1d6}) fire damage.

reaction.name: Parry
entries: The jinnborn pirate adds 2 to its AC against one melee attack that would hit it. To do so, the jinnborn must see the attacker and be wielding a melee weapon.

trait.name: Elemental Weapons
entries: The jinnborn's weapon attacks are imbued with its elemental power. When the jinnborn hits with any weapon, the weapon deals an extra {@damage 1d6} cold damage (included in the attack).

trait.name: Flamboyant Defense
entries: While the jinnborn pirate is wearing no armor and wielding no shield, its AC includes its Charisma modifier.

trait.name: Knows the Ropes
entries: The jinnborn pirate has proficiency with airships, sandships, or waterborne ships (the jinnborn's choice). It adds its proficiency bonus to any check it makes to control the chosen type of ship, and it adds its proficiency bonus to any saving throws made while on the chosen type of vehicle.

action.name: Rapier
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d8 + 2}) piercing damage plus 3 ({@damage 1d6}) cold damage.

action.name: Shortbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 4} to hit, ranged 80/320 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) piercing damage plus 3 ({@damage 1d6}) cold damage.

reaction.name: Parry
entries: The jinnborn pirate adds 2 to its AC against one melee attack that would hit it. To do so, the jinnborn must see the attacker and be wielding a melee weapon.

trait.name: Shrill Screech
entries: When agitated, the jubjub bird makes a nearconstant shrill and high scream, giving it advantage on Charisma ({@skill Intimidation}) checks.

trait.name: Stubborn
entries: The jubjub bird has advantage on saving throws against being {@condition charmed}. In addition, Wisdom ({@skill Animal Handling}) checks are made with disadvantage against the jubjub bird.

trait.name: Unpredictable
entries: {@action opportunity attack||Opportunity attacks} against the jubjub bird are made with disadvantage.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The jubjub bird makes two Bite attacks, or it makes one Bite attack and one Constrict attack.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 10 ft., one creature. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d8 + 3}) piercing damage plus 7 ({@damage 2d6}) poison damage, and the target must succeed on a {@dc 13} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition poisoned} for 1 minute. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

action.name: Constrict
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}14 ({@damage 2d10 + 3}) bludgeoning damage, and the target is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 13}). Until this grapple ends, the creature is {@condition restrained}, and the jubjub bird can't constrict another target.

reaction.name: Impassioned Riposte
entries: When a creature the jubjub bird can see misses it with an attack while within 10 feet of it, the jubjub bird can make one Bite attack against the attacker.

trait.name: Aura of Honesty
entries: A creature that enters a space within 10 feet of the juniper sheriff for the first time on a turn or starts its turn there must succeed on a {@dc 13} Charisma saving throw or be unable to speak a deliberate lie until it starts its turn more than 10 feet away from the sheriff. Creatures affected by this trait are aware of it, and the juniper sheriff knows whether a creature in the area succeeded or failed on its saving throw.

trait.name: Sheriff's Duty
entries: The juniper sheriff knows if it hears a lie and can't speak a deliberate lie.

trait.name: Unfailing Memory
entries: The juniper sheriff remembers every creature that has ever spoken to it. If a creature has spoken to the sheriff and speaks to the sheriff again while polymorphed or disguised, the sheriff has advantage on Intelligence ({@skill Investigation}), Wisdom ({@skill Insight}), and Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks to identify or recognize that creature.

action.name: Saber
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d8 + 3}) slashing damage.

action.name: Bitter Truth
entries: {@atk rs} {@hit 5} to hit, range 60 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 2d4 + 3}) psychic damage, and the target has disadvantage on the next saving throw it makes against the juniper sheriff's Aura of Honesty within the next 1 minute.

bonus.name: Hop Away
entries: The juniper sheriff takes the {@action Dash} or {@action Disengage} action.

trait.name: Impaling Charge
entries: If the karkadann moves at least 20 feet straight toward a target and then hits it with a Horn attack on the same turn, the karkadann impales the target on its horn, grappling the target if it is a Large or smaller creature (escape {@dc 15}). Until the grapple ends, the target is {@condition restrained}, takes 18 ({@damage 4d8}) piercing damage at the start of each of its turns, and the karkadann can't make horn attacks against other targets.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The karkadann has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The karkadann makes two Hooves attacks or one Horn attack and one Hooves attack.

action.name: Hooves
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}15 ({@damage 2d8 + 6}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Horn
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}24 ({@damage 4d8 + 6}) piercing damage.

action.name: Toss
entries: One Large or smaller creature impaled by the karkadann is thrown up to 30 feet in a random direction and knocked {@condition prone}. If a thrown target strikes a solid surface, the target takes 3 ({@damage 1d6}) bludgeoning damage for every 10 feet it was thrown. If the target is thrown at another creature, that creature must succeed on a {@dc 15} Dexterity saving throw or take the same damage and be knocked {@condition prone}.

action.name: Healing Touch (3/Day)
entries: The karkadann touches another creature with its horn. The target magically regains 22 ({@damage 4d8 + 2}) hp and is cured of all diseases and poisons afflicting it.

trait.name: Elemental Nature
entries: The khamaseen doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

trait.name: Stinging Dust
entries: The khamaseen is surrounded by a cloud of swirling dust and small stones. A creature that starts its turn within 5 feet of the khamaseen must succeed on a {@dc 12} Constitution saving throw or have disadvantage on attack rolls until the start of its next turn. On a successful saving throw, the creature is immune to the khamaseen's Stinging Dust for the next 24 hours.

action.name: Slam
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) bludgeoning damage plus 5 ({@damage 2d4}) lightning damage.

action.name: Choking Cloud {@recharge 6}
entries: The khamaseen surrounds itself with a large cloud of dust and debris. Each creature within 10 feet of the khamaseen must succeed on a {@dc 12} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition incapacitated} for 1 minute. While {@condition incapacitated}, the creature is unable to breathe and coughs uncontrollably. An {@condition incapacitated} creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

reaction.name: Shock
entries: If a creature wearing metal armor or wielding a metal weapon or shield moves within 5 feet of the khamaseen, it must succeed on a {@dc 12} Dexterity saving throw or take 5 ({@damage 2d4}) lightning damage.

monster.name: Khargi
languages: understands Abyssal and Infernal but can't speak

trait.name: Deadly Infestation
entries: A creature that touches the khargi or hits it with a melee attack while within 5 feet of it takes 7 ({@damage 2d6}) poison damage as stinging insects rise up to protect the khargi.

trait.name: Death Swarms
entries: When the khargi dies, the insects crawling across and within it burst from its body, forming {@dice 2d4} swarms of insects that appear in unoccupied spaces within 5 feet of the khargi's space.

trait.name: Infested Weapons
entries: The khargi's weapon attacks are magical. When the khargi hits with any weapon, the weapon deals an extra {@damage 2d6} poison damage (included in the attack).

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The khargi makes one Bite attack and two Leg attacks.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}14 ({@damage 2d8 + 5}) piercing damage plus 7 ({@damage 2d6}) poison damage.

action.name: Legs
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 2d4 + 5}) bludgeoning damage plus 7 ({@damage 2d6}) poison damage.

action.name: Swarming Breath {@recharge 5}
entries: The khargi exhales biting, stinging insects in a 30-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a {@dc 16} Constitution saving throw, taking 31 ({@damage 9d6}) poison damage on a failed save, or half as much on a successful one.

reaction.name: Adaptive Carapace
entries: When the khargi takes acid, cold, force, lightning, or thunder damage, it can magically attune itself to that type of damage. Until the end of its next turn, the khargi has resistance to damage of the triggering type, and when it hits with any weapon, the target takes an extra 7 ({@damage 2d6}) damage of the triggering type.

trait.name: Drake Mount
entries: The drake rider has formed a bond with a Medium or larger drake mount (found in this or other books or use the statistics of a giant lizard). Regardless of the drake's intelligence, it acts as a controlled mount while carrying a drake rider, obeying the rider's spoken commands. Mounting and dismounting the drake costs the drake rider only 5 feet of movement.

trait.name: Mounted Warrior
entries: While the drake rider is mounted, its mount can't be {@condition charmed} or {@condition frightened}.

trait.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
entries: While in sunlight, the drake rider has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on sight.

trait.name: Sure Seat
entries: While mounted and not incapacitated, the drake rider can't be knocked {@condition prone}, dismounted, or moved against its will.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The drake rider makes three Spear attacks. If the rider is mounted, its mount can then make one Bite, Claw, Slam, or Tail attack.

action.name: Spear
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) piercing damage, or 7 ({@damage 1d8 + 3}) piercing damage if used with two hands to make a melee attack.

action.name: Trained Tactics {@recharge 4}
entries: The drake rider commands its mount to move up to 30 feet in a straight line, moving through the space of any Large or smaller creature and performing one of the following tactical maneuvers. This movement doesn't provoke {@action opportunity attack||opportunity attacks}.

action.name: Barrel Roll
entries: The mount flies up and over one creature in the line, ending its movement at least 10 feet past the target. As the drake rider hangs upside down at the top of the loop, it makes one Spear attack against the target with advantage. On a hit, the rider rolls damage dice three times. The mount must have a flying speed to use this maneuver.

action.name: Corkscrew Roll
entries: The mount swims in a corkscrew around the creatures in the line. Each creature in the line must succeed on a {@dc 13} Dexterity saving throw or be {@condition incapacitated} with dizziness until the end of its next turn. The mount must have a swimming speed to use this maneuver.

action.name: Weaving Rush
