entries: The mount weaves back and forth along the line. Each creature in the line must succeed on a {@dc 13} Strength saving throw or take 10 ({@damage 3d6}) bludgeoning damage and be knocked {@condition prone}.

reaction.name: Failsafe Equipment
entries: The drake rider wears wing-like arm and feet flaps folded on its back. If its mount dies or it is dismounted, the rider descends 60 feet per round and takes no damage from falling, if its mount was flying, or it gains a swimming speed of 30 feet for 1 minute, if its mount was swimming.
The kobold sits astride a drake, taking a brief respite. Words pass between them, and they laugh, their wings and scales shining.
Kobold drake riders specialize in training and riding drakes—whether through the skies, the seas, or the trees. Their skills are especially valued as scouts in times of war.

entries.name: Bonded Companions
entries: The bond of trust needed between a drake and rider to work effectively together takes time and effort to forge. Since there are so many types of drakes, these kobolds specialize, focusing their training on just a few types of drakes, either taken from tradition or from proximity. Drakes and their riders often meld their families together, creating successive generations of drakes and their riders.

trait.name: Aura of Draconic Virtue
entries: Kobolds within 30 feet of an empyrean kobold have advantage on attack rolls and ability checks. At the start of each of its turns, the empyrean kobold can choose to exclude any number of kobolds from this aura (no action required).

trait.name: Elemental Weapons
entries: The empyrean kobold's weapon attacks are magical. When the kobold hits with any weapon, the weapon deal an extra {@dice 3d8} acid, cold, fire, lightning, or poison damage (included in the attack), the kobold's choice.

trait.name: Immortal Nature
entries: The empyrean kobold doesn't require food, drink, or sleep.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The empyrean kobold has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The empyrean kobold makes three Claw attacks. It can replace one Claw attack with a use of Divine Command.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d6 + 4}) slashing plus 13 ({@damage 3d8}) acid, cold, fire, lightning, or poison damage (the kobold's choice).

action.name: Invoke the Dragon Gods {@recharge 5}
entries: The empyrean kobold channels the might of the dragon gods and exhales elemental energy in a 60-foot cone. Each creature in the area must make a {@dc 16} Dexterity saving throw, taking 49 ({@damage 14d6}) acid, cold, fire, lightning, or poison damage (the kobold's choice) on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

action.name: Divine Command
entries: The empyrean kobold chooses a creature it can see within its Aura of Draconic Virtue and directs a kobold within the aura to attack the target. The kobold can make one weapon attack against the target as a reaction.

action.name: Invisibility
entries: The empyrean kobold magically turns {@condition invisible} until it attacks or until its concentration ends (as if concentrating on a spell). Any equipment the empyrean kobold wears or carries is {@condition invisible} with it.

reaction.name: Draconic Ascension
entries: When a kobold it can see is reduced to 0 hp, the empyrean kobold can reincarnate the kobold as a wyrmling dragon of a type befitting that kobold and its virtues. The empyrean kobold can provide ascension to up to two kobolds each hour with this reaction.
This angelic kobold shimmers as its iridescent scales shift through the full color spectrum. It floats above the battlefield on ethereal, prismatic wings.

Kobold are known for fearlessly throwing themselves into battle against any foe large or small; however, few know the underlying source of their reckless approach to combat and life in general. The truth lies in kobold's desire to impress an empyrean kobold.

entries.name: Servants of the Dragon Gods
entries: Empyrean kobolds often work with, or operate on behalf of, {@creature zirnitran|ToB3|zirnitran angels}, though they operate independently until actively called upon by the angels. Similar to the {@creature zirnitran|ToB3|zirnitran angel's} observation of dragons, empyrean kobolds secretly watch the activities of kobolds, rarely choosing to reveal themselves. When an observed kobold dies while performing any action that embodies a true dragon spirit, an empyrean kobold carries out its sacred charge and reincarnates the heroic kobold as a dragon. The dragon type always matches the spirit the kobold lived and died to embody.

trait.name: Arcane Weapons
entries: The cunning artisan's weapon attacks are magical. When the ogre hits with any weapon, the weapon deals an extra {@damage 1d8} force damage (included in the attack).

trait.name: Artisan's Prowess
entries: If a magic item requires an action to activate, the cunning artisan can activate it as a bonus action instead.

trait.name: Sense Magic
entries: The cunning artisan senses magic within 120 feet of it at will. This trait otherwise works like the {@spell detect magic} spell but isn't itself magical.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The cunning artisan makes two Battleaxe attacks or three Arcane Bolt attacks.

action.name: Battleaxe
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}13 ({@damage 2d8 + 4}) slashing damage, or 15 ({@damage 2d10 + 4}) slashing damage if used with two hands, plus 4 ({@damage 1d8}) force damage.

action.name: Arcane Bolt
entries: {@atk rs} {@hit 6} to hit, range 60 ft., one target. {@h}12 ({@damage 2d8 + 3}) force damage.

action.name: Curse Item {@recharge 5}
entries: The cunning artisan curses one magic item it can see within 60 feet of it. If the item is being worn or carried by a creature, that creature must succeed on a {@dc 15} Charisma saving throw to avoid the curse. For 1 minute, the cursed item suffers one of the curses described in the Artisan Curses sidebar, as appropriate for its item type.

footer.name: Artisan Curses
entries: The cunning artisan can curse any item it creates, placing a dormant curse, a deactivation command word, or an active curse. Choose a curse that best fits the item and the story you want to tell, or use the curses listed here based on the item's type.

rows: The wearer becomes vulnerable to one of the following damage types: bludgeoning, piercing, or slashing.
Each round the item is in use in combat or other dangerous circumstance, it has a {@chance 25} chance of losing all magical properties for {@dice 1d4} rounds.
If a target succeeds on a saving throw against the item's effect, the effect rebounds on the item's wielder. If there is no saving throw, the effect has a {@chance 25} chance to rebound.
The weapon's bonus to hit, if any, becomes a penalty.

entries: This creature has the brutish build of a common {@creature ogre}, but its clothing and weapons are well-made and maintained. Beneath a heavy brow, small eyes gleam with intelligence.

Cunning artisan ogres exhibit a keen intellect and magical aptitude. They create magic items, weaving subtle curses into their creations. They can sense the auras of enchanted items and can warp those auras to cause malfunctions and misfires.

entries.name: Magic For a Price
entries: The cunning artisan creates magic items for its own personal use as well as trade. Due to its selfish and suspicious nature, these items are often cursed from the start. Likewise, any item the ogre trades or gives to another likely has a dormant curse or a command word it can use to deactivate the item, in case relations sour.

entries.name: Artisan Curses
entries: The cunning artisan can curse any item it creates, placing a dormant curse, a deactivation command word, or an active curse. Choose a curse that best fits the item and the story you want to tell, or use the curses listed here based on the item's type.

rows: The wearer becomes vulnerable to one of the following damage types: bludgeoning, piercing, or slashing.
Each round the item is in use in combat or other dangerous circumstance, it has a {@chance 25} chance of losing all magical properties for {@dice 1d4} rounds.
If a target succeeds on a saving throw against the item's effect, the effect rebounds on the item's wielder. If there is no saving throw, the effect has a {@chance 25} chance to rebound.
The weapon's bonus to hit, if any, becomes a penalty.

trait.name: Blessed Weapons
entries: The ghost hunter's weapon attacks are magical. When the hunter hits with any weapon, the weapon deals an extra {@damage 3d8} radiant damage (included in the attack).

trait.name: Ethereal Sight
entries: The ghost hunter can see 60 feet into the Ethereal Plane when it is on the Material Plane, and vice versa.

trait.name: Hidden Hunter
entries: While the ghost hunter remains motionless, it is {@condition invisible} to Undead.

trait.name: Pack Tactics
entries: The ghost hunter has advantage on attack rolls against a target if at least one of the hunter's allies is within 5 feet of the target and the ally isn't {@condition incapacitated}.

trait.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
entries: While in sunlight, the ghost hunter has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on sight.

trait.name: Undead Hunter
entries: The ghost hunter has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) and Wisdom ({@skill Survival}) checks to find and track Undead.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The ghost hunter makes three Shortsword or Hand Crossbow attacks. It can replace one attack with a Flame Jet attack.

action.name: Shortsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 1d6 + 6}) piercing damage plus 13 ({@damage 9d8}) radiant damage.

action.name: Hand Crossbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 10} to hit, range 30/120 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 1d6 + 6}) piercing damage plus 13 ({@damage 3d8}) radiant damage.

action.name: Flame Jet
entries: {@atk ms,rs} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 60 ft., one target. {@h}18 ({@damage 4d6 + 4}) fire damage. If the target is a creature or a flammable object that isn't being worn or carried, it ignites. Until a creature takes an action to douse the fire, the target takes 5 ({@damage 1d10}) fire damage at the start of each of its turns.

action.name: Holy Strike {@recharge 5}
entries: The ghost hunter flips up its eyepatch to reveal a holy relic embedded within the empty socket. Each creature within 30 feet of the ghost hunter must make a {@dc 17} Dexterity saving throw, taking 36 ({@damage 8d8}) radiant damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. If an Undead fails the saving throw, it is also {@condition stunned} until the end of its next turn.

bonus.name: Grappling Hook {@recharge 4}
entries: The ghost hunter launches its grappling hook at a Large or larger object or structure or at a Huge or larger creature it can see within 60 feet of it and is pulled to an unoccupied space within 5 feet of the target without provoking {@action opportunity attack||opportunity attacks}.

bonus.name: Elusive Hunter
entries: The ghost hunter takes the {@action Dodge} or {@action Hide} action.

reaction.name: Flame Burst
entries: When a hostile creature enters a space within 5 feet of the ghost hunter, the hunter can release a burst of fire from its clockwork hand. The creature must succeed on a {@dc 17} Dexterity saving throw or take 7 ({@damage 2d6}) fire damage and have disadvantage on the next attack roll it makes against the ghost hunter before the end of the ghost hunter's next turn.

trait.name: Expert Wrestler
entries: The leviathan hunter can grapple creatures that are two sizes larger than itself and can move at its full speed when dragging a creature it has {@condition grappled}. If the hunter grapples a Medium or smaller creature, the target has disadvantage on its escape attempts. In addition, the hunter has advantage on ability checks and saving throws made to escape a grapple or end the {@condition restrained} condition.

trait.name: Hardy Defense
entries: While the leviathan hunter is wearing no armor and wielding no shield, its AC includes its Constitution modifier.

trait.name: Hold Breath
entries: The hunter can hold its breath for 30 minutes.

trait.name: Leviathan Hunter
entries: The leviathan hunter has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) and Wisdom ({@skill Survival}) checks to find and track Large or larger creatures with a swimming speed.

trait.name: Marine Weapons
entries: The leviathan hunter's weapon attacks are magical. When the hunter hits with any weapon, the weapon deals an extra {@damage 2d8} cold damage or poison damage (included in the attack), the hunter's choice.

trait.name: Pack Tactics
entries: The leviathan hunter has advantage on an attack roll against a target if at least one of the hunter's allies is within 5 feet of the target and the ally isn't {@condition incapacitated}.

trait.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
entries: While in sunlight, the leviathan hunter has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on sight.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The leviathan hunter makes three Slam attacks, or it makes one Harpoon attack and two Slam attacks.

action.name: Slam
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}12 ({@damage 2d6 + 5}) bludgeoning damage plus 9 ({@damage 2d8}) cold damage or poison damage (the hunter's choice), and the target is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 17}). The hunter can grapple only one target at a time.

action.name: Harpoon
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}12 ({@damage 2d6 + 5}) piercing damage plus 9 ({@damage 2d8}) cold damage or poison damage (the hunter's choice), and the harpoon sticks in the target. While the harpoon is stuck, the target takes 7 ({@damage 2d6}) piercing damage at the start of each of its turns, the hunter can't make Harpoon attacks against other targets, and the target and hunter can't move further than 60 feet away from each other. A creature, including the target, can take its action to detach the harpoon by succeeding on a {@dc 17} Strength check. Alternatively, the cord connecting the leviathan hunter to the harpoon can be attacked and destroyed (AC 10; hp 25; immunity to bludgeoning, poison, and psychic damage), dislodging the harpoon into an unoccupied space within 5 feet of the target and preventing the leviathan hunter from using Recall Harpoon.

action.name: Crush
entries: One creature {@condition grappled} by the hunter must make a {@dc 17} Strength saving throw, taking 33 ({@damage 8d6 + 5}) bludgeoning damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

bonus.name: Recall Harpoon
entries: The leviathan hunter pulls on the cord connected to its harpoon, returning the harpoon to its empty hand. If the harpoon is stuck in a creature, that creature must succeed on a {@dc 17} Strength saving throw or be pulled up to 20 feet toward the hunter.

reaction.name: Grappled Redirect
entries: If the leviathan hunter is the target of an attack it can see while grappling a creature, it can hold the {@condition grappled} creature in the way, and the {@condition grappled} creature becomes the target of the attack instead.

trait.name: Pack Tactics
entries: The planes hunter has advantage on attack rolls against a target if at least one of the hunter's allies is within 5 feet of the target and the ally isn't {@condition incapacitated}.

trait.name: Planar Attunement
entries: At the start of each of its turns, the planes hunter chooses one of the following damage types: acid, cold, fire, lightning, necrotic, radiant, or thunder. It has resistance to the chosen damage type until the start of its next turn.

trait.name: Planar Weapons
entries: The planes hunter's weapon attacks are magical. When it hits with any weapon, the weapon deals an extra {@damage 3d8} damage of the type chosen with Planar Attunement (included in the attack).

trait.name: Planes Hunter
entries: The planes hunter has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) and Wisdom ({@skill Survival}) checks to find and track Celestials, Fiends, and Elementals.

trait.name: Snaring Blade
entries: If the planes hunter scores a critical hit against a creature, that creature can't use any method of extradimensional movement, including teleportation or travel to a different plane of existence, for 1 minute. The creature can make a {@dc 16} Charisma saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

trait.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
entries: While in sunlight, the planes hunter has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on sight.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The planes hunter makes three Longsword attacks.

action.name: Longsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d8 + 4}) slashing damage, or 9 ({@damage 1d10 + 4}) slashing damage if used with two hands, plus 13 ({@damage 3d8}) acid, cold, fire, lightning, necrotic, radiant, or thunder damage (as determined by Planar Attunement).

action.name: Warping Whirlwind {@recharge 5}
entries: The planes hunter bends reality around it, slicing nearby creatures with sword strikes from across the planes. Each creature within 10 feet of the planes hunter must make a {@dc 16} Dexterity saving throw, taking 18 ({@damage 4d8}) slashing damage and 18 ({@damage 4d8}) acid, cold, fire, lightning, necrotic, radiant, or thunder damage (as determined by Planar Attunement) on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

action.name: Planar Traveler (1/Day)
entries: The planes hunter can transport itself to a different plane of existence. This works like the {@spell plane shift} spell, except the hunter can only affect itself and can't use this action to banish an unwilling creature to another plane.

bonus.name: Planar Step
entries: The planes hunter teleports, along with any equipment it is wearing or carrying, up to 30 feet to an unoccupied space it can see. Glowing swirls of elemental energy appear at the origin and destination when it uses this bonus action.

reaction.name: Parry
entries: The planes hunter adds 4 to its AC against one melee attack that would hit it. To do so, the hunter must see the attacker and be wielding a melee weapon.

trait.name: Crafty
entries: The sapper has advantage on ability checks made to pick locks or to detect, disarm, or set traps.

trait.name: Evasion
entries: If the sapper is subjected to an effect that allows a Dexterity saving throw to take only half damage, the sapper instead takes no damage if it succeeds on the saving throw, and only half damage if it fails.

trait.name: Pack Tactics
entries: The sapper has advantage on attack rolls against a target if at least one of the sapper's allies is within 5 feet of the target and the ally isn't {@condition incapacitated}.

trait.name: Siege Monster
entries: The sapper deals double damage to objects and structures.

trait.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
entries: While in sunlight, the sapper has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on sight.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The sapper makes three Mining Pick attacks. It can replace one attack with a use of Throw Explosive.

action.name: Mining Pick
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) piercing damage.

action.name: Throw Explosive
entries: The sapper throws a minor explosive at one creature it can see within 30 feet of it. The target must make a {@dc 13} Dexterity saving throw. On a failure, a creature takes 9 ({@damage 2d8}) force damage and is knocked {@condition prone}. On a success, a creature takes half the damage and isn't knocked {@condition prone}.

action.name: Explosive Charge {@recharge 5}
entries: The sapper throws a powerful explosive at a point it can see on the ground within 60 feet of it. Each creature within 15 feet of that point must make a {@dc 13} Dexterity saving throw. On a failure, a creature takes 9 ({@damage 2d8}) fire damage and 9 ({@damage 2d8}) force damage and is pushed up to 10 feet away from the point and knocked {@condition prone}. On a success, a creature takes half the damage and isn't pushed or knocked {@condition prone}. If a creature fails the saving throw by 5 or more, it is also {@condition deafened} for 1 minute. Alternatively, the sapper can place the explosive in a space within 5 feet of it and delay the explosion until the end of the sapper's next turn or when a creature moves to a space within 5 feet of the explosive, whichever happens first.
The kobold's scales are covered in soot. and a bit of smoke trickles up from its gear. It excitedly pores over maps and floorplans.
A sapper's job is to helps their allies move, fight, and survive. As combat engineers they take on a wide variety of roles, but what they cherish most is blowing up enemy defenses.

entries.name: Breaking Things
entries: Sappers are adept at breaking things: tunneling into fortresses, destroying bridges, busting through fortifications, or similar acts of structural destruction. Whether able to plan for weeks or forced to improvise on the spot, they have a hundred solutions for every problem—some of which will likely even minimize collateral damage.

entries.name: Black Powder
entries: By far, black powder is the sapper's favored tool, and few problems can't be solved with it. Black powder isn't always available, but that doesn't stop sappers. With just a little time, sappers can formulate magical explosions without the need for black powder, using what's on hand and a guarded alchemical formulation or two.

trait.name: Toxic Ichor
entries: While submerged in water, the lakescourge lotus's ichor taints the water within 10 feet of it. When a creature enters the area for the first time on a turn or starts its turn there, that creature must succeed on a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition poisoned} while it remains in the area and for 1 minute after it leaves. A {@condition poisoned} creature that is no longer in the water can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. If the purify food and drink spell is cast on a space within 5 feet of the lakescourge lotus or on the space it occupies, this trait ceases to function for 1 minute.

trait.name: Undead Nature
entries: The lakescourge lotus doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

trait.name: Waterwalker
entries: The lakescourge lotus can walk across the surface of water as if it were solid ground. This trait otherwise works like the {@spell water walk} spell but isn't itself magical.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The lakescourge lotus makes two Tainted Claw or Poisonous Water Jet attacks.

action.name: Tainted Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) slashing damage plus 9 ({@damage 2d8}) poison damage, and the target must succeed on a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition poisoned} for 1 minute. A {@condition poisoned} creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

action.name: Poisonous Water Jet
entries: {@atk rs} {@hit 5} to hit, range 60 ft., one target. {@h}15 ({@damage 3d8 + 2}) poison damage.

action.name: Enter Reflection
entries: The lakescourge lotus touches a body of water large enough to hold it and becomes a reflection on the surface of the water. While in this form, the lotus has immunity to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage from nonmagical attacks and resistance to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage from magical attacks. While a reflection, its speed is reduced to 5 feet, it can't make Tainted Claw attacks, and it can revert to its true form as a bonus action. If the lakescourge lotus takes damage that isn't bludgeoning, piercing, or slashing while it is a reflection, it is forced back into its true form.

monster.name: Leashed Lesion
languages: understands Void Speech but can't speak

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The leashed lesion makes one Bite attack and two Claw attacks.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d8 + 2}) piercing damage plus 5 ({@damage 2d4}) necrotic damage. The lesion and any creature {@condition grappled} by its Life Tether regain hp equal to the necrotic damage dealt.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) slashing damage.

action.name: Draining Burst {@recharge 5}
entries: The leashed lesion selects a point it can see within 120 feet of it. Each creature within 20 feet of that point must make a {@dc 12} Constitution saving throw, taking 13 ({@damage 3d8}) necrotic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. The lesion and any creature {@condition grappled} by its Life Tether each gain 13 ({@damage 3d8}) temporary hp.

bonus.name: Life Tether
entries: The leashed lesion attaches a symbiotic tether to a creature sitting in the recess in its back. A creature in the recess that isn't attached to the tether takes 7 ({@damage 2d6}) piercing damage at the end of the lesion's turn, and the lesion regains hp equal to the damage dealt. While the tether is attached, the creature is {@condition grappled} by the lesion. The lesion or the creature can detach the tether as a bonus action. The lesion can have its symbiotic tether attached to only one creature at a time.

trait.name: Sense Magic
entries: The ley wanderer senses magic within 120 feet of it at will. This trait otherwise works like the {@spell detect magic} spell but isn't itself magical.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The ley wanderer makes three Slam or Psychic Lash attacks.

action.name: Slam
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d8 + 2}) bludgeoning damage plus 9 ({@damage 2d8}) psychic damage.

action.name: Psychic Lash
entries: {@atk rs} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 120 ft., one target. {@h}17 ({@damage 3d8 + 4}) psychic damage.

action.name: Dispelling Burst {@recharge 5}
entries: The ley wanderer emits a psychic burst that disrupts magic within 30 feet of it. Each creature in the area must make a {@dc 15} Intelligence saving throw, taking 27 ({@damage 6d8}) psychic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. In addition, each spell of 3rd level or lower in the area immediately ends, and the ley wanderer gains 5 temporary hp for each spell ended in this way.

action.name: Teleport (3/Day)
entries: The ley wanderer magically teleports itself and up to six willing creatures holding hands with the ley wanderer, along with any equipment they are wearing or carrying, to a location the ley wanderer is familiar with, up to 100 miles away. If the destination is a location rich in magical energy, such as a ley line, the ley wanderer can teleport up to 300 miles away.

bonus.name: Drain Magic Item
entries: The ley wanderer drains the magic from an item it is holding. A magic item with charges loses {@dice 1d6} charges, an item with limited uses per day loses one daily use, and a single-use item, such as a potion or spell scroll is destroyed. All other magic items have their effects suppressed for 1 minute. The ley wanderer gains 5 temporary hp each time it drains a magic item. A drained item regains its magic after 24 hours.

reaction.name: Absorb Spell
entries: When a creature the ley wanderer can see within 30 feet of it casts a spell, the ley wanderer can absorb the spell's energy, countering it. This works like the {@spell counterspell} spell, except the ley wanderer must always make a spellcasting ability check, no matter the spell's level. Its ability check for this is +7. If it successfully counters the spell, the ley wanderer gains 5 temporary hp for each level of the spell.

resist.note: from nonmagical attacks not made with cold iron weapons

trait.name: Draw Life Essence
entries: The life broker can spend 10 minutes coaxing the life essence out of a willing creature, taking only the agreed‑upon amount of time from the creature's maximum lifetime. The life essence appears as a rosy mist that rises from the mouth, nose, or skin of the creature and snakes into a carved crystal vial in the broker's cloak, where it takes on the form of a crimson liquid. A creature that drinks such a vial gains the life stored within it, provided the life broker gave the vial willingly. If the life broker draws all the remaining life from a creature, that creature dies, and it can be returned to life only by means of a {@spell wish} spell.

trait.name: Life Reading
entries: If the life broker spends 1 minute studying a mortal creature it can see within 30 feet of it, the broker can determine the remainder of that creature's natural life, to the second.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The life broker has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Necrotic Weapons
entries: The life broker's weapon attacks are magical. When the life broker hits with any weapon, the weapon deals an extra {@damage 4d8} necrotic damage (included in the attack).

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The life broker makes three Rapier attacks.

action.name: Rapier
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d8 + 4}) piercing plus 18 ({@damage 4d8}) necrotic damage.

action.name: Life Feast {@recharge 5}
entries: The life broker pulls life from hostile creatures within 30 feet of it that aren't Constructs or Undead. Each such creature in the area must make a {@dc 18} Constitution saving throw, taking 36 ({@damage 8d8}) necrotic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. The life broker gains temporary hp equal to the single highest amount of necrotic damage dealt and has advantage on attack rolls until the end of its next turn.

bonus.name: Quick-Footed
entries: The life broker takes the {@action Dash}, {@action Disengage}, or {@action Dodge} action.

trait.name: False Appearance
entries: While the light eater remains motionless in dim light or darkness, it is indistinguishable from a normal rock.

trait.name: Light Absorption
entries: When the light eater starts its turn within 5 feet of a source of light, the light is reduced while the light eater remains within 100 feet of the light source. Bright light becomes dim light, and dim light becomes darkness. If the light eater reduces a light source's light to darkness, the light eater sheds multicolored bright light in a 20-foot radius and dim light for an additional 20 feet for 1 hour, and the light source is extinguished if it is nonmagical flame or dispelled if it was created by a spell of 2nd level or lower.

trait.name: Light Sense
entries: The light eater can pinpoint the location of any source of light within 100 feet of it and can sense the general direction of any source of light within 1 mile of it.

action.name: Tentacle
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) bludgeoning damage.

variant.name: Light Eater Familiars
entries: Some light eaters are willing to serve spellcasters as a familiar. Such light eaters have the following trait.

entries.name: Familiar
entries: The light eater can serve another creature as a familiar, forming a magic, telepathic bond with that willing companion. While the two are bonded, the companion can sense what the light eater senses as long as they are within 1 mile of each other. While the light eater is within 10 feet of its companion, the companion gains resistance to radiant damage. At any time and for any reason, the light eater can end its service as a familiar, ending the telepathic bond.

items.name: Familiar
entries: The light eater can serve another creature as a familiar, forming a magic, telepathic bond with that willing companion. While the two are bonded, the companion can sense what the light eater senses as long as they are within 1 mile of each other. While the light eater is within 10 feet of its companion, the companion gains resistance to radiant damage. At any time and for any reason, the light eater can end its service as a familiar, ending the telepathic bond.

trait.name: Brittle
entries: If the living soot takes cold damage, it partially freezes; its speed is reduced by 10 feet and its AC is reduced by 2 until the end of its next turn.

trait.name: Choking Air Form
entries: The living soot can enter a hostile creature's space and stop there, and it can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide without squeezing. In addition, when a creature starts its turn in the same space as the living soot, the creature must succeed on a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw or take 7 ({@damage 2d6}) poison damage and be unable to breathe until it starts its turn outside the soot's space.

trait.name: Elemental Nature
entries: The living soot doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

trait.name: False Appearance
entries: While the living soot remains motionless, it is indistinguishable from a tangled mass of blackened, dusty webbing.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The elemental makes two Slam attacks, or it makes one Slam attack and one Constrict attack.

action.name: Slam
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}14 ({@damage 2d8 + 5}) bludgeoning damage plus 7 ({@damage 2d6}) poison damage.

action.name: Constrict
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}14 ({@damage 2d8 + 5}) bludgeoning damage, and the target is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 15}). Until this grapple ends, the target is {@condition restrained}, and the living soot can't Constrict another target.

action.name: Engulfing Sootstorm {@recharge 4}
entries: The living soot spins violently in place, spreading out tendrils of thick, poisonous ash. Each creature within 20 feet of it must make a {@dc 15} Dexterity saving throw. On a failure, a creature takes 21 ({@damage 6d6}) poison damage and its speed is halved. On a success, a creature takes half the damage and its speed isn't reduced. The speed reduction lasts until a creature spends an action cleaning off the ash.

trait.name: Danger From Above
entries: If the lobe lemur jumps at least 10 feet straight toward a creature from a higher position than the target, such as leaping down from a tree, it has advantage on the next attack roll it makes against that creature.

trait.name: Standing Leap
entries: The lobe lemur's long jump is up to 30 feet and its high jump is up to 15 feet, with or without a running start.

trait.name: Swamp Camouflage
entries: The lobe lemur has advantage on Dexterity ({@skill Stealth}) checks made to hide in swampy terrain.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The lobe lemur makes three Claw Swipe attacks, or it makes one Face Clamp attack and two Claw Swipe attacks.

action.name: Claw Swipe
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 2d4 + 4}) slashing damage.

action.name: Face Clamp
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 2d4 + 4}) piercing damage, and the lobe lemur attaches to the target's head. If the lobe lemur is already attached to the target when it hits with this attack, the attack doesn't deal damage.

Instead, the target is {@condition blinded} until the end of its next turn. While attached to the target, the lobe lemur can attack no other creature except the target but has advantage on its attack rolls. The lemur's speed also becomes 0, it can't benefit from any bonus to its speed, and it moves with the target.

A creature, including the target, can take its action to detach the lemur by succeeding on a {@dc 14} Strength check. On its turn, the lemur can detach itself from the target by using 5 feet of movement.

trait.name: Scent of Death
entries: Any creature that isn't Undead and that starts its turn within 5 feet of the kadag ogre must succeed on a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition poisoned} until the start of its next turn. On a successful saving throw, the creature is immune to the kadag ogre's Scent of Death for 1 hour.

trait.name: Undead Affinity
entries: An Undead has disadvantage on attack rolls against the kadag ogre if the ogre hasn't attacked that Undead within the past 24 hours. In addition, each skeleton and zombie within 30 feet of the kadag ogre that has no master follows the ogre's verbal commands until a master asserts magical control over it.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The kadag ogre makes three Spear attacks.

action.name: Spear
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 10 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}12 ({@damage 2d6 + 5}) piercing damage, or 14 ({@damage 2d8 + 5}) piercing damage if used with two hands to make a melee attack.

action.name: Master of Death {@recharge 5}
entries: The kadag ogre empowers up to three friendly Undead it can see within 30 feet of it. Each empowered Undead can use a reaction to move up to half its speed and make one melee weapon attack. In addition, an empowered Undead gains 5 ({@damage 2d4}) temporary hit points for 1 minute. The kadag ogre can't empower Undead with an Intelligence score of 10 or higher.
This gray-skinned {@creature ogre} is clad in worked leather and stands straighter than its brethren. The stench of rotting flesh radiates from the creature.

Occasionally, an {@creature ogre} will seclude itself and master its hunger. Claiming a cave atop a desolate mountainside or deep in the badlands, the {@creature ogre} becomes a hermit and leaves its caves only to ritualistically murder whatever it finds. {@creature ogre||Ogres} that stick through the process and resist the urge to feast eventually become kadag ogres, strengthened by murder and masters of their own urges. They are smarter and tougher than most of their kin but are much less sociable.

entries.name: Masters of Death
entries: While not true necromancers, the rites performed by kadag ogres make them kin to the undead. Their flesh is hardened against death magic, their mere presence sickens the living, and they can command lesser undead in their vicinity. These rites require sacrifices of intelligent creatures, and kadag ogres often prey upon travelers or nearby villagers for the materials they need. Some kadag ogres corral masterless undead, using them to guard territory, gather sacrifices, and protect the ogre's isolation.

entries.name: Cryptic Monsters
entries: The secretive lives of these ogres means that most of their victims don't know what they face. Villages tell tales of the Monster in the Wastes, or a petty necromancer with a hulking servant, or the giant that eats those who intrude upon its secret lair. Other ogres speak reverently of the wise death hermits, teaching that any {@creature ogre} can become a kadag with enough dedication. Occasionally, some warlord or necromancer seeks out a kadag ogre and entreats it into service. Most fail, but some manage to bully, bribe, or trick the ogre into service, where they serve as surly lieutenants over undead and other {@creature ogre||ogres}.

entries.name: Mountain Ambushers
entries: Kadag ogres prefer the narrow passes and limited sightlines of the high mountains, both for the isolation and the advantages it provides over their prey. They enjoy ambushing groups passing in front of their cave mouths and flinging those capable of fighting back off the side of the mountain.

trait.name: Devouring Charge (Boar Form Only)
entries: If the rainforest ogre moves at least 20 feet straight toward a target and then hits it with a Tusk attack on the same turn, the target must succeed on a {@dc 14} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}. If the target is {@condition prone}, the ogre can make one Bite attack against it as a bonus action.

trait.name: Fey Ancestry
entries: The rainforest ogre has advantage on saving throws against being {@condition charmed}, and magic can't put the ogre to sleep.

trait.name: Speak with Beasts
entries: The rainforest ogre can communicate with Beasts as if they shared a language.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The rainforest ogre makes two Spear or Tusk attacks and one Bite attack.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 1d10 + 4}) piercing damage, and the ogre gains 5 ({@damage 2d4}) temporary hp.

action.name: Spear (Ogre Form Only)
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 10 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 2d6 + 4}) piercing damage, or 13 ({@damage 2d8 + 4}) piercing damage if used with two hands to make a melee attack.

action.name: Tusk (Boar Form Only)
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 2d6 + 4}) piercing damage.

bonus.name: Change Shape
entries: The rainforest ogre transforms into a Large boar or back into its true form, which is an ogre. Its statistics are the same in each form. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying isn't transformed. It reverts to its true form if it dies.
This fearsome, hulking brute has thick green skin, pointed ears, and a large mouth full of sharp teeth. Its bare-chested body is adorned with macabre piercings and bone jewelry.

Also known as negoogunogumbar, or "hunger of the forest," by locals, these terrifying jungle-dwellers stand around 11 feet tall and weigh over 1,000 pounds. Much smarter than common {@creature ogre||ogres}, rainforest ogres were once creatures of the fey realms, serving hags in deep forests or underworld caverns or working as bodygaruds for unseelie fey rulers. Banished to the mortal world for reasons long lost to time, rainforest ogres now stalk the jungles of the world, consuming whatever they can catch and decorating themselves with the bones.

entries.name: Humanoid Hunters
entries: Rainforest ogres are rightly feared as man-eaters. Although they will eat anything—even nuts and berries if they have to—they enjoy the taste of humanoid flesh above all else, making their homes in caves close to villages to ensure a steady supply of fresh meat. Hunting mostly at night, an ogre sneaks through the jungle as quietly as its large size allows, then then swiftly kills a sentry or snatches a villager. The ogre prefers to eat its victims raw and is often so hungry it doesn't wait to return to its lair before consuming its prey.

entries.name: Boar Affinity
entries: If an alarm is raised in a village where the rainforest ogre is hunting, it assumes the form of a {@creature giant boar} and furiously charges its assailants, bringing what remains back to its cave to feed the giant forest boars it keeps as pets and emergency food supplies. Humanoids living in jungles where rainforest ogres are found kill forest hogs on sight, but they avoid eating the meat because of the animal's associations with the ogre.

walk.condition: (20 ft., swim 30 ft. in crocodile or hybrid form)

immune.note: from nonmagical attacks not made with silvered weapons

trait.name: Hold Breath (Crocodile or Hybrid Form Only)
entries: The werecrocodile can hold its breath for 15 minutes.

action.name: Multiattack (Humanoid or Hybrid Form Only)
entries: The werecrocodile makes two Tail Swipe or Khopesh attacks, or it makes one Bite attack and one Tail Swipe attack.

action.name: Bite (Crocodile or Hybrid Form Only)
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d10 + 2}) piercing damage, and the target is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 12}). Until this grapple ends, the target is {@condition restrained}, and the werecrocodile can't bite another target. If the target is a Humanoid, it must succeed on a {@dc 12} Constitution saving throw or be cursed with werecrocodile lycanthropy.

action.name: Tail Swipe (Crocodile or Hybrid Form Only)
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target not {@condition grappled} by the werecrocodile. {@h}7 ({@damage 2d4 + 2}) bludgeoning damage, and the target must succeed on a {@dc 12} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}.

action.name: Khopesh (Humanoid Form Only)
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d8 + 2}) slashing damage, or 7 ({@damage 1d10 + 2}) slashing damage if used with two hands.

bonus.name: Change Shape
entries: The werecrocodile transforms into a Large crocodile or into a crocodile-humanoid hybrid, or back into its true form, which is Humanoid. Its statistics, other than its size, are the same in each form. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying transforms with it. If the werecrocodile dies, it reverts to its true form.
This well-muscled human's smile is a little too wide and its teeth a little too sharp.
Werecrocodiles inhabit many cities and villages on the banks of great rivers and lakes.

entries.name: Big Grins
entries: In humanoid form, werecrocodiles are well-muscled and have a disconcerting smile that is just a bit too wide. They like to wield khopeshes and other brutal slashing weapons in battle.

entries.name: Mistaken for Merchants
entries: Werecrocodiles are often confused for {@creature subek|ToB}, which can lead to nasty surprises for those seeking knowledge or goods. The indifference that subek feel toward werecrocodiles doesn't help the situation, leaving those who bargain with them always on edge, never knowing if they're dealing with a {@creature subek|ToB} merchant or a duplicitous werecrocodile.

trait.name: Stone Chomper
entries: The rockchewer ogre deals double damage to stone objects and structures with its bite attack.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The rockchewer ogre makes two Slam attacks or one Bite attack and one Slam attack.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}18 ({@damage 3d8 + 5}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Slam
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}15 ({@damage 3d6 + 5}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Rock
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 8} to hit, range 60/240 ft., one target. {@h}21 ({@damage 3d10 + 5}) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 15} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}.

action.name: Chew Rock
entries: The rockchewer ogre thoroughly crushes a rock in its large maw, reducing it to rubble.

action.name: Gravel Spray
entries: The rockchewer ogre spits out a 15-foot cone of crunched up rock. Each creature in that area must make a {@dc 15} Dexterity saving throw, taking 21 ({@damage 6d6}) bludgeoning damage, or half as much damage on a successful one. The rockchewer ogre can use this action only if it has used Chew Rock within the past minute.

bonus.name: Quick Chew {@recharge 6}
entries: The rockchewer ogre uses Chew Rock.

reaction.name: Rock Catching
entries: If a rock or similar object is hurled at the rockchewer ogre, the ogre can, with a successful {@dc 10} Dexterity saving throw, catch the missile and take no bludgeoning damage from it.

Rough stone forms the skin of this towering giant. It pulls a rock from the bag slung over its shoulder and bites down on it as one would a piece of fruit. When the giant speaks, loose gravel spurts from its mouth.
Rockchewer ogres roam hills, mountains, and badlands that contain exposed stone. They often share territory with stone giants, though the giants consider the ogres' presence an infestation.

entries.name: Absentminded Gnawers
entries: Rockchewer ogres eat natural and worked stone. They compulsively chew on it, which can include castles, towers, or walls. They can quickly devastate foundations, as they typically eat 50 pounds of stone each day. Considering the powerful force required to chew stone, the creatures fortunately forgo biting softer targets. Their fussiness about the experience of chewing tough materials extends to the speed at which they eat. Rockchewer ogres prefer to take their time with their food, rolling the remnants around in their mouths as they eat. Even in cases where they must quickly crush stone to spit devastating cones of debris in combat, the ogres are reluctant to hurry.

entries.name: Deadly Play
entries: The ogres enjoy chucking rocks at each other as a game. On most throws, they fail to catch the projectile, and their bodies withstand most of the impact. A typical match sees rocks thudding against the ogres' torsos while they laugh. Because the ogres greet each other with thrown rocks, they often toss rocks at any new "friends" they meet. They quickly apologize for any harm done, provided the response consists of harsh words and not drawn weapons.

entries.name: Tolerated by Stone Giants
entries: Rockchewer ogres feel a kinship to {@creature stone giant||stone giants} and often migrate to the giants' strongholds. Many {@creature stone giant||stone giants} believe the ogres are distant relatives and begrudgingly accept them into the midst. The ogres put the giants' patience to the test, however, as they thoughtlessly chew on homes, art, or important monuments. {@creature stone giant||Stone giants} prefer not to kill rockchewer ogres; instead, they lead the easily distracted ogres to quarries and mines away from {@creature stone giant} homes.

monster.name: Wereotter

walk.condition: (swim 40 ft. in otter or hybrid form)

immune.note: from nonmagical attacks not made with silvered weapons

senses: darkvision 60 ft. (otter and hybrid forms only)

trait.name: Hold Breath
entries: The wereotter can hold its breath for 10 minutes.

trait.name: Keen Hearing and Smell
entries: The wereotter has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on hearing or smell.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The wereotter makes three Javelin attacks, or it makes one Bite attack and two Javelin attacks. It can replace one Javelin attack with a Net attack.

action.name: Bite (Otter or Hybrid Form Only)
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d4 + 3}) piercing damage. If the target is a Humanoid, it must succeed on a {@dc 11} Constitution saving throw or be cursed with wereotter lycanthropy.

action.name: Javelin (Humanoid or Hybrid Form Only)
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 3} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 30/120 ft., one target. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d6 + 1}) piercing damage.

action.name: Net (Humanoid or Hybrid Form Only)
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 3} to hit, range 5/15 ft., one target. {@h}A Large or smaller creature hit by the net is {@condition restrained} until it is freed. The net has no effect on creatures that are formless or creature that are Huge or larger. A creature, including the target, can take its action to free the {@condition restrained} target by succeeding on a {@dc 11} Strength check. Dealing 5 slashing damage to the net (AC 10) frees the target without harming it, ending the effect and destroying the net.

bonus.name: Change Shape
entries: The wereotter transforms into a Medium otterhumanoid hybrid or into a Large otter, or back into its true form, which is Humanoid. Its statistics, other than its size, are the same in each form. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying isn't transformed. It reverts to its true form if it dies.
Its soft pelt glimmering, the bipedal otter climbs onto the river's shoreline, water cascading off its fur. Tugging a short rope, the creature hoists up a net, brimming with flapping fish.

Wereotters are gentle, thoughtful lycanthropes with an air of mischievousness. In humanoid form, they remain quite calm, even in the face of threats, though they can become fierce when protecting themselves or a loved one. Wereotters do their utmost to not spread their curse to others and will bite a humanoid only when no other options are present. When facing hostile humanoids, wereotters rely on their net to capture a foe, then release the attacker far from the lycanthrope's home.

entries.name: Family-Oriented
entries: Groups of wereotters are extended families with the founding member cursed and passing their lycanthropy on to their children. Thus, non-lycanthropes can be found in these small clusters, having married into or been adopted by the family. These family groups tend to live outside most civilized towns and village.

entries.name: River and Swamp Dwellers
entries: Encountered most often in swamps, on lakeshores, or by rivers deep in mountain ranges or forest, wereotters use their unique skills to fish and forage for food for their family clusters. Some build small stilt villages over or along the water, while others use what nature has provided, living in large cave networks.

trait.name: Keen Smell
entries: The malmbjorn has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on smell.

trait.name: Metal Sense
entries: The malmbjorn can pinpoint, by scent, the location of any Small or larger ferrous metal, such as an iron deposit or steel armor, within 100 feet of it. It can sense the general direction of such metal within 1 mile.

trait.name: Tunneler
entries: The malmbjorn can burrow through solid rock at half its burrow speed and leaves a 15-foot-diameter tunnel in its wake.

action.name: Mulitattack
entries: The malmbjorn makes one Bite attack and two Adamantine Claw attacks.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 12} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}34 ({@damage 5d10 + 7}) piercing damage, and the target is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 18}). Until this grapple ends, the target is {@condition restrained}, and the malmbjorn can't Bite another target.

action.name: Adamantine Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 12} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}29 ({@damage 5d8 + 7}) slashing damage. This attack deals double damage to objects and structures.

action.name: Metal Volley {@recharge 5}
entries: The malmbjorn shakes itself, launching shards of metal from its hide. Each creature within 20 feet of the malmbjorn must make a {@dc 18} Dexterity saving throw, taking 45 ({@damage 13d6}) slashing damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

bonus.name: Metal Eater
entries: The malmbjorn swallows one Medium or smaller ferrous metal object within 5 feet of it. If the object is being held or worn by a creature, that creature must succeed on a {@dc 18} Strength saving throw or the malmbjorn swallows the object. If the creature holding or wearing the object is also {@condition grappled} by the malmbjorn, it has disadvantage on this saving throw. Nonmagical objects are digested and destroyed at the start of the malmbjorn's next turn. Magic objects remain intact in the malmbjorn's stomach for 8 hours then are destroyed. Artifacts are never destroyed in this way.

reaction.name: Ironhide
entries: When the malmbjorn is hit by a weapon made of metal, fur-like spikes of metal grow out of the malmbjorn's hide until the end of its next turn. While the spikes remain, the malmbjorn's AC increases 2, and any critical hit against it becomes a normal hit.

trait.name: Keen Sight
entries: The meerkat has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on sight.

trait.name: Snake Hunter
entries: The meerkat has advantage on saving throws against being {@condition poisoned}.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 3} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}1 piercing damage.

trait.name: Corral
entries: A creature in the swarm's space must succeed on a {@dc 12} Dexterity saving throw to leave the swarm's space. The creature has advantage on its saving throw if the swarm has half of its hp or fewer.

trait.name: Keen Sight
entries: The swarm has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on sight.

trait.name: Snake Hunter
entries: The swarm of meerkats has advantage on saving throws against being {@condition poisoned}.

trait.name: Swarm
entries: The swarm can occupy another creature's space and vice versa, and the swarm can move through any opening large enough for a Tiny meerkat. The swarm can't regain hp or gain temporary hp.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 0 ft., one creature in the swarm's space. {@h}10 ({@damage 4d4}) piercing damage, or 5 ({@damage 2d4}) piercing damage if the swarm has half of its hp or fewer.

trait.name: Grassland Camouflage
entries: The megantereon has advantage on Dexterity ({@skill Stealth}) checks made to hide in grassland terrain.

trait.name: Keen Smell
entries: The megantereon has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on smell.

trait.name: Pounce
entries: If the megantereon moves at 20 feet straight toward a creature and then hits with a Claw attack on the same turn, that target must succeed on a {@dc 14} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}. If the target is {@condition prone}, the megantereon can make one Bite attack against it as a bonus action.

trait.name: Running Leap
entries: With a 10-foot running start, the megantereon can long jump up to 20 feet.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}13 ({@damage 2d8 + 4}) piercing damage. If the target is a creature other than an Undead or Construct, it must succeed on a {@dc 12} Constitution saving throw or lose 2 ({@damage 1d4}) hp at the start of each of its turns due to a bleeding wound. The creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. Any creature can take an action to stanch the wound with a successful {@dc 12} Wisdom ({@skill Medicine}) check. The wound also closes if the target receives magical healing.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}11 ({@damage 2d6 + 4}) slashing damage.

trait.name: Changing Form
entries: The midnight sun's form automatically changes based on the presence or absence of light in its space.

items.name: Day Form.
items.entry: While more than half the midnight sun is in darkness, it appears as a glowing orb of light, though it sheds no light. In this form, it deals radiant damage, has immunity to radiant damage, and has vulnerability to necrotic damage.

items.name: Night Form.
items.entry: While more than half the midnight sun is in bright or dim light, it appears as an orb of darkness. In this form, it deals necrotic damage, has immunity to necrotic damage, and has vulnerability to radiant damage.

items.name: Twilight Form.
items.entry: While half the midnight sun is in bright or dim light and the other half is in darkness, it appears as a split orb of light and darkness. In this form, it deals force damage.

trait.name: Energy Being
entries: The midnight sun can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide without squeezing, and it can enter a hostile creature's space and stop there. The first time it enters a creature's space on a turn, that creature takes 3 ({@damage 1d6}) damage of the type determined by the sun's current form.

trait.name: Reality Inversion
entries: Reality is inverted for creatures close to the midnight sun. When a creature starts its turn in the sun's space or within 5 feet of the sun, any circumstance, trait, or feature that would grant it advantage, instead grants it disadvantage, and vice versa, until the start of its next turn.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The midnight sun makes three Energy Blast attacks.

action.name: Energy Blast
entries: {@atk ms,rs} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 120 ft., one target. {@h}14 ({@damage 3d6 + 4}) damage of the type determined by the sun's current form.

action.name: Energy Pulse {@recharge 5}
entries: The midnight sun emits a pulse of energy. Each creature within 15 feet of the midnight sun must make a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw, taking 28 ({@damage 8d6}) damage of the type determined by the sun's current form on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

trait.name: Mindleech Aura
entries: When a {@condition charmed} creature enters a space within 15 feet of the mindshard on a turn or starts its turn within 15 feet of the mindshard, that creature takes 7 ({@damage 2d6}) psychic damage.

trait.name: Translucent
entries: The mindshard is {@condition invisible} to creatures more than 60 feet away from it.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The mindshard makes two Refracted Light Beam attacks.

action.name: Refracted Light Beam
entries: {@atk ms,rs} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 60 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 2d6 + 3}) radiant damage.

action.name: Light Construction {@recharge 5}
entries: The mindshard bends light toward a point it can see within 60 feet of it, creating a colorful pattern on that point. Each creature within 20 feet of that point must make a {@dc 14} Wisdom saving throw. On a failure, a creature takes 14 ({@damage 4d6}) psychic damage and is {@condition charmed} and {@condition incapacitated} for 1 minute. On a success, a creature takes half the damage and isn't {@condition charmed} or {@condition incapacitated}. A {@condition charmed} and {@condition incapacitated} creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

action.name: Refract Mind (1/Day)
entries: The mindshard pulls a Humanoid with 0 hp into its body, refracting the creature into fragments of itself. The Humanoid dies and {@dice 2d4} cultists appear in unoccupied spaces within 15 feet of the mindshard. The cultists, which share the Humanoid's appearance and memories, act as allies of the mindshard and obey its telepathic commands. A Humanoid must have an Intelligence score of 5 or higher to be refracted in this manner.

reaction.name: Enthralling Defense
entries: When a creature the mindshard can see within 30 feet of it hits it with an attack, that creature must succeed on a {@dc 14} Charisma saving throw or be {@condition charmed} until the end of its next turn.

trait.name: Charge
entries: If the minotaur moves at least 10 feet straight toward a target and then hits it with a gore attack on the same turn, the target takes an extra 9 ({@damage 2d8}) piercing damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 14} Strength saving throw or be pushed up to 10 feet away and knocked {@condition prone}.

trait.name: Keen Smell
entries: The minotaur has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on smell.

trait.name: Labyrinthine Recall
entries: The minotaur can perfectly recall any path it has traveled.

trait.name: Ravening Hunger
entries: When a ravening minotaur reduces a creature to 0 hp with a melee attack on its turn, the minotaur can take a bonus action to consume the creature's heart. The minotaur's hp maximum increases by 5 for every ten hearts it consumes in this way.

trait.name: Ravening Madness
entries: The ravening minotaur has disadvantage on Intelligence checks and saving throws. It considers every creature hostile and doesn't gain any benefit from the {@action Help} action or similar spells or effects that involve helping or receiving help from friendly creatures. This trait doesn't prevent a spellcaster from restoring hp to the minotaur or curing the ravening with magic.

trait.name: Reckless
entries: At the start of its turn, the minotaur can choose to have advantage on all melee weapon attack rolls it makes during that turn, but attack rolls against it have advantage until the start of its next turn.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The minotaur makes one Bite and two Claw attacks.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d8 + 4}) piercing damage, and the ravening minotaur gains temporary hp equal to the damage dealt. The target must succeed on a {@dc 13} Constitution saving throw or becoming infected with {@disease the ravening|ToB3}.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d6 + 4}) slashing damage.

action.name: Gore
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}13 ({@damage 2d8 + 4}) piercing damage.
Blood coats the claws and mouth of this wild-eyed minotaur. It holds the dripping remains of a heart in its claw.

This feral minotaur is driven by a monstrous hunger that can be sated only by consuming the hearts of its foes. Its fur stained with blood, it fights with teeth, sharp claws, and lethal horns—though its greatest weapon is its ferocity.

entries.name: Created by Disease
entries: The ancient minotaur clans once deliberately exposed their warriors to a disease called the ravening, hoping to strengthen them. This practice led to disaster as the highly contagious disease spread, creating large numbers of ravening minotaurs—wild creatures filled with uncontrollable fury and a lust for consuming the hearts of other creatures.

trait.name: False Appearance
entries: While motionless, a monkey's bane vine is indistinguishable from a normal vine.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The monkey's bane vine makes two Tendril attacks.

action.name: Tendril
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 20 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 2d6 + 4}) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a Large or smaller creature, it is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 14}). Until this grapple ends, the creature is {@condition restrained} and takes 7 ({@damage 2d6}) bludgeoning damage at the start of each of its turns. The monkey's bane vine has two tendrils, each of which can grapple only one target.
Plump, orange fruit hangs from deep green vines wrapped around a great tree.
These deadly, semimobile carnivorous plants superficially resemble normal vines. Monkey's bane vines are found in forests and jungles, growing around the trunks of towering rainforest trees.

entries.name: Sweet Fruit
entries: In spring, the vines grow colorful blooms, and in late summer they produce tasty-looking orange fruit that attracts prey. The fruit has a sickly-sweet flavor that monkeys find irresistible; the nimble creatures are often willing to risk being grabbed by the plant's tendrils to snatch the tasty fruit.

entries.name: Food for the Roots
entries: When a creature gets too close, the vine strikes, grabbing hold with its tendrils and either ripping its prey apart or crushing the life out of it. The vine deposits the remains near its roots, where they fertilize the plant.

entries.name: Living Traps
entries: Local humanoids aware of the vine's carnivorous nature sometimes take advantage of the plant. They will grow a monkey's bane vine over a hidden treasure cache, the entrance to a tomb, or other locale as a defense against interlopers and thieves. The most reclusive and paranoid might even grow the vines near entrances to their homes as snares for would-be intruders. In areas where troops of monkeys become nuisances and infest cities and towns, these vines are sometimes deliberately cultivated to help control the monkey population.

entries.name: Risky Harvest
entries: While monkeys greatly desire the vine's fruit, it is too sweet for most humanoids. Still, some humanoids produce a liqueur from the juice of the fruit, and the resulting monkeybane brandy is popular among wealthy gnomes, goblins, orcs, and humans. Those willing to risk the danger of the vines can sell the results at a steep price.

trait.name: Lubricious Plumage
entries: The moon weaver's skin exudes an oil that permeates its plumage. The moon weaver can't be {@condition restrained} by magical or nonmagical webbing, and it ignores all movement restrictions caused by webbing.

action.name: Beak
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d4 + 3}) piercing damage.

bonus.name: Emboldening Song (2/Day)
entries: The moon weaver delivers a burst of beautiful song that motivates and emboldens one friendly creature the moon weaver can see within 60 feet of it. If the target can hear the song, it gains one Embolden die, a d6. Once within the next 10 minutes, the target can roll the die and add the number rolled to one ability check, attack roll, or saving throw it makes.

resist.note: from nonmagical attacks not made with silvered weapons

trait.name: Deathly Origins
entries: The moonless hunter can be turned and can take damage from holy water as if it was Undead.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The moonless hunter has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Nightmare Leap
entries: Once on its turn, the moonless hunter can use half its movement to step magically into the dreams of a sleeping creature within 5 feet of it. It emerges from the dreams of another sleeping creature within 1 mile of the first sleeper, appearing in an unoccupied space within 5 feet of the second sleeper. Each sleeper then must succeed on a {@dc 14} Wisdom saving throw or suffer one level of {@condition exhaustion}, as the resulting nightmares prevent restful sleep. A creature that fails this saving throw by 5 or more also suffers {@table long-term madness}.

trait.name: Spider Climb
entries: The moonless hunter can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

trait.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
entries: While in sunlight, the moonless hunter has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on sight.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The moonless hunter uses Briny Embrace, if it has a creature {@condition grappled}. It then makes two Claw attacks or one Bite attack and one Claw attack.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}13 ({@damage 2d8 + 4}) piercing damage.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 2d6 + 4}) slashing damage, and the target is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 14}). The moonless hunter has two claws, each of which can grapple only one target.

action.name: Briny Embrace
entries: The moonless hunter fills the lungs of one creature {@condition grappled} by it with seawater. The creature must succeed on a {@dc 14} Constitution saving throw or begin {@quickref suffocating||2}. A {@quickref suffocating||2} but conscious creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. The effect also ends if the creature escapes the grapple.

action.name: Whispered Terrors {@recharge 5}
entries: The moonless hunter bombards the minds of up to three creatures it can see within 60 feet of it with nightmares. Each target must make a {@dc 14} Wisdom saving throw. On a failure, a creature takes 18 ({@damage 4d8}) psychic damage and is {@condition frightened} until the end of its next turn. On a success, a creature takes half the damage and isn't {@condition frightened}. If a creature fails the saving throw by 5 or more, it also suffers {@table short-term madness}.

trait.name: Alien Nature
entries: The moonweb doesn't require air or sleep.

trait.name: Transparent
entries: A moonweb has advantage on Dexterity ({@skill Stealth}) checks while motionless or in dim light.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The moonweb makes one Dissolving Bite attack and one Tendrils attack.

action.name: Dissolving Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}13 ({@damage 2d8 + 4}) piercing damage plus 9 ({@damage 2d8}) acid damage, and the moonweb regains hp equal to the acid damage dealt.

action.name: Tendrils
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 10 ft., one creature. {@h}11 ({@damage 2d6 + 4}) piercing damage, and the target must succeed on a {@dc 14} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition paralyzed} for 1 minute. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

action.name: Etheric Pulse {@recharge 6}
entries: The moonweb releases a burst of ethereal energy. Each creature within 30 feet of the moonweb must succeed on a {@dc 14} Constitution saving throw or become partially ethereal. A partially ethereal creature's attacks deal normal damage to the moonweb, even if the attacks are nonmagical, but all other creatures have resistance to the partially ethereal creature's nonmagical damage. In addition, the moonweb can pinpoint the location of the partially ethereal creature, and the moonweb has advantage on attack rolls against the creature. A partially ethereal creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

bonus.name: Ethereal Jaunt
entries: The moonweb magically shifts from the Material Plane to the Ethereal Plane, or vice versa.

monster.name: Moppet
languages: understands one language known by its creator but can't speak

trait.name: Construct Nature
entries: The moppet doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

trait.name: False Appearance
entries: While the moppet remains motionless, it is indistinguishable from a normal doll.

trait.name: Psychic Pool
entries: The moppet absorbs psychic energy from creatures in its waking nightmare, holding up to four Psychic Points at a time. As a bonus action while casting a spell within 5 feet of the moppet, the moppet's owner can expend these points to cast the spell without expending a spell slot. To do so, the owner must expend a number of Psychic Points equal to the spell's level.

action.name: Psychic Burst
entries: {@atk ms,rs} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 60 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 2d6 + 2}) psychic damage. If the moppet scores a critical hit, it gains one Psychic Point.

action.name: Waking Nightmare
entries: Each creature with an Intelligence of 3 or higher within 60 feet of the moppet must make a {@dc 13} Intelligence saving throw. On a failure, the creature enters a collective fugue state with all other creatures that failed the save. The creature is {@condition unconscious}, but it doesn't drop anything it is holding or fall {@condition prone}. All creatures in this state are faced with a hostile nightmare creature. The nightmare creature uses the statistics of a brown bear, except it deals psychic damage instead of piercing or slashing damage. The appearance of the nightmare creature is up to the GM but should reflect the mutual fears of the affected creatures.

A fight with the nightmare creature works as normal, except all the action takes place in the minds of the affected creatures. When an affected creature is reduced to 0 hp, the moppet gains one Psychic Point. If the nightmare creature, or the moppet, is reduced to 0 hp, all creatures in the fugue state awaken. Any spell slots or class features used in the nightmare combat are expended, but magic item charges or uses aren't expended.

If a creature in the fugue state takes damage from a source other than the nightmare creature, it can immediately repeat the saving throw with advantage, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a creature's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the creature is immune to the moppet's Waking Nightmare for the next 24 hours.

bonus.name: Nimble Moves
entries: The moppet takes the {@action Dash} or {@action Disengage} action.

trait.name: Amphibious
entries: The mortifera can breathe air and water.

trait.name: False Appearance
entries: While the mortifera remains motionless and submerged in water, it is indistinguishable from a bed of lotus flowers.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The mortifera has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Poisonous Tendrils
entries: A creature that starts its turn {@condition grappled} by the mortifera must succeed on a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition poisoned} for 1 minute. A {@condition poisoned} creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The mortifera makes one Fanged Tentacles attack and two Slam attacks, or it makes three Slam attacks. It can replace two Slam attacks with a use of Chomp.

action.name: Fanged Tentacles
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 2d4 + 4}) piercing damage plus 9 ({@damage 2d8}) poison damage, and the target is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 15}). Until this grapple ends, the target is {@condition restrained}, and the mortifera can't use its Fanged Tentacles on another target.

action.name: Slam
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 1d12 + 4}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Chomp
entries: One creature {@condition grappled} by the mortifera is pulled up to 5 feet toward the mortifera's central maw, which chomps down on the creature. The target must make a {@dc 15} Strength saving throw, taking 10 ({@damage 3d6}) piercing damage and 13 ({@damage 3d8}) poison damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

action.name: Poison Spray {@recharge 5}
entries: The mortifera sprays poison from its central maw in a 30-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a {@dc 15} Dexterity saving throw, taking 27 ({@damage 6d8}) poison damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

trait.name: Keen Hearing and Smell
entries: The ogre has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on hearing or smell.

trait.name: Tentacle Senses
entries: The Void-blessed ogre can't use its {@sense tremorsense} while {@condition grappled} or {@condition restrained}.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The Void-blessed ogre makes one Tentacle Lash attack and one Void Bite attack, or it makes three Void Spit attacks.

action.name: Tentacle Lash
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. {@h}12 ({@damage 2d6 + 5}) bludgeoning damage plus 7 ({@damage 2d6}) psychic damage, and the target must succeed on a {@dc 15} Intelligence saving throw or be {@condition blinded} until the end of its next turn, as jumbled visions and voices of the Void fill its mind.

action.name: Void Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 1d10 + 5}) piercing damage plus 9 ({@damage 2d8}) necrotic damage.

action.name: Void Spit
entries: {@atk rs} {@hit 6} to hit, range 60 ft., one target. {@h}12 ({@damage 2d8 + 3}) necrotic damage.

reaction.name: Volatile Stomach
entries: When the Void-blessed ogre takes bludgeoning, piercing, or slashing damage, it can regurgitate some of its stomach contents. Each creature within 5 feet of the ogre must succeed on a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw or take 4 ({@damage 1d8}) necrotic damage and be {@condition poisoned} until the end of its next turn. A pool of Voidinfused stomach contents forms in a space the ogre can see within 5 feet of it and lasts until the start of the ogre's next turn. A creature that enters the pool for the first time on a turn or starts its turn there takes 4 ({@damage 1d8}) necrotic damage.

A purple-skinned {@creature ogre} stands hunched over, using boulders to keep itself upright. Its slack jaw filled with yellowed teeth hangs open, with green drool falling out. A dark void sits where its eyes should be, and two tentacles extend from its shoulders. Each tentacle ends in three smaller tentacles, reaching and quivering and sometimes holding it upright.

Void-blessed ogres are {@creature ogre||ogres} born in areas filled with the power of the Void or inhabited by dark creatures from the space between the stars. The volatile Void energies blessed these ogres with supernatural senses and two powerful tentacles. These tentacles increase the ogres' senses further when bored into the ground.
