The primordial matriarch can have any number of Elementals under her control at one time, provided the combined total CR of the Elementals is no higher than 10.

reaction.name: Elemental Adaptation
entries: When the matriarch would take acid, cold, fire, lightning, or thunder damage, she can change the element selected with Roiling Elements to that type of damage, gaining immunity to that damage type, including the triggering damage.

legendaryHeader: The primordial matriarch can take 3 legendary actions, choosing from the options below. Only one legendary action can be used at a time and only at the end of another creature's turn. The matriarch regains spent legendary actions at the start of her turn.

legendary.name: Elemental Change
entries: The primordial matriarch changes the damage immunity granted by Roiling Elements.

legendary.name: Fly
entries: The primordial matriarch flies up to half her flying speed without provoking {@action opportunity attack||opportunity attacks}.

legendary.name: Create Elemental (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The primordial matriarch uses Create Elementals.

legendary.name: Return to Mother (Costs 3 Actions)
entries: The primordial matriarch absorbs an Elemental within 10 feet of her, gaining a temporary hp equal to 10 times the CR of the Elemental absorbed.

trait.name: Elemental Nature
entries: The primordial surge doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

trait.name: Life From Death
entries: When the surge dies, it explodes in a burst of raw creation. The area in a 50-foot radius centered on the primordial surge is blanketed in lush flora native to the region, providing enough food to feed a dozen Large or smaller creatures for 6 ({@damage 1d12}) days. Creatures in the area that have been dead no longer than 1 day are returned to life with 4 ({@damage 1d8}) hp.

trait.name: Primordial Form
entries: The primordial surge can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide without squeezing. A creature that touches the primordial surge or hits it with a melee attack while within 5 feet of it takes 7 ({@damage 2d6}) acid, cold, fire, lightning, or thunder damage (the primordial surge's choice). In addition, the primordial surge can enter a hostile creature's space and stop there. The first time it enters a creature's space on a turn, that creature takes 7 ({@damage 2d6}) acid, cold, fire, lightning, or thunder damage (the surge's choice). A creature that starts its turn in the primordial surge's space must succeed on a {@dc 18} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition blinded} and {@condition deafened} until it starts its turn outside the surge's space.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The primordial surge makes three Elemental Strike attacks.

action.name: Elemental Strike
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 11} to hit, reach 15 ft. or range 60 ft., one target. {@h}28 ({@damage 4d10 + 6}) acid, cold, fire, lightning, or thunder damage (the primordial surge's choice).

action.name: Primordial Storm {@recharge 6}
entries: A rain of elemental energies falls around the primordial surge, producing one of the following effects:

items.name: Restorative Rain.
items.entry: Each creature within 30 feet of the surge that isn't a Construct or Undead regains 27 ({@damage 5d10}) hp. The area becomes difficult terrain as nonmagical plants in the area become thick and overgrown.

items.name: Ruinous Rain.
items.entry: Each creature within 30 feet of the surge must make a {@dc 18} Dexterity saving throw. On a failure, a creature takes 27 ({@damage 5d10}) acid damage and 27 ({@damage 5d10}) fire damage and is coated in burning acid. On a success, a creature takes half the damage and isn't coated in acid. A creature coated in acid takes 5 ({@damage 1d10}) acid damage and 5 ({@damage 1d10}) fire damage at the start of each of its turns until it or another creature takes an action to scrape or wash off the acid.

trait.name: Malleable Physiology
entries: At the start of its turn, the atavist gains one of the following benefits until it ends the effect (no action required) or the start of its next turn: {@sense Darkvision} out to a range of 30 feet.
A climbing, flying, or swimming speed of 30 feet.
Advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on hearing or smell.
Bony spikes sprout along its skin, and a creature that touches the atavist or hits it with a melee attack while within 5 feet of it takes 4 ({@damage 1d8}) piercing damage.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The atavist makes two Keratin Blade or Bone Shard attacks. If both attacks hit one target, the target takes an extra 7 ({@damage 2d6}) piercing damage as bits of bone dig deeper into the target.

action.name: Keratin Blade
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 2d6 + 4}) slashing damage.

action.name: Bone Shard
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 4} to hit, range 30/120 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 2d4 + 2}) piercing damage.

resist.note: from nonmagical attacks not made with cold iron weapons

trait.name: Beguiling Aura
entries: The mere sight of the pùca is a temptation for road-weary travelers. Whenever a creature that can see the pùca starts its turn within 30 feet of the pùca, that creature succeed on make a {@dc 15} Wisdom saving throw or be {@condition charmed} for 1 minute. A {@condition charmed} creature must take the {@action Dash} action and move toward the pùca by the safest available route on each of its turns, trying to get within 5 feet of the fey horse to mount it. Each time the creature takes damage and at the end of each of its turns, the creature can repeat the saving throw, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a creature's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the creature is immune to the pùca's Beguiling Aura for the next 24 hours.

trait.name: Nightmarish Ride
entries: If a creature mounts the pùca, the creature must succeed on a {@dc 15} Charisma saving throw or become {@condition paralyzed} and {@condition restrained} by chains on the pùca's back until the next dawn. While it has a rider captured in this way, the pùca takes the {@action Dash} or {@action Disengage} actions on each of its turns to flee with the rider. After it moves 100 feet, it disappears with the captured rider, magically racing along a nightmarish landscape. At the next dawn, it returns to the space where it disappeared or the nearest unoccupied space, the rider lands in an unoccupied space within 5 feet of the pùca, and the pùca flees. At the end of the ride, the rider suffers one level of {@condition exhaustion}.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The pùca makes two Chain Whip attacks and one Hooves attack.

action.name: Chain Whip
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. {@h}15 ({@damage 2d10 + 4}) bludgeoning damage, and the target is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 15}) if it is a Medium or smaller creature and the pùca doesn't have two other creatures {@condition grappled}. Until this grapple ends, the target is {@condition restrained}.

action.name: Hooves
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}13 ({@damage 2d8 + 4}) bludgeoning damage, and the target must succeed on a {@dc 15} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}.
A dark horse draped in thick silver chains emerges from the shadows between the trees, its eyes glowing with an eerie light.

This mysterious equine fey appears at night beside lonely forest roads and tempts weary travelers to ride it. Once upon its back, however, the púca takes the foolish individual on a nightmarish ride through the dark woods before returning them to where they started at dawn, exhausted. Those who have ridden a púca report seeing twisted, otherworldly forests and strange creatures.

entries.name: Redeemable
entries: The púca is a fey creature corrupted by shadow. If a rider who is pure of heart willingly climbs astride the púca, enjoys the ride, and thanks the púca when they return at dawn, the púca is cleansed of the shadow taint, and the chains fall away from its body. The púca is then free to aid lost travelers instead of terrorizing them.

entries.name: Púca in the Shadow Realm
entries: In the Midgard setting and the Shadow Realm, the púca can travel the shadow roads at will. During its nightmarish rides, it crosses in and out of these pathways, allowing riders to glimpse terrifying things. If a rider redeems a púca and asks for its aid, the rider can use the mount to gain access to the shadow roads.

trait.name: Blessings of the Sea Gods
entries: The puffinfolk has advantage on saving throws while flying over or swimming in ocean waters.

trait.name: Hardy Ocean Explorers
entries: The puffinfolk is considered a Medium creature when determining its carrying capacity. In addition, it can hold its breath for 30 minutes.

trait.name: Oceanic Recall
entries: The puffinfolk can perfectly recall any path it has traveled above or within an ocean.

action.name: Peck
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d6 + 4}) piercing damage.

reaction.name: Quick and Nimble
entries: When a creature the puffinfolk can see targets it with a melee or ranged weapon attack, the puffinfolk darts out of the way, and the attacker has disadvantage on the attack roll.

monster.name: Pyrite Pile
languages: understands Dwarvish and Terran but can't speak

trait.name: False Appearance
entries: While the pyrite pile remains motionless, it is indistinguishable from a normal pile of gold nuggets.

trait.name: Gold Fever
entries: When a Humanoid or xorn that can see the pyrite pile starts its turn within 60 feet of the pyrite pile, that creature must succeed on a {@dc 15} Wisdom saving throw or be {@condition charmed} until the end of its next turn. A {@condition charmed} creature must take the {@action Dash} action and move toward the pyrite pile by the safest available route on its next turn, trying to get within 5 feet of the Elemental.

trait.name: Metal Sense
entries: The pyrite pile can pinpoint, by scent, the location of precious metals within 60 feet of it and can sense the general direction of Small or larger deposits of such metals within 1 mile.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The pyrite pile makes two Slam attacks. If the pyrite pile hits one Medium or smaller creature with both attacks, the target is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 16}). Until this grapple ends, the target takes 7 ({@damage 2d6}) bludgeoning damage at the start of each of its turns. The pyrite pile can have only one creature {@condition grappled} at a time.

action.name: Slam
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}15 ({@damage 3d6 + 5}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Hurl Nugget
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 8} to hit, range 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}14 ({@damage 2d8 + 5}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Eat Gold
entries: The pyrite pile absorbs 52 ({@damage 8d12}) gp worth of nonmagical items and coins made of precious metals, ignoring copper, worn or carried by one creature {@condition grappled} by it, and the elemental regains hp equal to half that amount. Absorbed metal is destroyed.

trait.name: False Appearance
entries: While the pyrrhic podthrower remains motionless, it is indistinguishable from a clump of crabgrass.

trait.name: Flaming Seedpod Regrowth
entries: The pyrrhic podthrower has four Flaming Seedpods. Used Flaming Seedpods may regrow each turn. If the pyrrhic podthrower starts its turn with less than four Flaming Seedpods, roll a {@dice d6}. On a roll of 5 or 6, it regrows {@dice 1d4} Flaming Seedpods, to a maximum of 4.

trait.name: Regeneration
entries: The pyrrhic podthrower regains 10 hp at the start of its turn. If the podthrower takes necrotic damage or if it is {@condition grappled} and removed from the ground, this trait doesn't function at the start of its next turn. The podthrower dies only if it starts its turn with 0 hp and doesn't regenerate.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The pyrrhic podthrower makes three Grass Blade attacks, or it uses Flaming Seedpod twice.

action.name: Grass Blade
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 2d6 + 4}) slashing damage.

action.name: Flaming Seedpod
entries: The podthrower lobs a flaming seedpod at a point it can see within 60 feet of it. The seedpod explodes on impact and is destroyed. Each creature within 10 feet of that point must make a {@dc 15} Dexterity saving throw, taking 12 ({@damage 5d4}) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

reaction.name: Unstable Bulb
entries: When the pyrrhic podthrower is {@condition grappled} and removed from the ground while above 0 hp, the unstable root bulb bursts. Each creature within 10 feet of the podthrower must make a {@dc 15} Dexterity saving throw, taking 12 ({@damage 5d4}) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

trait.name: Keen Sight and Smell
entries: The quagga has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on sight or smell.

trait.name: Knife Dancer
entries: When the quagga hits a creature with a Twin Blade attack, it doesn't provoke {@action opportunity attack||opportunity attacks} when it moves out of that creature's reach.

trait.name: Pack Tactics
entries: The quagga has advantage on attack rolls against a creature if at least one of the quagga's allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally isn't {@condition incapacitated}.

trait.name: Trampling Charge
entries: If the quagga moves at least 20 feet straight toward a target and then hits it with a Twin Blade attack on the same turn, that target must succeed on a {@dc 14} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}. If the target is {@condition prone}, the quagga can make one Hooves attack against it as a bonus action.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The quagga makes two Twin Blade attacks and one Hooves attack, or it makes four Javelin attacks.

action.name: Hooves
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 2d4 + 2}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Javelin
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 30/120 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) piercing damage.

action.name: Twin Blade
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 2d6 + 4}) slashing damage.

bonus.name: War Surge
entries: When the quagga reduces a creature to 0 hp with a melee attack on its turn, the quagga can move up to half its speed and make a Twin Blade attack.

trait.name: Earth Glide
entries: The qumdaq can burrow through nonmagical, unworked earth, sand, and stone. While doing so, the elemental doesn't disturb the material it moves through.

trait.name: Elemental Nature
entries: The qumdaq doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

trait.name: Final Gift
entries: When the qumdaq dies, it bursts in a shower of sand. A qumdaq of the dying qumdaq's choice within 10 feet of it regains 5 ({@damage 2d4}) hp, or the target gains 5 ({@damage 2d4}) temporary hp if it is at its hp maximum.

trait.name: Horde Tactics
entries: The qumdaq has advantage on attack rolls against a creature if at least one of the qumdaq's allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally isn't {@condition incapacitated}. In addition, the qumdaq's weapon attacks deal an extra 2 ({@damage 1d4}) bludgeoning damage on a hit, if at least three of the qumdaq's allies are within 5 feet of the target and the allies aren't incapacitated.

trait.name: Sense Magic
entries: The qumdaq senses magic within 60 feet of it at will. This trait otherwise works like the {@spell detect magic} spell but isn't itself magical.

action.name: Slam
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d4 + 2}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Desiccation Field (1/Day)
entries: The qumdaq extends its arms, sending sand and grit swirling around itself. Each creature that isn't a qumdaq within 10 feet of the qumdaq must make a {@dc 10} Constitution saving throw. On a failure, a creature takes 5 ({@damage 2d4}) bludgeoning damage and suffers one level of {@condition exhaustion} for 1 hour, or until it drinks at least 1 pint of water. On a success, a creature takes half the damage and isn't exhausted. A creature can suffer no more than a total of three levels of {@condition exhaustion} from Desiccation Field, regardless of how many qumdaqs use the action.

monster.name: Rafflesian
languages: understands the languages of its host companion but can't speak

trait.name: Symbiote
entries: A rafflesian can bond with a willing Humanoid creature that remains in physical contact with it for 10 minutes. While bonded in this way, the host creature gains a +2 bonus to AC and saving throws and has resistance to all damage, and the rafflesian's speed is 0, moving with the host when it moves. Each time the host takes damage, the rafflesian takes the same amount of damage. If the host is subjected to an effect that would force it to make a saving throw, the host can use its saving throw bonuses or the rafflesian's. If both are subjected to the same effect, only one of them is affected, the rafflesian's choice. The rafflesian and the host otherwise retain their own statistics and take separate turns. The rafflesian and the host can't be separated, unless the rafflesian chooses to terminate the connection. The rafflesian can detach itself safely from a host over the course of 1 hour, or it can detach itself from the creature as an action, which immediately kills the host.

trait.name: Symbiotic Thought
entries: The rafflesian and its host can communicate telepathically while bonded.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The rafflesian makes three Vine Whip attacks. It can replace one attack with a use of Blood Root.

action.name: Vine Whip
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}17 ({@damage 3d8 + 4}) slashing damage.

action.name: Blood Root
entries: The rafflesian launches a root toward one creature it can see within 30 feet of it. The creature must succeed on a {@dc 15} Dexterity saving throw or take 14 ({@damage 4d6}) necrotic damage as the rafflesian drains blood from it. The rafflesian or the host (the rafflesian's choice) then regains hp equal to the damage taken.

reaction.name: Last Resort
entries: When the host dies, the rafflesian can reanimate it for up to 10 days, provided the host's body is still intact. During this time, the host is protected from decay and can't become undead. The rafflesian can use a bonus action to cause the host to move as it could in life, but the host can't take any other actions. If the host could speak in life, the rafflesian can speak with the host's voice. A host body reanimated in this way can be restored to life by any spell capable of doing so.

vulnerable.note: from magic weapons wielded by good creatures

trait.name: Arcane Weapons
entries: The myrmidon's weapon attacks are magical. When the myrmidon hits with any weapon, the weapon deals an extra {@damage 2d4} force damage (included in the attack).

trait.name: Dedicated Warrior
entries: The myrmidon has advantage on saving throws against being {@condition charmed} and {@condition frightened}.

trait.name: Limited Magic Immunity
entries: The myrmidon can't be affected or detected by spells of 1st level or lower unless it wishes to be. It has advantage on saving throws against all other spells and magical effects.

trait.name: Tiger Tag Team
entries: The myrmidon has advantage on attack rolls against a creature if at least one friendly rakshasa is within 5 feet of the creature and that rakshasa isn't {@condition incapacitated}.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The myrmidon rakshasa makes two Forked Scimitar or Arcane Bolt attacks.

action.name: Forked Scimitar
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d6 + 4}) slashing damage plus 5 ({@damage 2d4}) force damage. Instead of dealing damage, the myrmidon can disarm a target wielding a weapon. The target must succeed on a {@dc 12} Strength saving throw or its weapon lands in a random space within 10 feet of the target.

action.name: Arcane Bolt
entries: {@atk rs} {@hit 4} to hit, range 60 ft., one target. {@h}12 ({@damage 4d4 + 2}) force damage.

reaction.name: Allied Parry
entries: When a creature the myrmidon can see attacks a creature within 5 feet of it, the myrmidon can impose disadvantage on the attack roll. To do so, the myrmidon must be wielding a shield.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The myrmidon casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save {@dc 12}):

vulnerable.note: from magic weapons wielded by good creatures

trait.name: False Appearance (Object Form Only)
entries: While the pustakam remains motionless, it is indistinguishable from an ordinary object.

trait.name: Limited Magic Immunity
entries: The pustakam can't be affected or detected by spells of 2nd level or lower unless it wishes to be. It has advantage on saving throws against all other spells and magical effects.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The pustakam makes two Claw attacks or uses False Promises twice. It can replace one use of False Promises with a use of Spellcasting.

action.name: Claw (Fiend Form Only)
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 2d4 + 2}) slashing damage plus 9 ({@damage 2d8}) psychic damage.

action.name: False Promises
entries: The pustakam whispers promises of power and riches in the mind of one creature it can see within 60 feet of it. The target must make a {@dc 15} Wisdom saving throw. On a failure, a creature takes 18 ({@damage 4d8}) psychic damage and is {@condition charmed} for 1 minute. On a success, a creature takes half the damage and isn't {@condition charmed}. While {@condition charmed}, a creature has disadvantage on saving throws against the pustakam's enchantment spells. A {@condition charmed} creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

bonus.name: Change Shape
entries: The pustakam transforms into a Tiny object or back into its true form, which is a fiend. Its statistics, other than its size, are the same in each form. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying isn't transformed. It reverts to its true form if it dies.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The pustakam casts one of the following spells, requiring no material or somatic components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save {@dc 15}):

vulnerable.note: from magic weapons wielded by good creatures

trait.name: Limited Magic Immunity
entries: The servitor can't be affected or detected by cantrips unless it wishes to be. It has advantage on saving throws against all other spells and magical effects.

action.name: Dagger
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d4 + 3}) piercing damage plus 3 ({@damage 1d6}) poison damage.

action.name: Hand Crossbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 5} to hit, range 30/120 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) piercing damage plus 3 ({@damage 1d6}) poison damage.

action.name: Protecting Pounce
entries: When a rakshasa the servitor can see within 15 feet of it is the target of an attack, the servitor can move up to half its speed toward that rakshasa without provoking {@action opportunity attack||opportunity attacks}. If it ends this movement within 5 feet of the rakshasa, the servitor becomes the target of the attack instead.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The servitor casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save {@dc 11}):

reaction.name: Proteting Pounce
entries: When a rakshasa the servitor can see within 15 feet of it is the target of an attack, the servitor can move up to half its speed toward that rakshasa without provoking {@action opportunity attack||opportunity attacks}. If it ends this movement within 5 feet of the rakshasa, the servitor becomes the target of the attack instead.

vulnerable.note: from magic weapons wielded by good creatures

trait.name: Limited Magic Immunity
entries: The slayer can't be affected or detected by spells of 4th level or lower unless it wishes to be. It has advantage on saving throws against all other spells and magical effects.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The slayer makes three Rapier or Light Crossbow attacks.

action.name: Rapier
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 1d8 + 5}) piercing damage plus 7 ({@damage 2d6}) poison damage, and the target must succeed on a {@dc 16} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition poisoned} until the end of its next turn.

action.name: Light Crossbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 9} to hit, range 80/320 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 1d8 + 5}) piercing damage plus 7 ({@damage 2d6}) poison damage, and the target must succeed on a {@dc 16} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition poisoned} until the end of its next turn.

bonus.name: Cunning Action
entries: The slayer takes the {@action Dash}, {@action Disengage}, or {@action Hide} action.

bonus.name: Gain the Upper Hand
entries: The slayer studies one creature it can see within 30 feet of it, granting the slayer advantage on the next attack roll it makes against the target before the start of the slayer's next turn. If the attack hits, the slayer's weapon attack deals an extra 9 ({@damage 2d8}) piercing damage.

reaction.name: Shadow Leap
entries: When a creature moves into a space within 5 feet of the slayer while the slayer is in dim light or darkness, the slayer can teleport to an unoccupied space it can see within 30 feet of it. The destination must also be in dim light or darkness.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The slayer casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save {@dc 16}):

trait.name: Good Dog
entries: If a Humanoid that hasn't harmed the relentless hound in the last 24 hours takes an action to offer the hound a morsel of food or speak kind words to it, the hound must succeed on a {@dc 12} Wisdom saving throw or be {@condition charmed} by that Humanoid for 1 hour or until the Humanoid or its companions do anything harmful to the hound. In addition, the relentless hound has disadvantage on saving throws against the {@spell command} spell.

trait.name: Incorporeal Movement
entries: The relentless hound can move through other creatures and objects as if they were difficult terrain. It takes 5 ({@damage 1d10}) force damage if it ends its turn inside an object.

trait.name: Pack Tactics
entries: The relentless hound has advantage on attack rolls against a creature if at least one of the hound's allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally isn't {@condition incapacitated}.

trait.name: Undead Nature
entries: The relentless hound doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The relentless hound makes two Spectral Bite attacks. If both attacks hit the same target, the target must succeed on a {@dc 13} Constitution saving throw or take 10 ({@damage 3d6}) necrotic damage and its hp maximum is reduced by that amount. This reduction lasts until the target finishes a long rest. The target dies if this effect reduces its hp maximum to 0.

action.name: Spectral Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}10 ({@damage 2d6 + 3}) necrotic damage.

reaction.name: Multiply (3/Day)
entries: When the relentless hound takes damage while below half its hp maximum, it creates a spectral hound. The spectral hound uses the statistics of a shadow, except it doesn't have the Sunlight Weakness trait and it can't make new shadows when it kills Humanoids. It appears in an unoccupied space within 5 feet of the relentless hound and acts on the same initiative as that hound. After the spectral hound finishes a long rest, it becomes a relentless hound.

trait.name: Elusive
entries: The rochade has advantage on saving throws and ability checks made to avoid or escape an effect that would reduce its speed. In addition, nonmagical difficult terrain composed of natural rocks or cavernous terrain doesn't cost it extra movement.

trait.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
entries: While in sunlight, the rochade has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) rolls that rely on sight.

action.name: Thieving Slam
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d6 + 4}) bludgeoning damage. Instead of dealing damage, the rochade can steal one item the target is wearing or carrying, provided the item weighs no more than 10 pounds, isn't a weapon, and isn't wrapped around or firmly attached to the target. For example, a rochade could steal a hat or belt pouch but not a creature's shirt or armor.

action.name: Rock
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 6} to hit, range 20/60 ft, one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d6 + 4}) bludgeoning damage.

bonus.name: Relay
entries: The rochade teleports one object it is holding that weighs no more than 10 pounds into the empty hand of one friendly creature it can see within 30 feet of it. If the target isn't a rochade, it must succeed on a {@dc 14} Dexterity saving throw to catch the object, otherwise the object falls to the ground in a space within 5 feet of the target.

bonus.name: Short Step
entries: The rochade teleports to an unoccupied space it can see within 15 feet of it.

reaction.name: Switch
entries: When a creature the rochade can see targets it with an attack, the rochade can switch places with any creature it can see within 15 feet of it. An unwilling creature must succeed on a {@dc 14} Dexterity saving throw to avoid the switch. If the switch is successful, the switched creature becomes the target of the attack instead.

trait.name: Earth Glide
entries: The rock salamander can burrow through nonmagical, unworked earth and stone. While doing so, the salamander doesn't disturb the material it moves through.

trait.name: Stone Camouflage
entries: The rock salamander has advantage on Dexterity ({@skill Stealth}) checks made to hide in rocky terrain.

trait.name: Stone Spider Climb
entries: The rock salamander can climb difficult stone surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) piercing damage.

action.name: Manipulate Stone
entries: If the rock salamander is touching stone, it can manipulate stone contiguous with its location to create one of the following effects:

items.name: Rumbling Earth.
items.entry: One creature touching stone within 10 feet of the salamander must succeed on a {@dc 12} Dexterity saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}.

items.name: Softened Earth.
items.entry: One creature touching stone within 10 feet of the salamander must succeed on a {@dc 12} Strength saving throw or be {@condition restrained} by softened, mud-like stone until the end of its next turn.

items.name: Stone Armor.
items.entry: The salamander's AC increases by 2 until the start of its next turn.

variant.name: Rock Salamander Familiars
entries: Some rock salamanders are willing to serve a spellcaster as a familiar. Such salamanders have the following trait.

entries.name: Familiar
entries: The rock salamander can serve another creature as a familiar, forming a magic, telepathic bond with that willing companion. While the two are bonded, the companion can sense what the salamander senses as long as they are within 1 mile of each other. While the salamander is within 10 feet of its companion, the companion shares the salamander's Stone Camouflage trait. At any time and for any reason, the salamander can end its service as a familiar, ending the telepathic bond.

items.name: Familiar
entries: The rock salamander can serve another creature as a familiar, forming a magic, telepathic bond with that willing companion. While the two are bonded, the companion can sense what the salamander senses as long as they are within 1 mile of each other. While the salamander is within 10 feet of its companion, the companion shares the salamander's Stone Camouflage trait. At any time and for any reason, the salamander can end its service as a familiar, ending the telepathic bond.

trait.name: Earth Glide
entries: The rockwood can burrow through nonmagical, unworked earth and stone. While doing so, the rockwood doesn't disturb the material it moves through.

trait.name: Elemental Nature
entries: The rockwood doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

trait.name: Persistence of Stone (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries: When the rockwood is reduced to below half its hp maximum, Fossil Barrage recharges.

trait.name: Roiling Roots
entries: The stony roots of the rockwood make the ground within 15 feet of the rockwood difficult terrain for creatures other than the rockwood.

trait.name: Siege Monster
entries: The rockwood deals double damage to objects and structures.

trait.name: Towering Reach
entries: The rockwood doesn't have disadvantage on ranged attack rolls from being within 5 feet of a hostile creature, though it may still have disadvantage from other sources.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The rockwood makes two Whomping Slam or Rock attacks. If both Whomping Slam attacks hit one target, each creature within 5 feet of the target must succeed on a {@dc 15} Dexterity saving throw or take 9 ({@damage 2d8}) bludgeoning damage and be knocked {@condition prone}.

action.name: Whomping Slam
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}18 ({@damage 3d8 + 5}) bludgeoning damage, and if the target is a Large or smaller creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 15} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}.

action.name: Rock
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 8} to hit, range 60/180 ft., one target. {@h}16 ({@damage 2d10 + 5}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Fossil Barrage {@recharge 6}
entries: The rockwood sprays shards of stone in a 30-foot cone. feet around it Each creature in that area must make a {@dc 15} Dexterity saving throw, taking 28 ({@damage 8d6}) piercing damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

trait.name: Amphibious
entries: The savior lumen swarm can breathe air and water.

trait.name: Fleeting Memory
entries: When the savior lumen swarm leaves a creature's sight, that creature must succeed on a {@dc 16} Wisdom saving throw or remember the swarm only as softly glowing lights.

trait.name: Illumination
entries: The savior lumen swarm sheds bright light in a 20-foot radius and dim light for an additional 20 feet.

trait.name: Immortal Nature
entries: The savior lumen swarm doesn't require food, drink, or sleep.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The swarm has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Swarm
entries: The savior lumen can occupy another creature's space and vice versa, and the swarm can move through any opening large enough for a Tiny celestial. The swarm can't regain hp or gain temporary hp.

trait.name: Team Effort
entries: The savior lumen swarm is considered to be a single Large creature for the purpose of determining its carrying capacity, and it has advantage on Strength checks made to push, pull, lift, or break objects.

action.name: Flurry of Tools
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 0 ft., one target in the swarm's space. {@h}10 ({@damage 4d4}) bludgeoning damage plus 10 ({@damage 4d4}) piercing damage and 10 ({@damage 4d4}) slashing damage, or 5 ({@damage 2d4}) bludgeoning damage plus 5 ({@damage 2d4}) piercing damage and 4 ({@damage 2d4}) slashing damage if the swarm has half of its hp or fewer.

action.name: Dismantle
entries: The savior lumen swarm destroys up to a 5-foot cube of nonmagical debris, structure, or object that isn't being worn or carried.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The savior lumen swarm casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save {@dc 14}):

trait.name: Blizzard Heart
entries: Nearby weather responds to the sazakan's desires. At the start of each hour, the sazakan can choose to change the precipitation and temperature within 1 mile of it by one stage, up or down (no action required). This effect works like the changing weather conditions aspect of the {@spell control weather} spell, except the sazakan can't change the wind, the conditions change immediately, and the sazakan can never make it warm, hot, or unbearable heat.

trait.name: Icy Nature
entries: The sazakan is infused with elemental power, and it requires only half the amount of air, food, and drink that a Humanoid of its size needs.

trait.name: Wintry Aura
entries: At the start of each of the sazakan's turns, each creature within 5 feet of it takes 7 ({@damage 2d6}) cold damage.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The sazakan makes three Icy Wind Lash attacks.

action.name: Icy Wind Lash
entries: {@atk ms,rs} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 60 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d8 + 4}) slashing damage plus 7 ({@damage 2d6}) cold damage. If the sazakan scores a critical hit, the target is {@condition restrained} by ice until the end of its next turn.

action.name: Ice Whirlwind {@recharge 5}
entries: The sazakan surrounds itself in icy wind. Each creature within 10 feet of the sazakan must make a {@dc 15} Strength saving throw. On a failure, a creature takes 28 ({@damage 8d6}) cold damage, and is pushed up to 15 feet away from the sazakan and knocked {@condition prone}. On a success, a creature takes half the damage and isn't pushed or knocked {@condition prone}. If the saving throw fails by 5 or more, the creature is also {@condition restrained} as its limbs become encased in ice. A creature, including the encased creature, can break the encased creature free by succeeding on a {@dc 15} Strength check. The encased creature is also freed if it takes fire damage.

trait.name: Flesh-Eating Aura
entries: When a creature that doesn't have all of its hp starts its turn within 10 feet of the scarab, the creature takes 2 ({@damage 1d4}) necrotic damage. In addition, any magical healing within 10 feet of the scarab is halved.

trait.name: Silent Steps
entries: No sound emanates from the ruin scarab, whether moving, attack, or ripping into a corpse. It has advantage on Dexterity ({@skill Stealth}) checks, and each creature within 5 feet of the scarab is {@condition deafened}.

trait.name: Undead Nature
entries: The ruin scarab doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

trait.name: Unstoppable
entries: Moving through difficult terrain doesn't cost the ruin scarab extra movement, and its speed can't be reduced.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The ruin scarab makes two Bite attacks. It can replace one attack with a use of Gut Rip.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}14 ({@damage 2d10 + 3}) slashing damage plus 5 ({@damage 2d4}) necrotic damage, and the target must make a {@dc 14} Strength saving throw. On a failure, the target is knocked {@condition prone} or pushed 5 feet away, the scarab's choice.

action.name: Gut Rip
entries: The ruin scarab tears into one {@condition prone} creature within 5 feet of it. The target must make a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw. On a failure, the target takes 11 ({@damage 2d10}) slashing damage and 5 ({@damage 2d4}) necrotic damage and is {@condition incapacitated} for 1 minute. On a success, the target takes half the damage and isn't {@condition incapacitated}. An {@condition incapacitated} creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

reaction.name: Relentless Pursuit
entries: When a creature within 10 feet of the ruin scarab moves away from it, the scarab can move up to half its speed toward that creature.
The large beetle is bone white and moves in eerie silence, carving into a pile of corpses with incredible speed.
Ruin scarabs are undead preparers of the dead, stripping meat from bones with cleaver-like mandibles and sorting of dead matter for their masters.

entries.name: Undead Pets
entries: These undead beetles were created by lords of undeath with just enough intelligence to be trainable. They butcher corpses with ease and determination, they clean the bones, and they sort and store the various vital bits for later use. The scarabs make fine guards, and every so often, they employ both sets of skills simultaneously when unwanted intruders stop by. They are commonly found roaming important mausoleums and necropolises as guards and cleaners, and they serve as guards deterrents in the demesne of undead lords.

entries.name: Rare Parts Retrieval
entries: Occasionally, a necromancer needs a very specific component for a ritual, or for a fine supper—maybe an aasimar spleen, a {@creature basilisk} eye, a certain drake's wing, or a giant oyster's pearl. Whatever the need, ruin scarabs make excellent retrievers, going straight to the source for the freshest of specimens.

trait.name: Discordant Drone
entries: Creatures within 15 feet of the suncatcher scarab can't hear each other's spoken words and can't cast spells with verbal components.

trait.name: Siege Monster
entries: The suncatcher scarab deals double damage to objects and structures.

trait.name: Unstoppable
entries: Moving through difficult terrain doesn't cost the suncatcher scarab extra movement, and its speed can't be reduced.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The suncatcher scarab makes three Bite attacks.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}14 ({@damage 2d8 + 5}) piercing damage plus 7 ({@damage 2d6}) poison damage, and the target must succeed on a {@dc 16} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition poisoned} until the end of its next turn.

action.name: Burrowing Burst
entries: If the suncatcher scarab burrows at least 20 feet as part of its movement, it can use this action to emerge in a space that contains one or more other creatures. Each of those creatures and each creature within 10 of the scarab's space must make a {@dc 16} Dexterity saving throw. On a failure, a creature takes 27 ({@damage 6d8}) bludgeoning damage and is knocked {@condition prone}. On a success, a creature takes half the damage and is pushed up to 10 feet out of the scarab's space into an unoccupied space of the creature's choice. If no unoccupied space is within range, the creature instead falls {@condition prone} in the scarab's space. The area within 10 feet of the scarab's space then becomes difficult terrain.

action.name: Wing Beat {@recharge 5}
entries: The suncatcher scarab rapidly beats its wings, releasing sound or light in a 60-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a {@dc 16} Constitution saving throw. The effect depends on if the elytra is closed or open:

items.name: Closed Elytra.
items.entry: On a failed save, a creature takes 35 ({@damage 10d6}) thunder damage, is pushed up to 15 feet away from the scarab, and is knocked {@condition prone}. On a successful one, a creature takes half the damage and isn't pushed or knocked {@condition prone}.

items.name: Open Elytra.
items.entry: On a failed save, a creature takes 35 ({@damage 10d6}) radiant damage and is {@condition blinded} until the end of its next turn. On a successful one, a creature takes half the damage and isn't {@condition blinded}.

entries: The immense scarab is a radiant gold and green. As its elytra open, colorful wings unfurl, and a loud droning fills the air.
The suncatcher scarab gets its name from the stained-glass pattern on its wings, which cast colorful shadows when it flies overhead. Unfortunately, such shadows often presage destruction.

entries.name: Product of Godly Intervention
entries: This massive insect is a relic of a bygone age, though details are scant. Some believe it was once the avatar of a god, others say it was created to end a now dead civilization, and some societies claim it helped their ancestors triumph in an all-but-forgotten war. Now, however, the suncatcher scarab is a simple, if large, insect.

entries.name: Destructive Force
entries: A suncatcher scarab is usually remains underground, tending its boulder-sized eggs or slumbering for decades at a time. However, hunger or natural disasters such as an earthquake can disturb it, making it burrow for the surface. Once exposed to the sun, the scarab goes on a rampage, destroying anything in its path and devouring just about anything to sate its omnivorous hunger. If not stopped, the beast eventually tires and returns to its underground lair, where it remains for decades before returning to the surface.

trait.name: Perfect Landing
entries: A scarsupial doesn't take damage from falling and is never knocked {@condition prone} from falling.

trait.name: Vertical Pounce
entries: If the scarsupial moves vertically, such as by falling from a tree, 10 feet towards a creature and then hits with a claw attack on the same turn, the target must succeed on a {@dc 13} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}. If the target is knocked {@condition prone}, the scarsupial can make a bite attack as a bonus action.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The scarsupial makes one Bite attack and one Claw attack.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}8 ({@damage 2d4 + 3}) piercing damage.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}10 ({@damage 2d6 + 3}) slashing damage.

bonus.name: Scrabble
entries: The scarsupial takes the {@action Dash} or {@action Disengage} action.

trait.name: Day Hunter
entries: When the scorchrunner jackal makes an attack roll while in sunlight, it can roll a {@dice d4} and add the number rolled to the attack roll.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The jackal makes two Bite or Flame Ray attacks.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) piercing damage.

action.name: Flame Ray
entries: {@atk rs} {@hit 4} to hit, range 120 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d8 + 2}) fire damage. If the jackal hits a creature with Flame Ray, the jackal gains half-cover against all attacks that originate more than 30 feet away from it until the start of its next turn.

bonus.name: Daylight Skirmish
entries: While in sunlight, the jackal takes the {@action Dash} or {@action Dodge} action.

trait.name: Elemental Nature
entries: The sewer weird doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

trait.name: Flammable Fumes
entries: If the sewer weird takes fire damage it erupts in a gout of flame. The weird immediately takes 5 ({@damage 2d4}) thunder damage, and each creature within 10 feet of the weird must succeed on a {@dc 15} Dexterity saving throw or take 3 ({@damage 1d6}) thunder damage and 7 ({@damage 2d6}) fire damage.

trait.name: Water Form
entries: The sewer weird can enter a hostile creature's space and stop there. It can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide without squeezing.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The sewer weird makes three Slam attacks.

action.name: Slam
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}13 ({@damage 2d8 + 4}) bludgeoning damage, and the target must succeed on a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition poisoned} until the end of its next turn.

action.name: Sewer Overflow {@recharge 5}
entries: The sewer weird emits a tide of filth and water from itself in a 15-foot cube. Each creature in this cube must make a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw. On a failure, a creature takes 18 ({@damage 4d8}) bludgeoning damage and 18 ({@damage 4d8}) poison damage and is infected with sewer plague. On a success, a creature takes half as much damage and isn't infected.

trait.name: Creeping Mists
entries: While the shadow lurker isn't in sunlight, a shadowy mist surrounds it. This mist reduces bright light within 60 feet of the shadow lurker to dim light.

trait.name: Shadow Sight
entries: The shadow lurker has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks while in dim light or darkness.

trait.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
entries: While in sunlight, the shadow lurker has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on sight.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The shadow lurker makes two Shadow Strike attacks. It can replace one attack with a use of Shadow Steal.

action.name: Shadow Strike
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 1d8 + 6}) slashing damage and 7 ({@damage 2d6}) cold damage.

action.name: Shadow Steal
entries: The shadow lurker chooses a creature it can see within 30 feet of it and convinces that creature's shadow to leave its owner. The target must succeed on a {@dc 15} Charisma saving throw or be cursed. A sleeping target has disadvantage on this check. While cursed, the target doesn't have a shadow and suffers one level of {@condition exhaustion} that can't be removed until the curse ends. The curse ends only if the target convinces its shadow to rejoin with it by succeeding on a {@dc 15} Charisma ({@skill Persuasion}) check while within 10 feet of its shadow or if the shadow is returned with a {@spell wish} spell.

While the target is cursed, its shadow becomes a {@creature living shade|CCodex} under the shadow lurker's control. Alternatively, the shadow lurker can combine two stolen shadows into a shadow instead. The shadow lurker can have no more than ten living shades or five shadows under its control at one time.

If a cursed creature's shadow is destroyed, it becomes a mundane shadow and moves to within 10 feet of the cursed creature, and the cursed creature has advantage on the check to convince the shadow to rejoin with it. If the shadow lurker dies, all stolen shadows return to their rightful owners, ending the curses.

bonus.name: Shadow's Embrace
entries: While in dim light or darkness, the shadow lurker can take the {@action Hide} action.

resist.note: from nonmagical attacks not made with silvered weapons

trait.name: Devil's Sight
entries: Magical darkness doesn't impede the shetani's {@sense darkvision}.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The shetani has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Necrotic Weapons
entries: Shetani weapon attacks are magical. When the shetani hits with any weapon, the weapon deals an extra {@damage 4d8} necrotic damage (included in the attack).

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The shetani makes three Claw or Necrotic Bolt attacks. It can replace one attack with a use of Spellcasting.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 2d6 + 4}) slashing damage plus 18 ({@damage 4d8}) necrotic damage.

action.name: Necrotic Bolt
entries: {@atk rs} {@hit 10} to hit, range 120 ft., one target. {@h}27 ({@damage 5d8 + 5}) necrotic damage.

action.name: Desiccating Breath {@recharge 5}
entries: The shetani inhales sharply, drawing moisture from surrounding creatures. Each creature that isn't a Construct or Undead within 15 feet of the shetani must make a {@dc 18} Constitution saving throw, taking 54 ({@damage 12d8}) necrotic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. If a creature fails the saving throw by 5 or more, it suffers one level of {@condition exhaustion}.

bonus.name: Change Shape
entries: The shetani transforms into a Large or smaller Beast or Humanoid, or back into its true form, which is a Fiend. Without wings, it loses its flying speed. Its statistics, other than its size and speed, are the same in each form. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying is transformed as desired by the shetani, taking whatever color or shape it deems appropriate. It reverts to its true form if it dies.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The shetani casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save {@dc 18}):

trait.name: Broken Silence
entries: The bell of the silent crier is infused with ancient and powerful magic, ensuring all creatures know the bell's significance. The silent crier's Bell Toll action affects even creatures that are {@condition deafened} or can't otherwise hear the bell's ringing.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The silent crier makes two Slam attacks and uses Bell Toll.

action.name: Slam
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 2d6 + 3}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Bell Toll
entries: The silent crier wracks its body, causing the bell affixed to it to toll, producing one of the following effects. The silent crier can't use the same effect two rounds in a row.

items.name: Concussive Knell.
items.entry: The bell tolls with a crippling chime. Each creature within 20 feet of the silent crier must succeed on a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition stunned} until the end of the silent crier's next turn.

items.name: Crushing Toll.
items.entry: The bell tolls with a thunderous strike. Each creature within 20 feet of the silent crier must make a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw, taking 18 ({@damage 4d8}) thunder damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

items.name: Endless Ringing.
items.entry: The silent crier sways back and forth rapidly, producing an endless, piercing ringing. The silent crier must take a bonus action on its subsequent turns to continue this ringing, and it can end the ringing at any time. While using Endless Ringing, the silent crier can't move or use Bell Toll. When a creature enters a space within 60 feet of the silent crier for the first time on a turn or starts its turn there, the creature must succeed on a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition deafened} and unable to cast spells with verbal components until the start of its next turn.

items.name: Herald of Dread.
items.entry: The silent crier chimes one terror-inducing note. Each creature within 60 feet of the silent crier must succeed on a {@dc 15} Wisdom saving throw or become {@condition frightened} for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a creature's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the creature is immune to the silent crier's Herald of Dread for the next 24 hours.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries: If the sinstar fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Spiny Defense
entries: A creature that touches the sinstar or hits it with a melee attack while within 5 feet of it takes 10 ({@damage 3d6}) piercing damage and, if the target is a Humanoid, it must succeed on a {@dc 19} Constitution saving throw or contract the thrall sickness disease (see the Thrall Sickness trait).

trait.name: Thrall Sickness
entries: A Humanoid infected with this disease manifests symptoms {@dice 1d4} days after infection, which include excessive thirst, increased desire for exposure to sunlight, and the appearance of itchy bumps on the skin. This disease wears down the victim's psyche while slowly transforming its body. Until the disease is cured, at the end of each long rest, the infected creature must make a {@dc 19} Constitution saving throw. On a failure, the creature's Dexterity and Intelligence scores are each reduced by {@dice 1d4}. The reductions last until the infected creature finishes a long rest after the disease is cured. The infected creature dies if the disease reduces its Dexterity or Intelligence score to 0. A Humanoid that dies from this disease transforms into a {@creature star thrall|ToB3} under the complete psychic control of the sinstar that infected it. This otherworldly disease can be removed by the {@spell greater restoration} spell or similar magic.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The sinstar uses Alluring Whispers. It then makes three Spines or Psychic Lash attacks.

action.name: Spines
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}16 ({@damage 4d6 + 2}) piercing damage, and if the target is a Humanoid, it must succeed on a {@dc 19} Constitution saving throw or contract the thrall sickness disease (see the Thrall Sickness trait).

action.name: Psychic Lash
entries: {@atk rs} {@hit 11} to hit, range 120 ft., one target. {@h}18 ({@damage 3d8 + 5}) psychic damage.

action.name: Alluring Whispers
entries: The sinstar telepathically whispers soothing and beckoning words in the minds of all Humanoids within 120 feet of it. Each target must succeed on a {@dc 19} Wisdom saving throw or be {@condition charmed} for 1 minute. While {@condition charmed}, a creature is {@condition incapacitated}, and if it is more than 5 feet away from the sinstar, it must move on its turn toward the sinstar by the most direct route, trying to get within 5 feet of the sinstar and touch it. The creature doesn't avoid {@action opportunity attack||opportunity attacks}, but before moving into damaging terrain, such as lava or a pit, and whenever it takes damage from a source other than the sinstar, the creature can repeat the saving throw. A {@condition charmed} creature can also repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns. If the saving throw is successful, the effect ends on it. A creature that successfully saves is immune to this sinstar's Alluring Whispers for the next 24 hours.

action.name: Slam
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d8 + 3}) bludgeoning damage plus 3 ({@damage 1d6}) piercing damage.

action.name: Shoot Spines {@recharge 5}
entries: The star thrall sprays spines in a burst around itself. Each creature within 15 feet of it must make a {@dc 13} Dexterity saving throw. On a failure, a creature takes 10 ({@damage 3d6}) piercing damage and is {@condition paralyzed} until the end of its next turn. On a success, a creature takes half the damage and isn't {@condition paralyzed}.

legendary.name: Spines
entries: The sinstar makes one Spines attack.

legendary.name: Teleport
entries: The sinstar magically teleports up to 120 feet to an unoccupied space it can see.

legendary.name: Detonate Thrall (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The sinstar orders one of its {@creature star thrall|ToB3|star thralls} to explode. Each creature within 10 feet of the thrall must make a {@dc 19} Dexterity saving throw, taking 10 ({@damage 3d6}) bludgeoning and 7 ({@damage 2d6}) piercing damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

trait.name: Spiny Defense
entries: A creature that touches the star thrall or hits it with a melee attack while within 5 feet of it takes 3 ({@damage 1d6}) piercing damage and must succeed on a {@dc 13} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition paralyzed} until the end of its next turn.

trait.name: Telepathic Bond
entries: While the star thrall is on the same plane of existence as the {@creature sinstar|ToB3} that created it, the star thrall can magically convey what it senses to the {@creature sinstar|ToB3}, and the two can communicate telepathically.

action.name: Slam
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d8 + 3}) bludgeoning damage plus 3 ({@damage 1d6}) piercing damage.

action.name: Shoot Spines {@recharge 5}
entries: The star thrall sprays spines in a burst around itself. Each creature within 15 feet of it must make a {@dc 13} Dexterity saving throw. On a failure, a creature takes 10 ({@damage 3d6}) piercing damage and is {@condition paralyzed} until the end of its next turn. On a success, a creature takes half the damage and isn't {@condition paralyzed}.

entries.name: Body Snatchers
entries: {@creature sinstar|ToB3|Sinstars} spread their influence by transforming humanoid victims into star thralls, their cactuslike servitors and guards. Star thralls are driven by the need to bring more humanoid victims to the {@creature sinstar|ToB3}, and some roam miles away from their {@creature sinstar|ToB3} parent to do so.

trait.name: Distraction
entries: Each creature with an Intelligence of 5 or higher that starts its turn within 5 feet of the slithy tove must succeed on a {@dc 13} Wisdom saving throw or become {@condition incapacitated} until the start of its next turn, as it hears imaginary murmurings and sees movement in its peripheral vision. On a successful saving throw, the creature has advantage on saving throws against the Distraction of all slighty toves for the next 24 hours.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The slithy tove makes two Claw attacks or one Claw attack and one Lick attack.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}12 ({@damage 3d4 + 5}) slashing damage.

action.name: Lick
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 1d8 + 5}) bludgeoning damage, and the target must succeed on a {@dc 13} Strength saving throw or be pulled up to 10 feet toward the slithy tove.

action.name: Musk of Clumsiness {@recharge 5}
entries: The slithy tove discharges musk in a 30-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a C 13 Constitution saving throw. On a failure, a creature takes 10 ({@damage 3d6}) poison damage and is {@condition poisoned} for 1 minute. On a success, a creature takes half the damage and isn't {@condition poisoned}. When a {@condition poisoned} creature moves more than 5 feet on its turn, it must succeed on a {@dc 13} Dexterity saving throw or fall {@condition prone}, stepping in a hole, hitting its head on a branch, tripping over a rock, bumping into an ally, or some other clumsy act. A {@condition poisoned} creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

bonus.name: Hidden Step
entries: The slithy tove magically teleports, along with any equipment it is wearing or carrying, up to 30 feet to an unoccupied space it can see and takes the {@action Hide} action.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The snallygaster has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Regeneration
entries: The snallygaster regains 15 hp at the start of its turn if it has at least 1 hp.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The snallygaster makes one Slimy Tentacles attack and three Talons attacks. If the snallygaster hits one creature with two Talons attacks, the target must succeed on a {@dc 18} Strength saving throw or take 11 ({@damage 2d10}) piercing damage and be knocked {@condition prone}.

action.name: Slimy Tentacles
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 12} to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. {@h}20 ({@damage 3d8 + 7}) bludgeoning damage, and the target is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 18}). Until this grapple ends, the target is {@condition restrained} and takes 18 ({@damage 4d8}) acid damage at the start of each of its turns, and the snallygaster can't use its Slimy Tentacles on another target.

action.name: Talons
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 12} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}20 ({@damage 2d12 + 7}) piercing damage.

action.name: Screech {@recharge 5}
entries: The snallygaster emits a loud squawk like a screeching whistle in a 60-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a {@dc 18} Constitution saving throw. On a failure, a creature takes 49 ({@damage 14d6}) thunder damage and is {@condition stunned} for 1 minute. On a success, a creature takes half the damage and isn't {@condition stunned}. A {@condition stunned} creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

bonus.name: Nimble Flier
entries: The snallygaster takes the {@action Dash} or {@action Disengage} action. It must be flying to use this bonus action.

reaction.name: Parry Spell
entries: If the snallygaster succeeds on a saving throw against a spell of 5th level or lower that targets only the snallygaster, the spell has no effect. If the snallygaster succeeds on the saving throw by 5 or more, the spell is reflected back at the spellcaster, using the slot level, spell save DC, attack bonus, and spellcasting ability of the caster.

monster.name: Snatch Bat
languages: understands Deep Speech and Umbral but can't speak

trait.name: Flyby
entries: The snatch bat doesn't provoke {@action opportunity attack||opportunity attacks} when it flies out of an enemy's reach.

trait.name: Treasure Sense
entries: The snatch bat can pinpoint, by scent, the location of precious metals, gemstones, and jewelry within 60 feet of it and can sense the general direction of such objects within 1 mile of it.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The snatch bat makes three Claw attacks or two Claw attacks and one Pilfering Bite attack.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5. ft., one target. {@h}12 ({@damage 2d6 + 5}) slashing damage.

action.name: Pilfering Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 2d4 + 5}) piercing damage. Instead of dealing damage, the snatch bat can steal one item the target is wearing or carrying, provided the item weighs no more than 10 pounds, isn't a weapon, and isn't wrapped around or firmly attached to the target. For example, a snatch bat could steal a hat or belt pouch but not a creature's shirt or armor. The bat holds the stolen item in its long neck-arm and must regurgitate that item (no action required) before it can make another Pilfering Bite attack.

trait.name: Grassland Camouflage
entries: The sodwose has advantage on Dexterity ({@skill Stealth}) checks made to hide in grassland terrain.

trait.name: Scarecrow
entries: Any creature that starts its turn within 10 feet of the sodwose must succeed on a {@dc 15} Wisdom saving throw or be {@condition frightened} until the end of its next turn. On a successful saving throw, the creature is immune to the sodwose's Scarecrow for the next 24 hours.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The sodwose makes three Grass Whip attacks.

action.name: Grass Whip
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 15 ft., one creature. {@h}12 ({@damage 2d6 + 5}) slashing damage, and the target must succeed on a {@dc 15} Strength saving throw or be pulled up to 10 feet toward the sodwose.

action.name: Entangle (1/Day)
entries: The sodwose compels all plants and roots within 20 feet of a point on the ground it can see within 60 feet of it to grasp and pull at nearby creatures for 1 minute. When a creature enters the area for the first time on a turn or starts its turn there, that creature must succeed on a {@dc 15} Strength saving throw or be {@condition restrained} by grasses and roots. A creature, including the {@condition restrained} creature, can take an action to free the {@condition restrained} creature by succeeding on a {@dc 15} Strength check.

bonus.name: Grass Step
entries: The sodwose teleports, along with any equipment it is wearing or carrying, up to 30 feet to an unoccupied space it can see. The origin and destination spaces must contain grass.

bonus.name: Set Snare
entries: The sodwose creates a snare in a square area it can see within 30 feet of it that is 5 feet on a side and at least half-filled with grass. The first creature to moves into that space within the next 1 minute must succeed on a {@dc 15} Strength saving throw or be {@condition restrained} by grasses. A creature, including the {@condition restrained} creature, can take an action to free the {@condition restrained} creature by succeeding on a {@dc 15} Strength check.
The sodwose can have no more than three snares set at one time. If it sets a fourth snare, the oldest snare ceases to function.

monster.name: Soil Snake
languages: understands the languages of its creator but can't speak

trait.name: Construct Nature
entries: The soil snake doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

trait.name: Grassland Camouflage
entries: The soil snake has advantage on Dexterity ({@skill Stealth}) checks made to hide in grassland terrain.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The soil snake makes one Bite attack and one Tail Whip attack.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}14 ({@damage 2d8 + 5}) piercing damage.

action.name: Tail Whip
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}16 ({@damage 2d10 + 5}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Charging Swallow
entries: The soil snake partially submerges in the ground and slithers forward, scooping up soil and creatures as it goes. The soil snake moves up to 30 feet in a straight line and can move through the space of any Medium or smaller creature. The first time it enters a creature's space during this move, that creature must make a {@dc 14} Dexterity saving throw. On a failure, a creature takes 14 ({@damage 4d6}) bludgeoning damage and is buried, as it is swallowed, bounced through the hollow inside of the soil snake, and deposited back in its space under a pile of soil. On a success, a creature takes half the damage and isn't buried. A buried creature is {@condition restrained} and unable to breathe or stand up. A creature, including the buried creature, can take its action to free the buried creature by succeeding on a {@dc 14} Strength check.

action.name: Soil Blast {@recharge 5}
entries: The soil snake expels soil in a 30-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a {@dc 14} Dexterity saving throw. On a failure, a creature takes 18 ({@damage 4d8}) bludgeoning damage and is knocked {@condition prone}. On a success, a creature takes half the damage and isn't knocked {@condition prone}.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The splinter matron has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Protective Frenzy
entries: For 1 minute after a splinter matron's tree takes damage, she has advantage on attack rolls against any creature that damaged her tree, and when she hits such a creature with her Claw, the Claw deals an extra {@damage 1d8} slashing damage.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The splinter matron makes two Claw or Splinter attacks.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}14 ({@damage 3d6 + 4}) slashing damage plus 7 ({@damage 2d6}) poison damage. If the target is a creature other than an Undead or Construct, it must succeed on a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw or take 4 ({@damage 1d8}) piercing damage at the start of each of its turns as splinters break off from the claws and dig into the wound. Any creature can take an action to remove the splinters with a successful {@dc 14} Wisdom ({@skill Medicine}) check. The splinters fall out of the wound if the target receives magical healing.

action.name: Splinter
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 7} to hit, range 30/120 ft., one target. {@h}22 ({@damage 4d8 + 4}) piercing damage.

action.name: Splinter Spray {@recharge 6}
entries: The splinter matron blasts a spray of splinters in a 15-foot cone. Each creature in the area must make a {@dc 15} Dexterity saving throw. On a failure, a creature takes 45 ({@damage 10d8}) piercing damage and is {@condition blinded} for 1 minute. On a success, a creature takes half the damage and isn't {@condition blinded}. A {@condition blinded} creature can make a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

trait.name: Construct Nature
entries: The stained-glass moth doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

trait.name: False Appearance
entries: While the stained-glass moth remains motionless against a window, wall, or ceiling, it is indistinguishable from an ordinary stained-glass window or artwork.

trait.name: Flyby
entries: The stained-glass moth doesn't provoke {@action opportunity attack||opportunity attacks} when it flies out of an enemy's reach.

trait.name: Immutable Form
entries: The stained-glass moth is immune to any spell or effect that would alter its form.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The stained-glass moth has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The stained-glass moth uses Blessed Wings. It then makes two Wing Slice or Radiant Wing attacks.

action.name: Wing Slice
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) slashing damage.

action.name: Radiant Wing
entries: {@atk rs} {@hit 4} to hit, range 60 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d8 + 2}) radiant damage.

action.name: Blessed Wings
entries: The stained-glass moth marks one creature it can see within 30 feet of it with holy power. If the target is a hostile creature, the next attack roll made against the target before the start of the moth's next turn has advantage. If the target is a friendly creature, it gains a +2 bonus to AC until the start of the moth's next turn.

trait.name: Phrenic Weapons
entries: The breathstealer's weapon attacks are magical. When the breathstealer hits with any weapon, the weapon deals an extra {@damage 3d6} psychic damage (included in the attack).

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The breathstealer makes two Shortsword attacks and one Dagger attack or three Psychic Blast attacks. It can replace one attack with a use of Gasp to Survive, if available.

action.name: Shortsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d6 + 4}) slashing damage plus 10 ({@damage 3d6}) psychic damage.

action.name: Dagger
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d4 + 4}) piercing damage plus 10 ({@damage 3d6}) psychic damage.

action.name: Psychic Blast
entries: {@atk rs} {@hit 5} to hit, range 60 ft., one target. {@h}16 ({@damage 4d6 + 2}) psychic damage. If the target is currently {@quickref suffocating||2} from the breathstealer's Gasp to Survive, the breathstealer can choose to deal 1 psychic damage to the target instead.

action.name: Gasp to Survive {@recharge 4}
entries: The breathstealer chooses a creature it dealt psychic damage to within the last minute. The target must make a {@dc 15} Wisdom saving throw. On a failure, the target takes 14 ({@damage 4d6}) psychic damage and believes it is {@quickref suffocating||2}, including choking and being unable to speak. On a success, the target takes half the damage and doesn't believe it is {@quickref suffocating||2}. At the start of each of the {@quickref suffocating||2} creature's turns, it must make a {@dc 15} Wisdom saving throw. It has disadvantage on this saving throw if it took psychic damage since the start of its prior turn. If it fails three such saving throws before succeeding on three such saving throws, it falls {@condition unconscious} for 1 hour, returns to breathing normally, and stops making this saving throw. On its third successful save, the effect ends for the creature.

bonus.name: Cunning Action
entries: The breathstealer takes the {@action Dash}, {@action Disengage}, or {@action Hide} action.

trait.name: Impenetrable Ego
entries: While the psychophant is conscious and wearing no armor and wielding no shield, it adds its Charisma modifier to its AC (included above) and saving throws. In addition, it has advantage on saving throws against being {@condition charmed} or {@condition frightened}.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The psychophant makes three Psychic Strike attacks. If the psychophant hits one creature with two Psychic Strike attacks, the target must succeed on a {@dc 16} Intelligence saving throw or be {@condition stunned} until the end of its next turn.

action.name: Psychic Strike
entries: {@atk ms,rs} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 60 ft., one target. {@h}18 ({@damage 4d6 + 4}) psychic damage.

action.name: Brain Storm {@recharge 6}
entries: The psychophant lashes out with a brutal manifestation of psychic force, wracking its foes' psyches. Each creature within 30 feet of the psychophant must make a {@dc 16} Intelligence saving throw. On a failure, a creature takes 31 ({@damage 9d6}) psychic damage and is {@condition poisoned} for 1 minute as it suffers a debilitating headache. On a success, a creature takes half the damage and isn't {@condition poisoned}. A {@condition poisoned} creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

bonus.name: Bend the Spoon
entries: The psychophant chooses one nonmagical weapon it can see within 30 feet of it and magically warps the weapon. If the weapon is being worn or carried, the creature wearing or carrying it can prevent the warping by succeeding on a {@dc 16} Wisdom saving throw. A warped weapon deals only half its normal damage on a hit, and a creature wielding a warped weapon has disadvantage on attack rolls with it. A creature can repair a warped weapon with the {@spell mending} spell or by spending a short rest repairing the weapon with the appropriate tools.

reaction.name: Appeal to the Fervent
entries: When a creature the psychophant can see targets it with an attack, the psychophant calls for aid from its followers, switching places with a friendly creature within 5 feet of it. The friendly creature becomes the target of the attack instead.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting (Psionics)
headerEntries: The pyschophant casts one of the following spells, requiring no spell components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save {@dc 16}):

entries: Whether by profane pacts, experiments gone awry, or awoken inner potential, psychophants have expanded their minds far beyond the mundane. Their commanding presences and indomitable personalities coupled with great psychic prowess can influence and control others, completely indifferent to the effect on those individuals. Their magnetic personalities draw followers to their sides, and many psychophants become leaders of cults, thieves' guilds, or other illicit organizations, while others dabble in politics. In battle, they compel others to their defense while they launch mental onslaughts against their foes.

trait.name: Tendril Whip Regrowth
entries: The stargazer has twelve tendrils. If all twelve tendrils are destroyed, it can't use Tendril Whip. Destroyed tendrils regrow when the stargazer finishes a long rest.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The stargazer has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The stargazer makes three Bite or Slam attacks and two Tendril Whip attacks. It can replace one Bite attack with a use of Wing Trap.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}18 ({@damage 3d8 + 5}) piercing damage.

action.name: Slam
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 10 ft., one creature. {@h}15 ({@damage 3d6 + 5}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Tendril Whip
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 20 ft., one creature. {@h}The target is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 16}). Until this grapple ends, the target is {@condition restrained}, and the stargazer can't use the same tendril on another target. A tendril can be attacked and destroyed (AC 10; hp 20; immunity to poison and psychic damage). Destroying a tendril deals no damage to the stargazer.

action.name: Wing Trap
entries: If the stargazer has no creatures trapped, it snaps its wing-like appendages shut, attempting to trap nearby creatures.
